content.original: Developed by Majesty M&M from battle data gathered in engagements with the Word of Blake's patterns of Phoenix Hawk BattleMechs, the Agrotera is a fast, hard-hitting Medium 'Mech packed with some of the most cutting-edge technology available. An XL 300 fusion engine and 240-meter jump capacity give the Agrotera excellent agility for it's weight class, while 9.5 tons of armor keep it reasonably safe against the hits that do land. The Agrotera is no slouch giving hits back, sporting an ERPPC linked to an advanced Actuator Enhancement System, backed by a Medium VSPL. A single normal Medium Pulse Laser and a pair of Small Pulse Lasers round out the Agrotera's arsenal and leave it well equipped to handle virtually any battlefield threat, entirely independent from supply line restrictions. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original:
Designed by Fredonian Industrial Technologies, the Anubis was originally designed to compliment the Osiris BattleMech in use by the Federated Suns. The 5Y variant uses a smaller 210 engine which reduces the top speed to 118km/h. The 5Y uses two LRM-5 launchers for missile support and deployment of Thunder rounds, while each arm carries a Light PPC. This weapons load encourages the pilot to engage in long-range duels. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Designed by Fredonian Industrial Technologies, the Anubis was originally designed to compliment the Osiris BattleMech in use by the Federated Suns. The 5Z variant uses a smaller 210 engine which reduces the top speed to 118km/h. This variant is based on the 5Y and developed in 3124. It removes all the weaponry of the 5Y, replacing it with an ER Medium Laser in each arm, a Streak SRM-4 in the side torsos, and head mounted TAG system allows the Anubis to call for fire support. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Anzu was well-regarded by both MechWarriors and technicians for its reliability; the AMSC found the Anzu to be a good fit for the aggressive combat tactics they had developed since the Jihad. Although the Anzu's maximum ground speed was 64 kph, the Chilton 465 Jump Jets allowed the Anzu to jump up to 120 meters. The Anzu mounted eleven tons of Starshield A Standard Armor with CASE II built in to protect the 'Mech and its pilot from ammunition explosions. The Anzu also used the same life support systems as the Shadow Hawk, already well-proven by the time the Anzu entered service, and the RCA Instatrac Mark X targeting and tracking system allowed the Anzu to simultaneously engage multiple targets while also spotting for indirect fire through the installed TAG system. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The Arctic Wolf II is a Clan Wolf-in-Exile Medium OmniMech that was developed during the Jihad, and finally deployed in 3085. The design is based on the OmniMech variant of the original Arctic Wolf. The original OmniMech version had a number of problems, including technical glitches and a lack of speed. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

The much-maligned 'Mech has been retrofitted to match the configuration of Bauer's personal hero, a Solaris VII duelist named Victor Vandergriff, who died before the onset of the FedCom civil war. content.original: This BattleMaster variant first seen in 3081 is unique to the Capellan Confederation. Equipped with Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite to power it, the traditional weaponry has been replaced with a Light Gauss Rifle and MML-7, supported by a Light PPC and ER Medium Laser in each torso. It also carries three jump jets, allowing it to cover 90 meters at a time. A Light Fusion Engine provides power and increases survivability. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Designed to engage in close range brawls, the 100 ton Berserker debuted in 3056. A 400 rated cXL Engine paired with TSM allows the BRZ-D4 to outrun almost any other heavy or assault grade Mech. A Bombast Laser and 4 Clan ER Medium Lasers make up the Mech’s ranged armament while a colossal 10 ton Hatchet is lethal at close range. Angel ECM and Impact Resistant Armour keep the BRZ-D4 safe as it closes in, 4 Jump Jets provide extra mobility and allow the Berserker to execute lethal DFA attacks; while a head mounted Flamer adds to the Mechs intimidation factor. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
A heavier 55-ton version of the venerable Centurion, the CN10-D was built in 3121 and uses an Endo Steel chassis to save weight on the design while retaining the CN9-A's original ground speed through the use of a 220-rated Light engine. Much like the CN9-D, the 10-D carries an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its primary weapon with an LRM-10 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system, but these are backed up by a Light PPC and an ER Medium Laser. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A post Jihad redesign, the Commando 8S uses an Endo Steel chassis and XL Engine. A pair of Streak SRM-2 launchers are carried in the right arm with a pair of ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. The Streak ammunition is stored in a CASE II protected bay. A Boosted C3 Slave allows the Commando to share targeting data with friendly forces, and a Supercharger allows it to reach speeds of 140km/h in short bursts. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: Marik factories continued to be the driving force behind further improvements to the Crusader. Kallon intermittently experimented with reduced speed and greater jump capacity, but ultimately consolidated the new weapons suite—mating multi-missile and Streak launchers with light PPCs—with the -5M’s movement profile to create the CRD-7M. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: With the -8R Kallon Industries returned to the roots of the Crusader, once again going for long-range firepower instead of the MMLs used in other recent variants. Due to using Light Ferro-Fibrous armor and both an XL engine core and XL gyro the -8R allows the mounting of two LRM-15 launchers, two Streak SRM 6 and twin Machine Guns, and still have enough weight capacity left to increase the total amount of armor to 12 tons. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The CRD-9BR Crusader was an attempt by Bander BattleMechs to take a well-performing melee mech at the Solaris 7 arenas and make it into a production unit. Using an 325 XXL engine and TSM, it is incredibly fast to close up to other 'Mechs before it delivers a debilitating melee attack with its Claws. The variant also has four leg-mounted Medium Lasers and two side torso mounted Medium Pulse Lasers, complimented by a LRM-10 launcher in each arm. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: A co-operation between Brigadier and Bandar BattleMechs, the -9R sports a 325 XXL engine and XL gyro to leave a lot of weight for weapons yet reach very high top speeds. The full armament consists of a LRM-15, a light PPC and a Machine Gun in each arm, and two SRM 6 mounted in the legs. The 3.5 ton of combined ammunition is protected by a CASE II. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
The Cuirass main armament is the Rotary AC/5 carried in the left arm. Identical to the weapon used on the Legionnaire and Blade BattleMechs, this weapon can easily knock smaller opponents right off their feet. Three tons of ammunition keeps the Cuirass fighting for a long time. Unlike the Legionnaire the Cuirass can close with an enemy unit and finish it off with either its ER Medium Laser or (if it needs to cool down) the two ton Sword mounted in the right arm. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

Unlike the Legionnaire the Cuirass can close with an enemy unit and finish it off with either its ER Medium Laser or (if it needs to cool down) the two ton Sword mounted in the right arm. Особенность: Прост в обслуживании Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.02

Лимит приводов рук: Left Lower

content.original:
The Dark Crow is a Clan Snow Raven developed Second Line BattleMech, which was produced only at its Inner Sphere facilities in the Outworlds Alliance after the Jihad. Named after a strange cave-dwelling bird found on Dante, the 'Mech has proven to be a popular design among Second Line troops. This variant of the Dark Crow appears to be a hybrid of the original Dark Crow and the Dark Crow 2, the ER Large Laser, which has been replaced with a standard Heavy Medium Laser and an advanced Targeting Computer, a configuration similar to that found on the Dark Crow 2. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth G is armed with 4 Improved Heavy Medium Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. A Supercharger pushes the Fire Moth to even faster speeds. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
The Deimos was developed by the Snow Raven Clan and the Mech was first introduced during the middle of the 3060s, allegedly on the Kerensky Cluster world of Lum. However, Inner Sphere intelligence agencies stopped hearing rumors about the 'Mech during the Jihad and it faded from memory. In 3085, the Snow Ravens revealed the existence of the Deimos to the Inner Sphere. It is considered as the pride of the Clan making at least one assigned to every touman. The C variants tactical capabilities are expanded thanks to the inclusion of an ECM Suite in the center torso, along with the three Improved Jump Jets split between the side torsos. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Designed for the Republic Armed Forces in 3121, the Doloire is an 80 ton Omnimech designed with a mixture of Clantech and Inner Sphere tech. Designed around a 320 rated Clan XL Engine and an Endo-Composite Structure, the Doloire has 32 tons of pod space, with a pair of Clan ER Medium Lasers hardwired into the Mechs CT. The Doloire DLR-O is armed with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and a Gauss Rifle. All of the weapons are Clantech versions, while 4 extra DHS and an Angel ECM suite round out the variant. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Dragon II is a Heavy BattleMech built by LAW for the armed forces of the Draconis Combine during the post-Jihad era. Built as a successor to the aging Dragon, the 'Mech was designed with Advanced Technology to allow it to handle threats of the new era. The design was phased in as a replacement to the older Dragons, which were nearing the end of their service lives. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
This upgrade of the EMP-7L replaces the basic autocannons with paired LB-X Autocannon/10s reminiscent of the EMP-6A. Two captured Medium Re-engineered Lasers replace the Medium Pulse Lasers, and the ER Large Laser is swapped for a Plasma Rifle fed by two tons of ammunition. The four tons of LB-X munitions in the right torso are protected by CASE. Both the Stealth Armor and Triple Strength Myomer are retained from the 7L. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
This variant was introduced in 3104 after the Victoria War. Protected by nine and a half tons of Light Ferro-Fibrous armor, the most dramatic change is the use of a Torso-Mounted Cockpit to increase pilot survival. This version of the 'Enforcer III carries an LB 10-X in the right arm and an ER PPC in the left arm. Two tons of ammunition are provided and protected by a CASE II system. For anti-infantry work, it carries a Small Pulse Laser. Ground speed and jump capability are identical to those of the standard Enforcer III. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

This variant carries a pair of Improved Heavy Large Lasers in the right arm. These are supplemented by twin Streak SRM-6 launchers in the left arm. Особенность: Устрашающий Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.18

Лимит приводов рук: Omni

content.original: Capable of reaching speeds of 87 km/h with it's MASC activated, the Executioner is a fast 95 ton Clan OmniMech. Powered by a 380 rated XL Engine, the Executioner has 26.5 tons of pod space. The MASC and 4 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis.
content.prevOriginal: Capable of reaching speeds of 87 km/h with it’s MASC activated, the Executioner is a fast 95 ton Clan OmniMech. Powered by a 380 rated XL Engine, the Executioner has 26.5 tons of pod space. The MASC and 4 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis. The Executioner EXE-I is armed with a pair of Improved Heavy Large Lasers for long range combat. For close range combat, the EXE-I has 2 Streak SRM-6’s. Guardian ECM cloaks the Mech in a veil of electronic noise, a Targeting Computer enhances the accuracy of the EXE-I’s weapons and a Supercharger increases the EXE-I’s speed while active. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
Clan Jade Falcon designed the Eyrie to parallel the Cougar, only with slightly less firepower in favor of a more well-rounded combat performance. It was first used in battle on the Lyran world of Zhongshan in 3087. Since then it has been deployed throughout the Clan's Clusters as light 'Mech hunters and fast support. Its distinctive wings, common with later Jade Falcon designs, allow the Eyrie to dissipate heat almost as fast as it gains it. In addition, the Partial Wing adds approximately sixty meters to the Eyrie's 150 meter range. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Sporting two Type 3 Series ATM 3s plus two Series 6a ER Medium Lasers and four General Systems Micro Pulse Lasers, allowing the Eyrie good mobility and armor, as well as great up-close firepower for its size and a minimized ammunition dependence. The Eyrie also includes talons in its legs, allowing it to rip important armor pieces apart while performing Death from Above maneuvers.

content.original:
Manufactured on Coventry for the mercenary market in 3101, possibly a descendant of the -B and almost the polar opposite of the -M variant, the -M2 variant of the Firestarter is an upgrade that is built on a Foundation Ultralight Endo Steel chassis and is armored with seven tons of Durallex Nova standard armor. Eleven Double Heat Sinks attempt to keep the -M2 cool, while a single ER Medium Laser mounted in the head and three Flamers in each arm work to tax those same heat sinks. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

It was designed as a swift cavalry unit capable of keeping up with lighter 'Mechs while also being able to bring the flexibility and firepower of a medium 'Mech. Quirk: Adv. M.A.S.C. Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original:
Intended to cripple and capture enemy units, the C configuration's principal tool in its mission is a TSEMP Cannon found in the left arm. Its offensive weaponry includes a single Snub-Nose PPC and a Light Autocannon/5 found in the other arm. Both arms' lower actuators have been removed to allow the 'Mech the flexibility of flipping its arms. CASE II has been added to the right torso to prevent any ammunition explosion effects from crippling the 'Mech's engine and arm weapons. One additional heat sink is added as well. Quirk: Adv. M.A.S.C. Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. Developed by the Lyran Commonwealth and elements of the former Free Worlds League the Ghost carries an extensive array of electronic warfare equipment into combat. A Beagle Active Probe allows the Ghost to find enemy units, while Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite allows the 'Mech to live up to its name. With excellent land speed and formidable medium-range weaponry, the Ghost is ideal for hunter-killer and heavy raiding missions, especially when paired with Griffins. This variant developed in 3087 replaces the standard weapons with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers, an ER Small Laser, and a single SRM-6. Built around an Endo Steel skeleton, this version uses a Defiance 300 Light Fusion Engine and standard armor with CASE to protect itself. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: The Goshawk II is a Medium BattleMech built by Clan Snow Raven in the mid-3080s. Based on the heavier Vapor Eagle (also known as the Goshawk), it is produced on the Inner Sphere world of Dante. The Goshawk II was designed as a second-line BattleMech for use exclusively by the Ravens.

content.original:
The Grand Summoner is a Heavy Class Clan OmniMech which was first produced by Clan Jade Falcon during the early years of the thirty-second century. Initially produced by the Eagle Craft Group on Erewhon in the Inner Sphere, the Grand Summoner(also known by the Clan as the Grand Summoner) proved to be a highly reliable replacement for the original Thor OmniMech. The design would soon be traded among other Inner Sphere Clans and became popular among their Warrior castes. One of the 'Mech's most noted actions was during Clan Wolf's Trial of Possession for then Clan Diamond Shark's entire Swimmer Khanate’s Beta Aimag. The flotilla’s commanders were able to bid down the Clan Wolf commander to a Cluster’s worth of forces on the world of Feltre. The Grand Summoner's performance in the hands of Diamond Shark MechWarriors in this difficult terrain helped to turn the tide of battle and resulted in winning the Trial. Clan Jade Falcon first produced the Grand Summoner as a distinct symbol of honor. This 'Mech is painted yearly in the parade scheme of a unit chosen by the Clan's Khan as part of tradition of honoring Clusters who had performed services honoring the Clan. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Similar to the original Thor's Prime Configuration, this arrangement of weaponry comes with of pair of side-torso LRM Launchers; large 15-tubed and a smaller 5-tubed model. Found in the Configuration's arms is a LB 10-X Class Autocannon and Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon, found in left and right arm actuators respectively. Also equipped in the Configuration is Five Jump Jets for tactical mobility.

content.original: The heavy missile-laden configuration, the B Config's principal weaponry is a pair of arm mounted 15-tubed LRM Launchers with 3 tons of ammo per launcher in same location. A pair of smaller side torso 5-tubed LRMs, with mix sized Advanced Missile Launchers, 9 and 6 is found in the left torso exclusively. The design's only energy weapons are pair of ER Small Lasers found inside torsos.

content.original: The C Configuration is a Brawler, armed with close-in and hard hitting weaponry which is reminiscent of the original Thor's C Configuration. The Configuration's main gun is a left-torso Ultra Class 20 Autocannon with 3 tons of ammunition split between each of its side torsos. Its other weaponry includes: a pair of arm mounted Large Pulse Lasers, a 4-tubed Streak SRM Launcher, and a Flamer.

content.original: Armed with mainly energy weaponry and a single missile launcher, this configuration again takes a page from the older model's configuration by the same name. In the arms is pair of ER Large Lasers and ER Mediums Lasers tied into a Targeting Computer. The left torso is home of the 15-tubed LRM launcher and its two tons of ammunition. Eight additional Double Heat Sinks and five Jump Jets round out the equipment for this configuration equipment.

content.original: The Grand Summoner shares some similarities to its predecessor, sharing the same size XL Fusion Engine, and physical appearance. What differs from the older design is its Pod Capacity; the Grand Summoner has a 30.5 ton capacity over the older model's 22.5. This increase of capacity comes from the reshuffling of the 'Mech's internal components and dropping the original's permanently-mounted Jump Jets from the design. The Grand Summoner's armor protection is slightly greater than the original, with half a ton more. The Prime Configuration long-range firepower comes from its side-torso-mounted 15-Tubed Long-Range Missile Launcher and pair of arm-mounted Class 5 Ultra Autocannons. Their ammunition is kept where these weapons are housed, with single ton per Autocannon and two tons for the missile launcher. In intermediate and close ranges, the Grand Summoner's full arsenal — including its four Extended Range Medium Lasers — can be brought to bear on a target with a minimum of overheating concerns (except when its Jump Jets are in use).

content.original: This Grand Titan is based on a field refit. It carries a Heavy PPC, two ER Medium Lasers, a single ER Large Laser, two Medium Lasers, and a Small Pulse Laser for anti-infantry work. For close combat it carries a Sword. It also has a 90 meter jump radius. A Heavy Duty Gyro has been Armored, as has the cockpit and all the arm and leg actuators. At the same time, this Grand Titan is equipped with Triple Strength Myomer which allows it to inflict twice as much damage in a physical brawl, as well as reach speeds of 64km/h. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

It also has a 90 meter jump radius. A Heavy Duty Gyro has been Armored, as has the cockpit and all the arm and leg actuators. At the same time, this Grand Titan is equipped with Triple Strength Myomer which allows it to inflict twice as much damage in a physical brawl, as well as reach speeds of 64km/h.

content.original: Taking inspiration from the original Grasshopper 5H, the 8K is a Dark Age redesign of the Grasshopper that reinvents it as a long ranged skirmisher and raider. Armed with 4 LPPC’s and an ER Large Laser, the 8K retains the 5H’s head mounted LRM-5; albeit with the inclusion of CAE II to protect the ammo bay. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The Griffin 3N is a Free Worlds variant designed to improve on the performance of the standard Griffin in almost all aspects of the design. Armed with an ER PPC and an Enhanced LRM-10 with Artemis IV, the Griffin 3N can fight at much longer ranges than would be expected from a standard Griffin. Case II and heavier armour round out the design, making it much more resistant to damage or ammunition explosions. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Built for speed, firepower, and simplicity, the Gyrfalcon became common in Jade Falcon Stars. Its 275-Rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine would help propel the design into the battlefield at 86 kph and at bursts to 108 kph with the help of its MASC. Included in its construction is a Partial Wing, which gives the design the ability to jump further than the normal 150 meters that its Jump Jets would be capable of. In addition to its regular sensors, the engineers would fit a Light Active Probe in the 'Mech's head to help it identify potential enemy targets.While it has been noted that its MechWarriors have it customized for their purposes, this design's original weapons layout consisted of two Series 6b Extended Range Large Lasers and two Type OVR-V LB 2-X ACs mounted in its shortened arms actuators. In addition to these ranged weapons systems, engineers would go on to reinforce the Gyrfalcon's legs. This is a nod to their touman changing its attitude towards the use of physical attacks, namely using Death from Above maneuver. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
Aleksandr Hazen: Arguably the Gyrfalcon’s most famous MechWarrior, he was Galaxy Commander of Zeta Galaxy during the Clan's desant into the Republic of the Sphere in 3134. Piloting his 'Mech which he named the White Lily, he would artfully cut through enemy forces in the Republic until reaching Prefecture IX's Capital of Skye. With his sibkin, Galaxy Commander Malvina Hazen, they would nearly take the world through his methods. However, he would be killed in action with Prefect Tara Campbell at the hands of her Hatchetman signature weapon. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Developed prior to Gray Monday, the Loki Mk II is a Heavy Class OmniMech, which was originally created for the touman of Clan Jade Falcon. Also known as the Hel internally among the Clans, the Loki is an upgraded version of the venerable Hellbringer developed by Clan Hell's Horses in 2926. The new 'Mech differs from its thirtieth century originator by having heavier equipment capacity and improved armor protection but a lower top speed. The 'Mech would become primarily used by Clans Jade Falcon and Hell's Horses in 3145, where the 'Mech would see action during those Clans' invasions of the Inner Sphere powers such as the Republic of the Sphere and Lyran Commonwealth. A noted action that utilized the Loki was during the Jade Falcon's occupation of Sargasso in 3142. The 9th Talon deployed a binary of Lokis to suppress resistance in the city of Salicastrum. The Cluster's Lokis (fitted with B Configurations) used their Long Tom Cannons to blast rebel forces. However, a Nova of Wolf-In-Exiles forces ambushed the binary, and the ensuing battle rendered half the Jade Falcon Lokis destroyed, however the survivors would withdraw temporarily. A Star's worth of survivors from the 9th would return to force a Clan Wolf retreat and prevent the world from falling back into Commonwealth hands. Quirk: Experimental TC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni
content.prevOriginal: Developed prior to Gray Monday, the Loki Mk II is a Heavy Class OmniMech, which was originally created for the touman of Clan Jade Falcon. Also known as the Hel internally among the Clans, the Loki is an upgraded version of the venerable Hellbringer developed by Clan Hell's Horses in 2926. The new 'Mech differs from its thirtieth century originator by having heavier equipment capacity and improved armor protection but a lower top speed. The 'Mech would become primarily used by Clans Jade Falcon and Hell's Horses in 3145, where the 'Mech would see action during those Clans' invasions of the Inner Sphere powers such as the Republic of the Sphere and Lyran Commonwealth. A noted action that utilized the Loki was during the Jade Falcon's occupation of Sargasso in 3142. The 9th Talon deployed a binary of Lokis to suppress resistance in the city of Salicastrum. The Cluster's Lokis (fitted with B Configurations) used their Long Tom Cannons to blast rebel forces. However, a Nova of Wolf-In-Exiles forces ambushed the binary, and the ensuing battle rendered half the Jade Falcon Lokis destroyed, however the survivors would withdraw temporarily. A Star's worth of survivors from the 9th would return to force a Clan Wolf retreat and prevent the world from falling back into Commonwealth hands. Quirk: Experimental TC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Designed to handle armored infantry and combat vehicles, the A Configuration comes with a balance of energy and ballistic weaponry. Each of the Configuration's arms comes with an ER PPC and Medium Pulse Laser, and two Double Heat Sinks. In the right torso are fitted two hard-hitting Improved Heavy Medium Lasers and a pair of AP Gauss Rifles. The left side torso houses a single LB 10-X Class Autocannon, 'Mech's 2 tons of ammunition for the AC, and the single ton of space for AP Gauss Rifles' ammo. An additional Double Heat Sink is found in the center torso and another in the head, along with an additional two in each arm. An Angel ECM is mounted in the right torso for added protection.

The Cannon's three tons of ammunition is found in the right torso with one of the 'Mech's three additional heat sinks.

content.original: The Loki Mk II is noted for its large 40 ton Omni Pod Capacity. This improvement was achieved through reducing the size of the 'Mech's engine to a 260-Rated XL Fusion Engine, installing a Small Cockpit, and the use of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The Prime Configuration of the Loki is geared towards long-range combat. The 'Mech's arms are fitted with a pair of Gauss Rifles and ER Large Lasers. In closer ranges, MechWarriors have a right torso mounted 4-tubed Streak SRM Launcher to add additional firepower where the Gauss Rifles become difficult to aim. The main guns are supplied with 3 tons of ammunition, while the Streak launcher is allotted a single ton. Two additional Double Heat Sinks are fitted to the Prime, to help it cope with the heat of the ER Larges.

A 65 ton design which emphasizes overwhelming firepower over speed or armour, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. Powered by 325 rated Xl Engine, the Hellbringer has 28.5 tons of pod space. The Hellbringer G is armed with an Inner Sphere Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle and an Improved Heavy Large Laser. A trio of ER Small Lasers cover close range combat. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Hornet debuted in 2760 as an urban recon 'Mech, but lack of interest forced the design to be shelved two years later. In 2990, Kallon Industries rediscovered the blueprints and resumed production. The upgraded HNT-171 started production in 3051. The production line was destroyed by the Capellans in 3069. The 'Mech is designed around the concept of being able to swiftly move through an urban environment with relatively heavy armor. Overall, because of its eclectic mix of weapons and relatively slow speed, the Hornet is only somewhat effective when inside of a city. When caught outside an urban environment the 'Mech is hard pressed to defend itself. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Based on the 161, and producted by Coalition Armory Inc. this Hornet variant was produced by using a 100XL engine with ten Compact Heat Sinks. It is protected by three and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor, and uses an Endo Steel chassis. It carries a Small Re-Engineered Laser, Small Laser, and an MML-5 with two tons of ammunition in a CASE protected bay. It is most frequently seen in the service of AFFS and Filtvelt Coalition militias.

content.original:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250 rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro Fibrous armour giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman I is armed with an ER Large Laser and a HAG/20. A Plasma Cannon and an ER Small Pulse Laser provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A long forgotten prototype, once considered for mass production, the HSR-1000-X dosen't exist in any official record. Built in small quanitties for the Republic of the Sphere's Ghost Knights, the 1000-X carries a single Clan produced ER Large Laser in a turret mount on the right torso. Shrouded in a Chameleon Light Poarisation Shield and equipped with a Supercharger, the 1000-X is a lightening fast ghost; perfect for the specific missions, Ghost Knights specalise in. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360 rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-F is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers. Watchdog CEWS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive and scouting capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team's more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvage from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. The first Ion Raptor to enter mainstream production, the ION-4R rolled out of Earthwerks Incorporated's Keystone plant in 3088. Designed as an all round trooper mech, the ION-4R is the first variant to include Jump Jets. Armed with a sextet of Light PPCs and 4 Artemis IV augmented SRM-4s, the 4R is a solid workhorse, suited to both garrison work and frontline duties. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team’s more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvage from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. Designed in collaboration with Sea Fox merchants, the Ion Raptor 5R is a return to VEST’s roots. Each 5R is hand built to order, mostly for select Solaris stables. Designed to succeed in the Arena and on the battlefield, the 5R is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers for ranged combat while 4 IHML’s surprise anyone who closes in. 4 Streak LRM-5’s support the ER Lasers, but can engage targets at close range if required. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. Designed in collaboration with Sea Fox merchants, the Ion Raptor 5R is a return to VEST’s roots. Each 5R is hand built to order, mostly for select Solaris stables. Designed to succeed in the Arena and on the battlefield, the 5R is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers for ranged combat while 4 IHML’s surprise anyone who closes in. 4 Streak LRM-5’s support the ER Lasers, but can engage targets at close range if required.

content.original:
The Jenner has been the stalwart of DCMS light lances for centuries. The JR7-N combines the frame of the -C4 model with more conventional weapons. Heavy ferro-fibrous armor provides nearly maximum protection, and CASE II protects the vulnerable XL engine. The JR7-N improved its scouting and raiding abilities with increased jump range and a Beagle Active Probe. Careful pilots have learned to stagger weapons fire and jumping to avoid overheating. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of fire power and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox I is armed with an ER PPC, an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A Targeting Computer, Supercharger and Modular Armor round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Primarily for sale to Inner Sphere customers, the Hell's Horses marketing ploy of adopting a familiar designation the 'Mech was dubed the Koshi, a decision that did not sit well with many of the more conservative members of the Clan. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-G is armed with a pair of Improved Heavy Large Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. 3 additional DHS, a pair of SRM-2’s and a Supercharger fill the remaining tonnage. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Lineholder was the first BattleMech design to come from Kressly Warworks. The Lineholder is designed around a set of Common Sense Rules for 'Mech design. This approach has produced a 'Mech with a good ground speed and respectable amount of armor and firepower. The 'Mech has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, allowing it to keep up with all but the fastest light and medium 'Mechs. The Lineholder also carries ten tons of armor protection and has fourteen heat sinks. Its mix of off-the-shelf weapons and equipment makes the Lineholder a reliable 'Mech that is easy to repair and is dependable in battle. However, the ultimate selling point for the Lineholder, especially to its target audience of small units and minor nobles, is value and price. In the first year of sales, the Lineholder was historically successful compared with other 55-ton BattleMechs. For minor factions able to afford brand new BattleMechs, the Lineholder has become the garrison machine of choice. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Defiance Industries, producing the Locust under license, decided to be bold and modernize the next design heavily. They used their new -7S as a testbed for their homegrown ClanTech components, including the ER medium laser and XL fusion engine. The latter is a popular salvage item for those who manage to down this variant, which can reach speeds approaching 200 kilometers an hour Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.original:
Bergan Industries has never ceased tinkering with its flagship product. Its latest variant, the -7V, harkens back to the original -1V, easing the transition for the many rookies who still pilot that venerable ’Mech as their trainer. Featuring a significant speed increase, a modestly improved weapons loadout, and a slight boost to its armor, it is best described as “the original, only more so.” Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
With the success of the Mad Cat Mk II design Clan Diamond Shark developed the Mad Cat III as a medium 'Mech to accompany the heavy Mad Cat and assault Mad Cat II. Intended for sale to both Inner Sphere and Clan customers, it has been shunned by the Clans save for the Nova Cats and Exiled Wolves as '...an outrage against everything Nicholas Kerensky stood for and taught us.' However, it has proven popular with the Successor States. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

This Maelstrom variant is equipped with an engine Supercharger to allow it to briefly hit 100km/h. The engine has been increased to allow it to cruise at 58km/h. It carries a Boosted C3 Slave and three Medium X-Pulse Lasers for close-in fighting. It carries a Clan-built Heavy Large Laser in the left arm, and a Clan-built ER PPC in the right arm. Nineteen double heat sinks keep it cool. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: When the Treaty of Taurus was signed, it established the New Colony Region in co-operation between the Magistracy of Canopus and the Taurian Concordat and also created the Colonial Marshals. This variant of the Marshal was introduced during the Dark Age. It carries a TSEMP Cannon, MML-9 with a three ton ammunition bay, two Machine Guns, a Flamer, a Medium Laser, and a Medium Pulse Laser. It is otherwise identical to the original Marshal. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
Designed for direct fire support, the Mauler 4R is a Davion take on the classic Kuritan design. Built around a pair of RAC/5s, the 4X carries 6 tons of ammo. Backing this up is a pair of snub-nose PPCs and Artemis enhanced SRM-6s, allowing the Mauler to cripple or kill enemies seeking to close on the slow mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The second variant of the Merlin produced by the Taurian Concordat, the -1E is an attempt to increase the usefulness of the 'Mech on the battlefield. To increase its short-range firepower, the -1ED drops the Heavy Machine Gun of the -1D and replaces the LRM with an MML. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
content.prevOriginal: Designed as a close range brawler, the Merlin 1E is marketed to smaller periphery states and mercenary commands in the market for a cut price heavy mech. Replacing the traditional PPC with an AC/10 and removing the anti personel weapons, allows for an extra pair of Medium Lasers to be added.With a third less heatsinks than the usual Merlin designs, pilots will need to be careful with their heat or risk a premature ammo explosion. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: Debuting in 3085, the latest generation of the Mongoose incorporates a wide array of new and updated technology. Not designed for head to head combat, this scout still posses a surprisingly nasty bite at close range; perfect for hunting and killing other scout units. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Не предназначенный для боя лицом к лицу, этот разведчик все еще может неприятно удивить на близком расстоянии. Идеально подходит для выслеживания и убийства других разведчиков. Особенность: Прост в управлении Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.98

content.original: A Regulan design built to emulate the Lyran Berzerker, the Neandertal is an 80 ton Battlemech designed around two concepts – speed and close combat. A 400 rated XL Engine paired with TSM helps achieve the first objective, while a massive Hatchet makes the Neanderthal deadly in close quarters. The Neanderthal NTL-AG is armed with a pair of Snub Nose PPC’s augmented by a PPC Capacitor. A trio of Rocket Launchers provide additional punch in close quarters, while Guardian ECM rounds out the mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The Omen is a Clan Assault BattleMech that was created by Clan Snow Raven in the post-Jihad era. Designed as an all-purpose combat unit, the Omen is considered to be slower than the typical late thirty-first century Clan Assault BattleMech. However, its well-rounded weaponry and its 16.5 tons of Standard Armor allows it to be durable in combat. Also to help with its lack of speed, the Omen has been given three Jump Jets, which allow the 'Mech to tactically position itself up to 90 meters in the air and effectively use its weapons. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Designed as a cost effective Assault grade battlemech, the Onager OGR-1 was created by the Jade Falcons to replace captured Inner Sphere mechs used by Garrison troops. A 270 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis allow the mech to carry a mammoth HAG/30. Supporting this are a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a pair of SRM-6’s with 2 Micro Pulse Lasers and a Small Pulse Laser deterring Infantry. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

A 270 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis allow the mech to carry a mammoth HAG/30. Supporting this are a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and a pair of SRM-6’s with 2 Micro Pulse Lasers and a Small Pulse Laser deterring Infantry.

content.original:
The customized Orion IIC piloted by Knight of the Sphere Burton Davion at time of death during the Capellan Crusades removes all weaponry save the ER Large Lasers, swapping the SRM launcher for a Streak LRM-15, the torso mounted-LRM rack for an ATM-3 and the Gauss Rifle for a HAG/20, two tons of ammunition carried for each weapon. Burton's 'Mech used a XL Engine to free up the weight for this weaponry as well four Jump Jets and a Light Active Probe. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Developed in 3139, the OSP-36 was the first non-prototype Advanced Point Defense System-equipped BattleMech introduced by the Republic Armed Forces. To mount a APDS system and a ton of ammo in each arm, the OSP-36 drops the Beagle probe and ER Small Laser entirely, replacing the Gauss Rifle with an ER PPC supported by a Radical Heat Sink System to free up the required weight while allowing the variant to remain combat-effective. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Conceptualised as a long range support platform, the Pendragon was a result of House Davion’s Jihad era MUSE programs. A 95 ton mech, the Pendragon is built around a 380 rated XL Engine and is loosely based on the Templar OmniMech. The Pendragon PDR-1R is the first production model and unlike the original prototype is entirely built with Inner Sphere technology. A pair of Extended Range LRM-15’s provide extreme range fire power, while an ER PPC and a trio of ER Medium Lasers provide closer ranged firepower. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The next generation of the Capellan Confederation's iconic Raven scout BattleMech, the main difference between the Raven II and the original Raven is that this new 'Mech seems to be meant for scout hunting and breaking through enemy lines, as opposed to the latter's fire support role. These new roles are played with the use of a Firmir Hypnos Tight-Stream Electromagnetic Pulse Cannon mounted in the 'Mech's left arm. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A dedicated electronic warfare and scout Mech, the 35 ton Raven has seen continuous service since it entered service in 3024. Powered by a 280 rated XL Engine, the Raven 5L is armoured in Stealth Armour and mounts an Angel ECM. Armed with a Narc Launcher and a TAG for spotting and tagging hostile units, the Raven 5L also mounts a pair of ER Medium Lasers and 2 SRM-2’s for close range combat. Quirk: Improved Jammer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A Garrison Mech constructed by the newly formed Escorpion Imperio in 3086, the 35 ton Reptar is essentially an up-gunned Industrial Mech. Designed to free up more capable machines for the front lines, the Reptar is usually deployed to protect command posts and other key infrastructure; only entering combat in the events of an emergency or enemy attack. Powered by a 175 rated fuel Cell, the Reptar is armed with a ProtoMech AC/8 and a pair of LMG’s. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.78

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

Powered by a 175 rated fuel Cell, the Reptar is armed with a ProtoMech AC/8 and a pair of LMG’s.

content.original:
After the Free Worlds League acquired the Silver Bullet Gauss Rifle technology from House Davion they put out a request for an experimental platform to trial the new weapons on. The RFL-7G was introduced by Kallon Industries in 3085 as their answer, mounting two Silver Bullet Gauss Rifles instead of the Autocannon-based weaponry their other models used. Due to the larger size and need for more ammunition bins the 'Mech could only fit 2 Extended Range Medium Lasers as the complementary armament. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
This variant was produced during the Jihad as a field refit kit but didn't see large usage until the early days of the Republic. Using an Endo Steel chassis, XL Gyro, and XL engine allowed designers to increase the top speed to 97 km/h and include six jump jets. Light Ferro-Fibrous armor protects the 'Mech, while each arm mounts a Light PPC and Snub-Nose PPC. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

Renewing the Mad Cat legend, the Mk IV used some of the most powerful configurations of its grand brother, while also incorporating easier to find and replace components. Clan Sea Fox expected to experience the same success with this model, as it had with previous ones. This specific variant was a prototype non-Omni stolen by Clan Jade Falcon. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Scarecrow is a rare BattleMech that Corean Enterprises produced from their plant on Augusta, although the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns officially disavowed knowledge of the Scarecrow until the 3140s. Incorporating mixed Clan and Inner Sphere technology, the Scarecrow was designed to be very effective at killing its intended target - infantry. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
This variant went by the unfortunate nickname Hobbled Scarecrow - it was an attempt to produce a version of the Scarecrow that could serve more ably in combat against other BattleMechs, although thin armor and limited speed made the Scarecrow a poor choice for such battles even with the revised weapons loadout. The Hobbled Scarecrow lacked the Machine Gun Arrays of the original and the Chameleon Light Polarization Shield, mounting three Medium Lasers instead, one located in each arm and one in the right torso. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Based on the Golden Age Storm Giant, the Scylla is an updated model developed by the Steel Vipers as a second line Battlemech. A 100 ton mech with a 400 rated XL Engine, the Scylla SCY-3 is armed with a LB-20X and a HAG-30. An ER PPC and a Heavy Large Laser give the Scylla a heavier punch at range. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Based on the lighter Shadow Cat OmniMech, the Shadow Cat II is a heavy Clan Jade Falcon fire-support BattleMech. This variant developed in 3089 carries four Streak SRM-6 launchers, supplemented by a single ER Large Laser and ER Medium Laser. This version is more intended for close in fighting rather than the long range fire support of the original. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original:
Taking a cue from Clan Jade Falcon’s Thor II, introduced during the previous decade, Nova Cat scientists removed the original Shadow Cat’s fixed jump jets to free valuable mass. Most of the remaining tonnage was allotted for pod space, enhancing the ’Mech’s flexibility, while the remainder maximized armor coverage to see the Clan’s precious OmniMechs and its warriors home safely. The Shadow Cat III A configuration features only a ER Large Laser in each arm. Mobility has been substantially increased with the retention of the MASC system and the inclusion of eight pod mounted Improved Jump Jets to increase jump ranges 50% over the original Shadow Cat. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Shadow Cat is a heavily-armed and maneuverable medium OmniMech developed by Clan Nova Cat to replace the Ice Ferret in the early 31st century during preparations for Operation Revival. This Dark Age configuration uses two Improved Heavy Large Lasers as its weaponry. To control the heat, seventeen double heat sinks are augmented by two Coolant Pods. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Shrike is outfitted with a powerful Targeting Computer that allows it to bring accurate firepower to bear on the battlefield. It has a hard-hitting armament that gives the 'Mech a powerful sting in combat at most ranges. A Long Bow LRM-10-rack allows pilots to engage enemies at long range, and two Type 9 Ultra Autocannon/5s are effective against even other assault-class 'Mechs. Lastly, two Series 2b ER Large Lasers provide a fairly powerful punch should the other weapon systems deplete their ammunition. The design owes its large weapon capacity to due use to its Endo Steel construction and its large 380-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine. Engineers enhanced the design by adding a Partial Wing, giving the Shrike extra jump capacity as well as additional cooling abilities under normal atmospheric conditions. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Though the Stinger IIC has a relatively low ground speed by Jihad Era standards, it is still fast enough to act as a harasser unit as well as a recon platform. The 180 meter jump capability is also useful, allowing the pilot to get out of tight terrain very quickly. The upgraded armor protection is valued by those warriors used to the older Stinger as well, but this armor is still too light to allow the 'Mech to operate in a stand up fight. Double Heat Sinks keep the Stinger IIC cool. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01
content.prevOriginal: Though the Stinger IIC has a relatively low ground speed by Jihad Era standards, it is still fast enough to act as a harasser unit as well as a recon platform. The 180 meter jump capability is also useful, allowing the pilot to get out of tight terrain very quickly. The upgraded armor protection is valued by those warriors used to the older Stinger as well, but this armor is still too light to allow the 'Mech to operate in a stand up fight. Double Heat Sinks keep the Stinger IIC cool. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05
content.content: Хотя Stinger IIC имеет относительно низкую скорость по стандартам Эры Джихада, он все же достаточно быстр, чтобы использоваться для разведки и преследования. Возможность прыжка на 180 метров также полезна, позволяя пилоту очень быстро выбраться из труднопроходимой местности. Модернизированная броня ценится воинами, которые пилотировали старый Stinger, но эта броня все еще слишком легкая, чтобы позволить меху принимать участие в прямых столкновениях. Double Heat Sink неплохо справляются с охлаждением Stinger IIC. Особенность: Распространенный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.01

Вариант IIC-2 отличается от IIC-1 улучшенными системами слежения за целью и системами электронного противодействия, но установка этих систем несколько ухудшила его скорость и маневренность. Также модель IIC-2 лишилась прыжковых ускорителей.

The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. A configuration introduced in the Republic era, this version carries a Gauss Rifle, SRM-6, and an ER Large Pulse Laser. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: Hey Boss, the clans call these things the Summoner but I've always called em' the Thor. These OmniMechs are a tad light on available pod space for their weight class and those early structural mounts are not compatible with anything else. But with that huge engine and lots of jumpjet hardpoints you will be hard pressed to find many 'Mechs its size that are faster.

content.original:
The Tenshi, ("Angel" in japanese), is an Assault Class OmniMech, which was manufactured during the early thirty-second century for the Draconis Combine's armed forces. A product of House Kurita's hidden efforts to rebuild its decimated 'Mech regiments, the Tenshi was designed to use resources found within the Combine. The Tenshi was first deployed among the ranks of the Ghost Regiments in the early 3100s, its deployment with a less-renowned brigade was part of the DCMS' two-fold effort of testing the 'Mech while also providing a fire-wall to save face should the design prove to be a failure in combat. One of its first deployments was in 3103, when the 1st Ghost conducted a raid on the Ghost Bear Dominionworld of Grumium. The eight Tenshis among the Ghosts' ranks performed well, with most of their numbers returning to the Combine with stolen Clan technology. Among the Tenshi's design features is its durability and having a heavy equipment payload. The designers saw fit to equip the 'Mech with a Compact Gyro and 18.5 tons of Standard Armor. The Tenshi also uses a number of new technologies that had finally entered production in the decades preceding the Jihad. The use of an Endo-Composite internal structure and a Light Fusion Engine granted the design a huge pod capacity of 48 tons. However, this large capacity had come at a price; that price being a slightly lower maximum speed than other comparable designs of the era." Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Tenshi's Primary configuration is equipped mainly with standard technologies that allow the 'Mech to engage an enemy unit at long-range. Its main weapon is an arm-mounted Gauss Rifle which is fed with 3 tons of ammunition. Its other set of long range weaponry consists five Light Particle Projection Cannons, all of which are fitted into the 'Mech's right arm. For a last resort, the 'Mech sports a pair of 10-tubed Rocket Launchers, with one placed in each of its legs. All of the energy weapons are tied to a Targeting Computer for greater accuracy. Among other equipment found in this configuration is a Guardian ECM, providing an electronic screen against enemy attacks, while a Supercharger is fitted into the center torso to help temporarily increase ground speed.

content.original: The A configuration's principle firepower comes from three Large Variable Speed Pulse Lasers, one mounted in each of the arms and in the center torso. Backing up the lasers is a single Apollo FCS-guided 30-tubed Medium-Range Missile Launcher with two tons of CASE II-protected ammunition. To help manage the great amounts of heat generated by the weapons, five additional Double Heat Sinks are added as well as a Coolant Pod.

content.original: Designed to severely cripple or destroy an enemy, the B configuration is equipped with two TSEMP Cannons found in each of its arms. Its other weapons and equipment include: A single right torso-mounted Heavy PPC, a pair of arm-mounted Streak 6-tubed SRM Launchers, and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers. Three Jump Jets help the 'Mech travel difficult terrain, while five Double Heat Sinks keep heat levels fairly manageable.

content.original:
The Thunderbolt IIC is a second-line heavy BattleMech that was originally developed for Clan Jade Falcon in 3085. The design came into existence due to that Clan's need to re-purpose surplus components being produced for their Loki and Thor OmniMech designs. Using one of Olivetti Weaponry's previous Inner Sphere designs, the classic Thunderbolt, they reworked it as a replacement for second-line 'Mechs lost during the Jihad. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
A much tougher BattleMech than its predecessor, the Viking IIC is protected by a massive 31 tons of GC Hardened Slab Armor. This is a dense and tough hardened armor, which while providing considerable protection in combat also slows the 'Mech down. Its lack of speed would make the Viking IIC unpopular with Clan warriors, who prefer swifter machines in combat. The foundation of toughness is also found in its GC Type 2C Endo Steel skeleton and a General Motors 270-Rated Fusion Engine. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

This configuration is meant for engagement at all ranges. In its arms are a pair of Ultra Autocannon/5s for long-range engagements. Backing up the autocannons are four SRM-6s, as well as two Medium Pulse Lasers found in the center torso. The A configuration has two additional Double Heat Sinks to cope with the new heat load of the weapons Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

The most noted feature of the B configuration is the addition of four Jump Jets in the legs, allowing greater flexibility during fire-support missions. Its weaponry and equipment includes a pair of side-torso mounted LRM-20s, arm-mounted ER Large Lasers, and a pair of ER Medium Lasers in the center torso. Two additional Double Heat Sinks help in managing heat levels. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
The primary configuration is focused on providing long range fire support. Its main weapons are four 20-tube Long-Range Missile Launchers split between the 'Mech's side torsos, with four tons of ammunition supplying the launchers. For closer engagements it has six Extended Range Medium Lasers divided in pairs and allocated to each of the 'Mech's arms and its center torso. Twelve Double Heat Sinks struggle to keep up with the massive heat output of this configuration. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. Introduced in the Dark Age era, this version carries four ER Large Lasers supported by twin SRM-6 launchers. A single ER Small Laser rounds out the armament. It's powered by a standard fusion engine, but uses an Endo Steel frame and Ferro-fibrous armor. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

An XXL Fusion Engine provides enough power for a top speed of 86km/h. The RACs are backed up by a pair of ER Medium Lasers and ER Small Lasers, and the missile launcher is now an LRM-10. In addition to the Ferro-Fibrous Armor, an ECM Suite in the head disrupts enemy electronics. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Fusion Core, the Warhammer WHM-8D2 is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers and a Thunderbolt-5 deter opponents from closing in. CASE and a Boosted C3 Slave round out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The Wasp is a popular Light Mech designed primarily for Reconnaissance work. The Wasp 3X is a failed prototype of a Dark Age redesign. Armed with a pair of Thunderbolt 5’s and a Medium Laser, the 3X relies on a combination of an XL Engine, XL Gyro, Ferro Fibrous, Endo Steel and Compact Heat Sinks; in order to mount the heavy weapons payload. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

content.original: Standing at ten meters tall, the Watchman is a 'Mech that was born of necessity. The idea for the design came when the bulk of the AFFS was moved to the Clan front. Because this seriously undermined the ability of the Federated Suns to keep its borders secure, the Watchman was designed to be distributed to militia units within the border marches to bulk up their strength. In its own right the Watchman is a durable and reliable 'Mech that is built with off the shelf components and is very easy to repair. The 'Mech is armored with eight and a half tons of standard armor, has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. This, combined with the Watchman's varied arsenal, makes it an excellent trooper or trainer. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: The WVR-9R, built on a former RetroTech factory line after the Jihad ended, could not be more traditional if it tried. It is a licensed derivative of a Thermopolis export model geared towards revamping older ’Mechs. This variant utilizes a large autocannon for maximal close-range firepower as most earlier variants did. After decades of production, the WVR-9R can rightfully be called an 'old mainstay'. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
Manufactured on Kwangjong-ni by Defiance, the Zeus X was both a poster child for excellence in production engineering and an innovative high-technology platform. The -X3 carried four ER Medium Lasers in the right arm and an ER PPC in the left arm, connected to a Targeting Computer. The true uniqueness of the design came in its use of Improved Jump Jets: the -X3 could jump up to 240 meters, which rivaled the jumping capability of any light 'Mech. This combination of heavy armor, speed and firepower made -the X3 the nightmare of any light or medium 'Mech and could outmaneuver any heavy or assault 'Mech. The -X3 mounted seventeen double heat sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Developed by Majesty M&M from battle data gathered in engagements with the Word of Blake's patterns of Phoenix Hawk BattleMechs, the Agrotera is a fast, hard-hitting Medium 'Mech packed with some of the most cutting-edge technology available. An XL 300 fusion engine and 240-meter jump capacity give the Agrotera excellent agility for it's weight class, while 9.5 tons of armor keep it reasonably safe against the hits that do land. The Agrotera is no slouch giving hits back, sporting an ERPPC linked to an advanced Actuator Enhancement System, backed by a Medium VSPL. A single normal Medium Pulse Laser and a pair of Small Pulse Lasers round out the Agrotera's arsenal and leave it well equipped to handle virtually any battlefield threat, entirely independent from supply line restrictions. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

A single normal Medium Pulse Laser and a pair of Small Pulse Lasers round out the Agrotera's arsenal and leave it well equipped to handle virtually any battlefield threat, entirely independent from supply line restrictions. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02
content.content: Developed by Majesty M&M from battle data gathered in engagements with the Word of Blake's patterns of Phoenix Hawk BattleMechs, the Agrotera is a fast, hard-hitting Medium 'Mech packed with some of the most cutting-edge technology available. An XL 300 fusion engine and 240-meter jump capacity give the Agrotera excellent agility for it's weight class, while 9.5 tons of armor keep it reasonably safe against the hits that do land. The Agrotera is no slouch giving hits back, sporting an ERPPC linked to an advanced Actuator Enhancement System, backed by a Medium VSPL. A single normal Medium Pulse Laser and a pair of Small Pulse Lasers round out the Agrotera's arsenal and leave it well equipped to handle virtually any battlefield threat, entirely independent from supply line restrictions. Особенность: Шустрый Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.02

content.original:
Designed by Fredonian Industrial Technologies, the Anubis was originally designed to compliment the Osiris BattleMech in use by the Federated Suns. The 5Y variant uses a smaller 210 engine which reduces the top speed to 118km/h. The 5Y uses two LRM-5 launchers for missile support and deployment of Thunder rounds, while each arm carries a Light PPC. This weapons load encourages the pilot to engage in long-range duels. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

content.original:
The Anzu was well-regarded by both MechWarriors and technicians for its reliability; the AMSC found the Anzu to be a good fit for the aggressive combat tactics they had developed since the Jihad. Although the Anzu's maximum ground speed was 64 kph, the Chilton 465 Jump Jets allowed the Anzu to jump up to 120 meters. The Anzu mounted eleven tons of Starshield A Standard Armor with CASE II built in to protect the 'Mech and its pilot from ammunition explosions. The Anzu also used the same life support systems as the Shadow Hawk, already well-proven by the time the Anzu entered service, and the RCA Instatrac Mark X targeting and tracking system allowed the Anzu to simultaneously engage multiple targets while also spotting for indirect fire through the installed TAG system. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Equipped with Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite to power it, the traditional weaponry has been replaced with a Light Gauss Rifle and MML-7, supported by a Light PPC and ER Medium Laser in each torso. It also carries three jump jets, allowing it to cover 90 meters at a time. A Light Fusion Engine provides power and increases survivability. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Designed to engage in close range brawls, the 100 ton Berserker debuted in 3056. A 400 rated cXL Engine paired with TSM allows the BRZ-D4 to outrun almost any other heavy or assault grade Mech. A Bombast Laser and 4 Clan ER Medium Lasers make up the Mech’s ranged armament while a colossal 10 ton Hatchet is lethal at close range. Angel ECM and Impact Resistant Armour keep the BRZ-D4 safe as it closes in, 4 Jump Jets provide extra mobility and allow the Berserker to execute lethal DFA attacks; while a head mounted Flamer adds to the Mechs intimidation factor. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A post Jihad redesign, the Commando 8S uses an Endo Steel chassis and XL Engine. A pair of Streak SRM-2 launchers are carried in the right arm with a pair of ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. The Streak ammunition is stored in a CASE II protected bay. A Boosted C3 Slave allows the Commando to share targeting data with friendly forces, and a Supercharger allows it to reach speeds of 140km/h in short bursts. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: The Crusader was initially designed as a close combat BattleMech for the Star League Defense Force. Captialising on this many factions painted up the R line and made them into Gladiatorial fighters. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: Marik factories continued to be the driving force behind further improvements to the Crusader. Kallon intermittently experimented with reduced speed and greater jump capacity, but ultimately consolidated the new weapons suite—mating multi-missile and Streak launchers with light PPCs—with the -5M’s movement profile to create the CRD-7M. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: With the -8R Kallon Industries returned to the roots of the Crusader, once again going for long-range firepower instead of the MMLs used in other recent variants. Due to using Light Ferro-Fibrous armor and both an XL engine core and XL gyro the -8R allows the mounting of two LRM-15 launchers, two Streak SRM 6 and twin Machine Guns, and still have enough weight capacity left to increase the total amount of armor to 12 tons. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The CRD-9BR Crusader was an attempt by Bander BattleMechs to take a well-performing melee mech at the Solaris 7 arenas and make it into a production unit. Using an 325 XXL engine and TSM, it is incredibly fast to close up to other 'Mechs before it delivers a debilitating melee attack with its Claws. The variant also has four leg-mounted Medium Lasers and two side torso mounted Medium Pulse Lasers, complimented by a LRM-10 launcher in each arm. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

The full armament consists of a LRM-15, a light PPC and a Machine Gun in each arm, and two SRM 6 mounted in the legs. The 3.5 ton of combined ammunition is protected by a CASE II. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
The Cuirass main armament is the Rotary AC/5 carried in the left arm. Identical to the weapon used on the Legionnaire and Blade BattleMechs, this weapon can easily knock smaller opponents right off their feet. Three tons of ammunition keeps the Cuirass fighting for a long time. Unlike the Legionnaire the Cuirass can close with an enemy unit and finish it off with either its ER Medium Laser or (if it needs to cool down) the two ton Sword mounted in the right arm. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The Dark Crow is a Clan Snow Raven developed Second Line BattleMech, which was produced only at its Inner Sphere facilities in the Outworlds Alliance after the Jihad. Named after a strange cave-dwelling bird found on Dante, the 'Mech has proven to be a popular design among Second Line troops. This variant of the Dark Crow appears to be a hybrid of the original Dark Crow and the Dark Crow 2, the ER Large Laser, which has been replaced with a standard Heavy Medium Laser and an advanced Targeting Computer, a configuration similar to that found on the Dark Crow 2. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth G is armed with 4 Improved Heavy Medium Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. A Supercharger pushes the Fire Moth to even faster speeds. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
The Deimos was developed by the Snow Raven Clan and the Mech was first introduced during the middle of the 3060s, allegedly on the Kerensky Cluster world of Lum. However, Inner Sphere intelligence agencies stopped hearing rumors about the 'Mech during the Jihad and it faded from memory. In 3085, the Snow Ravens revealed the existence of the Deimos to the Inner Sphere. It is considered as the pride of the Clan making at least one assigned to every touman. The C variants tactical capabilities are expanded thanks to the inclusion of an ECM Suite in the center torso, along with the three Improved Jump Jets split between the side torsos. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Designed around a 320 rated Clan XL Engine and an Endo-Composite Structure, the Doloire has 32 tons of pod space, with a pair of Clan ER Medium Lasers hardwired into the Mechs CT. The Dragon II is a Heavy BattleMech built by LAW for the armed forces of the Draconis Combine during the post-Jihad era. Built as a successor to the aging Dragon, the 'Mech was designed with Advanced Technology to allow it to handle threats of the new era. The design was phased in as a replacement to the older Dragons, which were nearing the end of their service lives. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
This upgrade of the EMP-7L replaces the basic autocannons with paired LB-X Autocannon/10s reminiscent of the EMP-6A. Two captured Medium Re-engineered Lasers replace the Medium Pulse Lasers, and the ER Large Laser is swapped for a Plasma Rifle fed by two tons of ammunition. The four tons of LB-X munitions in the right torso are protected by CASE. Both the Stealth Armor and Triple Strength Myomer are retained from the 7L. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
This variant was introduced in 3104 after the Victoria War. Protected by nine and a half tons of Light Ferro-Fibrous armor, the most dramatic change is the use of a Torso-Mounted Cockpit to increase pilot survival. This version of the 'Enforcer III carries an LB 10-X in the right arm and an ER PPC in the left arm. Two tons of ammunition are provided and protected by a CASE II system. For anti-infantry work, it carries a Small Pulse Laser. Ground speed and jump capability are identical to those of the standard Enforcer III. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
Clan Jade Falcon designed the Eyrie to parallel the Cougar, only with slightly less firepower in favor of a more well-rounded combat performance. It was first used in battle on the Lyran world of Zhongshan in 3087. Since then it has been deployed throughout the Clan's Clusters as light 'Mech hunters and fast support. Its distinctive wings, common with later Jade Falcon designs, allow the Eyrie to dissipate heat almost as fast as it gains it. In addition, the Partial Wing adds approximately sixty meters to the Eyrie's 150 meter range. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
