Manufactured on Coventry for the mercenary market in 3101, possibly a descendant of the -B and almost the polar opposite of the -M variant, the -M2 variant of the Firestarter is an upgrade that is built on a Foundation Ultralight Endo Steel chassis and is armored with seven tons of Durallex Nova standard armor. Eleven Double Heat Sinks attempt to keep the -M2 cool, while a single ER Medium Laser mounted in the head and three Flamers in each arm work to tax those same heat sinks. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
Intended to cripple and capture enemy units, the C configuration's principal tool in its mission is a TSEMP Cannon found in the left arm. Its offensive weaponry includes a single Snub-Nose PPC and a Light Autocannon/5 found in the other arm. Both arms' lower actuators have been removed to allow the 'Mech the flexibility of flipping its arms. CASE II has been added to the right torso to prevent any ammunition explosion effects from crippling the 'Mech's engine and arm weapons. One additional heat sink is added as well. Quirk: Adv. M.A.S.C. Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. Developed by the Lyran Commonwealth and elements of the former Free Worlds League the Ghost carries an extensive array of electronic warfare equipment into combat. A Beagle Active Probe allows the Ghost to find enemy units, while Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite allows the 'Mech to live up to its name. With excellent land speed and formidable medium-range weaponry, the Ghost is ideal for hunter-killer and heavy raiding missions, especially when paired with Griffins. This variant developed in 3087 replaces the standard weapons with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers, an ER Small Laser, and a single SRM-6. Built around an Endo Steel skeleton, this version uses a Defiance 300 Light Fusion Engine and standard armor with CASE to protect itself. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

A sleek, mobile, and versatile design, the Clan Hellhound was long suspected to be one of the first OmniMechs produced by the Clans. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Goshawk II is a Medium BattleMech built by Clan Snow Raven in the mid-3080s. Based on the heavier Vapor Eagle (also known as the Goshawk), it is produced on the Inner Sphere world of Dante. The Goshawk II was designed as a second-line BattleMech for use exclusively by the Ravens. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The Grand Summoner is a Heavy Class Clan OmniMech which was first produced by Clan Jade Falcon during the early years of the thirty-second century. Initially produced by the Eagle Craft Group on Erewhon in the Inner Sphere, the Grand Summoner(also known by the Clan as the Grand Summoner) proved to be a highly reliable replacement for the original Thor OmniMech. The design would soon be traded among other Inner Sphere Clans and became popular among their Warrior castes. One of the 'Mech's most noted actions was during Clan Wolf's Trial of Possession for then Clan Diamond Shark's entire Swimmer Khanate’s Beta Aimag. The flotilla’s commanders were able to bid down the Clan Wolf commander to a Cluster’s worth of forces on the world of Feltre. The Grand Summoner's performance in the hands of Diamond Shark MechWarriors in this difficult terrain helped to turn the tide of battle and resulted in winning the Trial. Clan Jade Falcon first produced the Grand Summoner as a distinct symbol of honor. This 'Mech is painted yearly in the parade scheme of a unit chosen by the Clan's Khan as part of tradition of honoring Clusters who had performed services honoring the Clan. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: This Grand Titan is based on a field refit. It carries a Heavy PPC, two ER Medium Lasers, a single ER Large Laser, two Medium Lasers, and a Small Pulse Laser for anti-infantry work. For close combat it carries a Sword. It also has a 90 meter jump radius. A Heavy Duty Gyro has been Armored, as has the cockpit and all the arm and leg actuators. At the same time, this Grand Titan is equipped with Triple Strength Myomer which allows it to inflict twice as much damage in a physical brawl, as well as reach speeds of 64km/h. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: Taking inspiration from the original Grasshopper 5H, the 8K is a Dark Age redesign of the Grasshopper that reinvents it as a long ranged skirmisher and raider. Armed with 4 LPPC’s and an ER Large Laser, the 8K retains the 5H’s head mounted LRM-5; albeit with the inclusion of CAE II to protect the ammo bay. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Особенность: Прочный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.1

content.original: The Griffin 3N is a Free Worlds variant designed to improve on the performance of the standard Griffin in almost all aspects of the design. Armed with an ER PPC and an Enhanced LRM-10 with Artemis IV, the Griffin 3N can fight at much longer ranges than would be expected from a standard Griffin. Case II and heavier armour round out the design, making it much more resistant to damage or ammunition explosions. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: This variant of the Griffin was based on the 6S. By dropping one of the ER medium lasers, the Artemis system, and using a Clan-spec LRM-15, engineers found enough room to add a C3 Boosted Slave and a Targeting Computer. CASE II protects the LRM ammunition. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Built for speed, firepower, and simplicity, the Gyrfalcon became common in Jade Falcon Stars. Its 275-Rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine would help propel the design into the battlefield at 86 kph and at bursts to 108 kph with the help of its MASC. Included in its construction is a Partial Wing, which gives the design the ability to jump further than the normal 150 meters that its Jump Jets would be capable of. In addition to its regular sensors, the engineers would fit a Light Active Probe in the 'Mech's head to help it identify potential enemy targets.While it has been noted that its MechWarriors have it customized for their purposes, this design's original weapons layout consisted of two Series 6b Extended Range Large Lasers and two Type OVR-V LB 2-X ACs mounted in its shortened arms actuators. In addition to these ranged weapons systems, engineers would go on to reinforce the Gyrfalcon's legs. This is a nod to their touman changing its attitude towards the use of physical attacks, namely using Death from Above maneuver. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

The second version of the Gyrfalcon would appear in 3112. This version dropped the Reflective Armor of the standard model for Ferro-Fibrous. Using a less advanced armor, this version also drops the Light Active Probe and adds two laser heat sinks. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

Produced with a mix of Inner Sphere and Clan technologies, the fourth variant of the Gyrfalcon carries a pair of TSEMP Cannons in place of the original's Autocannons. Similar to the third variant, this version retains the same level of Ferro armor protection. The design has been equipped with 3 additional Laser Sinks in comparison to the previous three variants. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
Aleksandr Hazen: Arguably the Gyrfalcon’s most famous MechWarrior, he was Galaxy Commander of Zeta Galaxy during the Clan's desant into the Republic of the Sphere in 3134. Piloting his 'Mech which he named the White Lily, he would artfully cut through enemy forces in the Republic until reaching Prefecture IX's Capital of Skye. With his sibkin, Galaxy Commander Malvina Hazen, they would nearly take the world through his methods. However, he would be killed in action with Prefect Tara Campbell at the hands of her Hatchetman signature weapon. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Developed prior to Gray Monday, the Loki Mk II is a Heavy Class OmniMech, which was originally created for the touman of Clan Jade Falcon. Also known as the Hel internally among the Clans, the Loki is an upgraded version of the venerable Hellbringer developed by Clan Hell's Horses in 2926. The new 'Mech differs from its thirtieth century originator by having heavier equipment capacity and improved armor protection but a lower top speed. The 'Mech would become primarily used by Clans Jade Falcon and Hell's Horses in 3145, where the 'Mech would see action during those Clans' invasions of the Inner Sphere powers such as the Republic of the Sphere and Lyran Commonwealth. A noted action that utilized the Loki was during the Jade Falcon's occupation of Sargasso in 3142. The 9th Talon deployed a binary of Lokis to suppress resistance in the city of Salicastrum. The Cluster's Lokis (fitted with B Configurations) used their Long Tom Cannons to blast rebel forces. However, a Nova of Wolf-In-Exiles forces ambushed the binary, and the ensuing battle rendered half the Jade Falcon Lokis destroyed, however the survivors would withdraw temporarily. A Star's worth of survivors from the 9th would return to force a Clan Wolf retreat and prevent the world from falling back into Commonwealth hands. Quirk: Experimental TC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
A 65 ton design which emphasizes overwhelming firepower over speed or armour, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. Powered by 325 rated Xl Engine, the Hellbringer has 28.5 tons of pod space. The Hellbringer G is armed with an Inner Sphere Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle and an Improved Heavy Large Laser. A trio of ER Small Lasers cover close range combat. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
The Hornet debuted in 2760 as an urban recon 'Mech, but lack of interest forced the design to be shelved two years later. In 2990, Kallon Industries rediscovered the blueprints and resumed production. The upgraded HNT-171 started production in 3051. The production line was destroyed by the Capellans in 3069. The 'Mech is designed around the concept of being able to swiftly move through an urban environment with relatively heavy armor. Overall, because of its eclectic mix of weapons and relatively slow speed, the Hornet is only somewhat effective when inside of a city. When caught outside an urban environment the 'Mech is hard pressed to defend itself. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

content.original:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250 rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro Fibrous armour giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman I is armed with an ER Large Laser and a HAG/20. A Plasma Cannon and an ER Small Pulse Laser provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A long forgotten prototype, once considered for mass production, the HSR-1000-X dosen't exist in any official record. Built in small quanitties for the Republic of the Sphere's Ghost Knights, the 1000-X carries a single Clan produced ER Large Laser in a turret mount on the right torso. Shrouded in a Chameleon Light Poarisation Shield and equipped with a Supercharger, the 1000-X is a lightening fast ghost; perfect for the specific missions, Ghost Knights specalise in. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360 rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-F is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers. Watchdog CEWS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive and scouting capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team's more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvage from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. The first Ion Raptor to enter mainstream production, the ION-4R rolled out of Earthwerks Incorporated's Keystone plant in 3088. Designed as an all round trooper mech, the ION-4R is the first variant to include Jump Jets. Armed with a sextet of Light PPCs and 4 Artemis IV augmented SRM-4s, the 4R is a solid workhorse, suited to both garrison work and frontline duties. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team’s more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvage from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. Designed in collaboration with Sea Fox merchants, the Ion Raptor 5R is a return to VEST’s roots. Each 5R is hand built to order, mostly for select Solaris stables. Designed to succeed in the Arena and on the battlefield, the 5R is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers for ranged combat while 4 IHML’s surprise anyone who closes in. 4 Streak LRM-5’s support the ER Lasers, but can engage targets at close range if required. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
The Jenner has been the stalwart of DCMS light lances for centuries. The JR7-N combines the frame of the -C4 model with more conventional weapons. Heavy ferro-fibrous armor provides nearly maximum protection, and CASE II protects the vulnerable XL engine. The JR7-N improved its scouting and raiding abilities with increased jump range and a Beagle Active Probe. Careful pilots have learned to stagger weapons fire and jumping to avoid overheating. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of fire power and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox I is armed with an ER PPC, an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A Targeting Computer, Supercharger and Modular Armor round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-G is armed with a pair of Improved Heavy Large Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. 3 additional DHS, a pair of SRM-2’s and a Supercharger fill the remaining tonnage. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Lineholder was the first BattleMech design to come from Kressly Warworks. The Lineholder is designed around a set of Common Sense Rules for 'Mech design. This approach has produced a 'Mech with a good ground speed and respectable amount of armor and firepower. The 'Mech has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, allowing it to keep up with all but the fastest light and medium 'Mechs. The Lineholder also carries ten tons of armor protection and has fourteen heat sinks. Its mix of off-the-shelf weapons and equipment makes the Lineholder a reliable 'Mech that is easy to repair and is dependable in battle. However, the ultimate selling point for the Lineholder, especially to its target audience of small units and minor nobles, is value and price. In the first year of sales, the Lineholder was historically successful compared with other 55-ton BattleMechs. For minor factions able to afford brand new BattleMechs, the Lineholder has become the garrison machine of choice. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: When the Treaty of Taurus was signed, it established the New Colony Region in co-operation between the Magistracy of Canopus and the Taurian Concordat and also created the Colonial Marshals. This variant of the Marshal was introduced during the Dark Age. It carries a TSEMP Cannon, MML-9 with a three ton ammunition bay, two Machine Guns, a Flamer, a Medium Laser, and a Medium Pulse Laser. It is otherwise identical to the original Marshal. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
Designed for direct fire support, the Mauler 4R is a Davion take on the classic Kuritan design. Built around a pair of RAC/5s, the 4X carries 6 tons of ammo. Backing this up is a pair of snub-nose PPCs and Artemis enhanced SRM-6s, allowing the Mauler to cripple or kill enemies seeking to close on the slow mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

The second variant of the Merlin produced by the Taurian Concordat, the -1E is an attempt to increase the usefulness of the 'Mech on the battlefield. To increase its short-range firepower, the -1ED drops the Heavy Machine Gun of the -1D and replaces the LRM with an MML. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.prevOriginal: Designed as a close range brawler, the Merlin 1E is marketed to smaller periphery states and mercenary commands in the market for a cut price heavy mech. Replacing the traditional PPC with an AC/10 and removing the anti personel weapons, allows for an extra pair of Medium Lasers to be added.With a third less heatsinks than the usual Merlin designs, pilots will need to be careful with their heat or risk a premature ammo explosion. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: Debuting in 3085, the latest generation of the Mongoose incorporates a wide array of new and updated technology. Not designed for head to head combat, this scout still posses a surprisingly nasty bite at close range; perfect for hunting and killing other scout units. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Не предназначенный для боя лицом к лицу, этот разведчик все еще может неприятно удивить на близком расстоянии. Идеально подходит для выслеживания и убийства других разведчиков. Особенность: Прост в управлении Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.98

Armed with 3 ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small Laser, the MON-96 carries a Bloodhound Active Probe in the right torso. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: A Regulan design built to emulate the Lyran Berzerker, the Neandertal is an 80 ton Battlemech designed around two concepts – speed and close combat. A 400 rated XL Engine paired with TSM helps achieve the first objective, while a massive Hatchet makes the Neanderthal deadly in close quarters. The Neanderthal NTL-AG is armed with a pair of Snub Nose PPC’s augmented by a PPC Capacitor. A trio of Rocket Launchers provide additional punch in close quarters, while Guardian ECM rounds out the mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The Omen is a Clan Assault BattleMech that was created by Clan Snow Raven in the post-Jihad era. Designed as an all-purpose combat unit, the Omen is considered to be slower than the typical late thirty-first century Clan Assault BattleMech. However, its well-rounded weaponry and its 16.5 tons of Standard Armor allows it to be durable in combat. Also to help with its lack of speed, the Omen has been given three Jump Jets, which allow the 'Mech to tactically position itself up to 90 meters in the air and effectively use its weapons. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Designed as a cost effective Assault grade battlemech, the Onager OGR-1 was created by the Jade Falcons to replace captured Inner Sphere mechs used by Garrison troops. A 270 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis allow the mech to carry a mammoth HAG/30. Supporting this are a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a pair of SRM-6’s with 2 Micro Pulse Lasers and a Small Pulse Laser deterring Infantry. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original:
Developed in 3139, the OSP-36 was the first non-prototype Advanced Point Defense System-equipped BattleMech introduced by the Republic Armed Forces. To mount a APDS system and a ton of ammo in each arm, the OSP-36 drops the Beagle probe and ER Small Laser entirely, replacing the Gauss Rifle with an ER PPC supported by a Radical Heat Sink System to free up the required weight while allowing the variant to remain combat-effective. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
Conceptualised as a long range support platform, the Pendragon was a result of House Davion’s Jihad era MUSE programs. A 95 ton mech, the Pendragon is built around a 380 rated XL Engine and is loosely based on the Templar OmniMech. The Pendragon PDR-1R is the first production model and unlike the original prototype is entirely built with Inner Sphere technology. A pair of Extended Range LRM-15’s provide extreme range fire power, while an ER PPC and a trio of ER Medium Lasers provide closer ranged firepower. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

A dedicated electronic warfare and scout Mech, the 35 ton Raven has seen continuous service since it entered service in 3024. Powered by a 280 rated XL Engine, the Raven 5L is armoured in Stealth Armour and mounts an Angel ECM. Armed with a Narc Launcher and a TAG for spotting and tagging hostile units, the Raven 5L also mounts a pair of ER Medium Lasers and 2 SRM-2’s for close range combat. Quirk: Improved Jammer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Armed with a Narc Launcher and a TAG for spotting and tagging hostile units, the Raven 5L also mounts a pair of ER Medium Lasers and 2 SRM-2’s for close range combat. Особенность: Improved Jammer Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.05

content.original:
A Garrison Mech constructed by the newly formed Escorpion Imperio in 3086, the 35 ton Reptar is essentially an up-gunned Industrial Mech. Designed to free up more capable machines for the front lines, the Reptar is usually deployed to protect command posts and other key infrastructure; only entering combat in the events of an emergency or enemy attack. Powered by a 175 rated fuel Cell, the Reptar is armed with a ProtoMech AC/8 and a pair of LMG’s. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.78

content.original:
After the Free Worlds League acquired the Silver Bullet Gauss Rifle technology from House Davion they put out a request for an experimental platform to trial the new weapons on. The RFL-7G was introduced by Kallon Industries in 3085 as their answer, mounting two Silver Bullet Gauss Rifles instead of the Autocannon-based weaponry their other models used. Due to the larger size and need for more ammunition bins the 'Mech could only fit 2 Extended Range Medium Lasers as the complementary armament. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Incorporating mixed Clan and Inner Sphere technology, the Scarecrow was designed to be very effective at killing its intended target - infantry. content.original:
This variant went by the unfortunate nickname Hobbled Scarecrow - it was an attempt to produce a version of the Scarecrow that could serve more ably in combat against other BattleMechs, although thin armor and limited speed made the Scarecrow a poor choice for such battles even with the revised weapons loadout. The Hobbled Scarecrow lacked the Machine Gun Arrays of the original and the Chameleon Light Polarization Shield, mounting three Medium Lasers instead, one located in each arm and one in the right torso. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original:
Taking a cue from Clan Jade Falcon’s Thor II, introduced during the previous decade, Nova Cat scientists removed the original Shadow Cat’s fixed jump jets to free valuable mass. Most of the remaining tonnage was allotted for pod space, enhancing the ’Mech’s flexibility, while the remainder maximized armor coverage to see the Clan’s precious OmniMechs and its warriors home safely. The Shadow Cat III A configuration features only a ER Large Laser in each arm. Mobility has been substantially increased with the retention of the MASC system and the inclusion of eight pod mounted Improved Jump Jets to increase jump ranges 50% over the original Shadow Cat. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Shrike is outfitted with a powerful Targeting Computer that allows it to bring accurate firepower to bear on the battlefield. It has a hard-hitting armament that gives the 'Mech a powerful sting in combat at most ranges. A Long Bow LRM-10-rack allows pilots to engage enemies at long range, and two Type 9 Ultra Autocannon/5s are effective against even other assault-class 'Mechs. Lastly, two Series 2b ER Large Lasers provide a fairly powerful punch should the other weapon systems deplete their ammunition. The design owes its large weapon capacity to due use to its Endo Steel construction and its large 380-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine. Engineers enhanced the design by adding a Partial Wing, giving the Shrike extra jump capacity as well as additional cooling abilities under normal atmospheric conditions. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Though the Stinger IIC has a relatively low ground speed by Jihad Era standards, it is still fast enough to act as a harasser unit as well as a recon platform. The 180 meter jump capability is also useful, allowing the pilot to get out of tight terrain very quickly. The upgraded armor protection is valued by those warriors used to the older Stinger as well, but this armor is still too light to allow the 'Mech to operate in a stand up fight. Double Heat Sinks keep the Stinger IIC cool. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

content.original:
The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. A configuration introduced in the Republic era, this version carries a Gauss Rifle, SRM-6, and an ER Large Pulse Laser. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Лимит приводов рук: Omni

content.original:
The Tenshi, ("Angel" in japanese), is an Assault Class OmniMech, which was manufactured during the early thirty-second century for the Draconis Combine's armed forces. A product of House Kurita's hidden efforts to rebuild its decimated 'Mech regiments, the Tenshi was designed to use resources found within the Combine. The Tenshi was first deployed among the ranks of the Ghost Regiments in the early 3100s, its deployment with a less-renowned brigade was part of the DCMS' two-fold effort of testing the 'Mech while also providing a fire-wall to save face should the design prove to be a failure in combat. One of its first deployments was in 3103, when the 1st Ghost conducted a raid on the Ghost Bear Dominionworld of Grumium. The eight Tenshis among the Ghosts' ranks performed well, with most of their numbers returning to the Combine with stolen Clan technology. Among the Tenshi's design features is its durability and having a heavy equipment payload. The designers saw fit to equip the 'Mech with a Compact Gyro and 18.5 tons of Standard Armor. The Tenshi also uses a number of new technologies that had finally entered production in the decades preceding the Jihad. The use of an Endo-Composite internal structure and a Light Fusion Engine granted the design a huge pod capacity of 48 tons. However, this large capacity had come at a price; that price being a slightly lower maximum speed than other comparable designs of the era." Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Thunderbolt IIC is a second-line heavy BattleMech that was originally developed for Clan Jade Falcon in 3085. The design came into existence due to that Clan's need to re-purpose surplus components being produced for their Loki and Thor OmniMech designs. Using one of Olivetti Weaponry's previous Inner Sphere designs, the classic Thunderbolt, they reworked it as a replacement for second-line 'Mechs lost during the Jihad. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
A much tougher BattleMech than its predecessor, the Viking IIC is protected by a massive 31 tons of GC Hardened Slab Armor. This is a dense and tough hardened armor, which while providing considerable protection in combat also slows the 'Mech down. Its lack of speed would make the Viking IIC unpopular with Clan warriors, who prefer swifter machines in combat. The foundation of toughness is also found in its GC Type 2C Endo Steel skeleton and a General Motors 270-Rated Fusion Engine. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original:
The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. Introduced in the Dark Age era, this version carries four ER Large Lasers supported by twin SRM-6 launchers. A single ER Small Laser rounds out the armament. It's powered by a standard fusion engine, but uses an Endo Steel frame and Ferro-fibrous armor. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version drops the ER PPCs and replaces them with experimental Rotary AC/5s. An XXL Fusion Engine provides enough power for a top speed of 86km/h. The RACs are backed up by a pair of ER Medium Lasers and ER Small Lasers, and the missile launcher is now an LRM-10. In addition to the Ferro-Fibrous Armor, an ECM Suite in the head disrupts enemy electronics. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original:
Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Fusion Core, the Warhammer WHM-8D2 is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers and a Thunderbolt-5 deter opponents from closing in. CASE and a Boosted C3 Slave round out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Standing at ten meters tall, the Watchman is a 'Mech that was born of necessity. The idea for the design came when the bulk of the AFFS was moved to the Clan front. Because this seriously undermined the ability of the Federated Suns to keep its borders secure, the Watchman was designed to be distributed to militia units within the border marches to bulk up their strength. In its own right the Watchman is a durable and reliable 'Mech that is built with off the shelf components and is very easy to repair. The 'Mech is armored with eight and a half tons of standard armor, has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. This, combined with the Watchman's varied arsenal, makes it an excellent trooper or trainer. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The WVR-9R, built on a former RetroTech factory line after the Jihad ended, could not be more traditional if it tried. It is a licensed derivative of a Thermopolis export model geared towards revamping older ’Mechs. This variant utilizes a large autocannon for maximal close-range firepower as most earlier variants did. After decades of production, the WVR-9R can rightfully be called an 'old mainstay'. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
Manufactured on Kwangjong-ni by Defiance, the Zeus X was both a poster child for excellence in production engineering and an innovative high-technology platform. The -X3 carried four ER Medium Lasers in the right arm and an ER PPC in the left arm, connected to a Targeting Computer. The true uniqueness of the design came in its use of Improved Jump Jets: the -X3 could jump up to 240 meters, which rivaled the jumping capability of any light 'Mech. This combination of heavy armor, speed and firepower made -the X3 the nightmare of any light or medium 'Mech and could outmaneuver any heavy or assault 'Mech. The -X3 mounted seventeen double heat sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Aeron attack VTOL (BAP) was derived from prototypes created by the Word of Blake at the beginning of the Jihad era. These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. Developed in 3084 as a less-expensive alternative to the base model, this variant is specialized for use in a recon. The standard Targeting Computer is removed and replaced with a Beagle Active Probe and a half-ton cargo to house and deploy remote drones. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 15 Left 85 15 Right 85 15 Rear 75 15 Total 375 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser
content.prevOriginal: A fast unit, the Light VTOL is not designed for protracted combat. Carrying an array of ranged weapons, the Light VTOL is designed to support allied units from range. VTOL: Ignores Terrain, slow in thin atmosphere. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 15 Left 82 15 Right 82 15 Rear 86 15 Total 375 75
content.content: The Aeron attack VTOL (BAP) was derived from prototypes created by the Word of Blake at the beginning of the Jihad era. These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. Developed in 3084 as a less-expensive alternative to the base model, this variant is specialized for use in a recon. The standard Targeting Computer is removed and replaced with a Beagle Active Probe and a half-ton cargo to house and deploy remote drones. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. Броня: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Структура: Structure Значения Б С Перед 115 15 Лево 85 15 Право 85 15 Зад 75 15 Итого 375 75 Особенность: Точное оружие - Laser

content.original: The Aeron attack VTOL (ERLL) was derived from prototypes created by the Word of Blake at the beginning of the Jihad era. These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. The Aeron carries a single Hellion-a III Extended Range Large Laser mounted in the nose. This weapon is aimed with the assistance of a battle-grade Targeting Computer. This allows the VTOL to target enemy units quickly and accurately even while moving at high speed. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 125 15 Left 80 15 Right 80 15 Rear 75 15 Total 375 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: First introduced in 3096, this post-Jihad design was created by Clan Wolf as a cheap anti-aircraft platform. Slow and heavily armored, the Aesir is often set into static positions where its relatively slow speed is not considered a liability. The Aesir mounts a set of four Type Sierra LB-X Autocannon/2s in its turret. With their long range, and cluster munitions, they serve as an effective counter against airborne raiders. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 200 30 Right 200 30 Rear 190 30 Turret 185 30 Total 975 150 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Aithon Assault Transport is a Clan heavy infantry transport first produced by Swedenborg Heavy Industries in 3084 for Clan Hell's Horses. Created as a new design, the Aithon serves as a replacement for the various vehicles that the Clan is no longer able to produce. The Aithon is slow, but it is a well armored design which sports 12.5 tons of advance tech Ferro-Lamellor Armor. In addition to its damage reducing armor, the vehicle's vulnerable traction system is protected with a 10-ton Armored Motive System. One of the vehicle's principal features is its Infantry Bay, which is able to handle upwards to 10 tons worth of troops. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Lamellor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 50 Left 180 50 Right 180 50 Rear 140 50 Turret 170 50 Total 890 250 Quirk: Distracting Can Resupply/Repair

content.original: The Anat Armored Personnel Carrier is an early Dark Age design which was first produced by Clan Hell's Horses in 3092. The Horses wanted a fast vehicle that could handle multiple terrain types. For this reason the vehicle was given a wheeled chassis and Limited Amphibious Equipment. The wheeled chassis can handle more terrain types than a hovercraft, and the amphibious equipment allows it to cross small water obstacles. Protected by three and a half tons of armor, the Anat can transport infantry units into hostile fire with some degree of safety. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 15 Left 80 15 Right 80 15 Rear 65 15 Turret 80 15 Total 435 75 Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Can Resupply/Repair

content.original: The Maxim Mark II transport is produced by Cyclops Inc. of Skye and Scarborough Manufacturers. The vehicle was intended as an upgrade from the original Maxim hover transport. Though Cyclops wanted to build on the long history of the original Maxim and continue to use heavy weapons, Scarborough’s engineers pointed out that by carrying fewer weapons the crew would naturally withdraw from the battlefield before getting into overly dangerous situations. This would keep the Maxim Mk. II in service for a longer time, allowing the Republic Armed Forces to spend more money on battle armor and other equipment. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 170 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 100 25 Turret 100 25 Total 570 125 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: The genesis of the Arrow IV Assault Vehicle or AAV was the battle to liberate Canopus IV during the Jihad, when Naomi Centrella and her forces saw the effectiveness of the Arrow IV-equipped Demolishers deployed by the Red Lancers when fighting against the Blakist Thirty-Fourth Militia Division. Although the AAV carried just the one missile system, the weight savings in comparison to the Demolisher allowed the AAV to carry more armor - thirteen and a half tons of heavy ferro-fibrous armor in total - and defensive weapons, a trait that was used to great effect against those used to fighting against the Demolisher. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 300 40 Left 270 40 Right 270 40 Rear 265 40 Turret 290 40 Total 1395 200 Quirk: Rugged
content.prevOriginal: Long range fire support assets, Artillery vehicles mount the big guns that pound stuff into metallic dust. Mounting large calibre weapons, Artillery excels at killing targets from afar. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 305 40 Left 265 40 Right 265 40 Rear 270 40 Turret 290 40 Total 1395 200

content.original: The Bardiche heavy Strike Tank was intended to be an infantry support vehicle, and while it is reasonably capable in providing that capability, it failed in most other roles simply because it wasn't well-armed enough to compete with main battle tanks of similar weight. To make matters worse, the Bardiche was both too heavy and too costly to be a popular choice for an infantry support vehicle. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Reactive Plating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 35 Left 155 35 Right 155 35 Rear 135 35 Turret 175 35 Total 820 175 Quirk: Off Roader

content.original: The Behemoth II Heavy Tank was designed in 3102 by Aldis Industries.The tank gained a reputation to be feared among MechWarriors during the Victoria War. Among some noted actions using the vehicle, was in 3117, when elements of the 4th Oriente Hussars encountered a platoon of 4 Behemoth II tanks used to help defend the Capellan world of Shuen Wan during a raid. The Capellan defenders utilized the tank's capacities to hold the high deserts plateau where they encountered the Hussars. The tanks proved to be resilient in combat and remained operational throughout the fight, forcing the Hussars to withdraw. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 365 50 Left 280 50 Right 280 50 Rear 190 50 Turret 285 50 Total 1400 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank
content.prevOriginal: A monster of a unit, these heavily armed vehicles are the epitome of the Tank. Line breakers and fire support platforms, these are usually found in the front of an attack. Trading speed or weapons for armor, the Assault Tank is almost impossible to kill. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.content: The Behemoth II Heavy Tank was designed in 3102 by Aldis Industries.The tank gained a reputation to be feared among MechWarriors during the Victoria War. Among some noted actions using the vehicle, was in 3117, when elements of the 4th Oriente Hussars encountered a platoon of 4 Behemoth II tanks used to help defend the Capellan world of Shuen Wan during a raid. The Capellan defenders utilized the tank's capacities to hold the high deserts plateau where they encountered the Hussars. The tanks proved to be resilient in combat and remained operational throughout the fight, forcing the Hussars to withdraw. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: After the Word of Blake was defeated in the Jihad, Maxwell-Pulaski Motors modified the design slightly and produced it for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084.[9] The main differences are the removal of its Blakist features. The infantry bay was reduced to four tons, and the C3i system was replaced by a C3 slave unit. The machine gun ammunition was reduced to half a ton. All these changes increased the pod space available to the RAF Bollas by four and a half tons, but the turret can only mount fifteen tons of equipment. The Stealth Armor was retained, as was the Guardian ECM suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Carnivore Assault Tank is a post-Jihad design produced by Clan Wolf as part their efforts to rebuild their touman. After its introduction, it would be traded to neighboring Clans and even Inner Sphere powers for additional supplies and equipment. The Carnivore was designed with lessons learned from the modern battlefield of the Jihad. A Guardian ECM Suite is meant to handle the Inner Sphere's usage of advanced electronic equipment. Unlike many previous Clan designs it is heavily armored. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: A modern take on the venerable SRM/LRM Carriers, the JES II Strategic Missile Carrier was a common missile based fire support vehicle in use in the early thirty-second century. A model sighted during the Dark Age era in 3088 mounted four Artemis IV enhanced LRM-20 in front with a single Artemis IV enhanced LRM-10 on each flank. It was also clad in Ferro-Fibrous armor. However to make room for all the equipment, the C3 Slave and Guardian ECM were removed, as was much of the armor. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. content.original: The Chalchiuhtotolin is a vehicle produced by Clan Jade Falcon during the post-Jihad era in response to the need for an urban combat vehicle. The vehicle's strange name can be attributed to Clan Merchant Factor Daniel. The tank is powered by a 230-rated Fusion Engine, which is capable of propelling the vehicle up to 86 km/h. The tank's weaponry was designed to be as accurate as possible as a means of minimizing damage to property and civilians when performing its urban enforcement duties. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Challenger Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. The Challenger was a joint effort between Kallon Industries and General Motors; rather than possibly losing out on lucrative contracts trying to outdo one another, the two corporations teamed up to create a main battle tank that could stand up to a BattleMech. The tank was produced on Kirklin, Kathil, and Salem. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 425 45 Left 335 45 Right 335 45 Rear 275 45 Turret 340 45 Total 1710 225 Quirk: Main Battle Tank
content.prevOriginal: The Challenger X Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. Equipped with a 270 rated XL Engine, the Challenger X has a top speed of 54kph, allowing it to keep pace with formations of heavy units. The tank is protected by fourteen tons of  Ferro-Fibrous Armor with an anti-missile system providing additional protection from missiles. The Challenger's primary weaponry includes a turret mounted Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo. For closer range threats, a LB 10-X Autocannon is also turret-mounted with two tons of ammo. An Artemis IV FCS-enhanced LRM-10 provides additional ranged firepower. To combat threats at short range, the Challenger X has a pair of Streak SRM 2 launchers protecting the sides of the tank, two front-mounted Medium Pulse Lasers and a rear-mounted Small Pulse Laser. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 425 45 Left 334 45 Right 334 45 Rear 277 45 Turret 340 45 Total 1710 225

content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. content.original: The DI Multipurpose VTOL was the end result of a design process hampered repeatedly by changing requirements. Defiance had built a prototype when the LCAF changed the requirements. Defiance finally responded by preempting further design changes by submitting their own design for a single multi-role helicopter that met all of the previous requirements. The design originally called for by the LCAF was also produced directly for sale by Defiance; the Gunship variant lacked the infantry compartment, TAG and Beagle Active Probe of the Multipurpose VTOL, instead mounting an MML-7 on the front of the Gunship. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 18 Left 130 18 Right 130 18 Rear 100 18 Turret 15 18 Total 575 90 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: Created by The Republic of the Sphere this variant of the MHI Amphibious APC sacrifices the infantry bay for a larger Light Fusion engine, allowing it to reach a top speed of 96 km/h. It retains the ER Medium Laser and actually increases armament by adding a pair of Light Machine Guns to the turret. The tank is protected by seven and a half tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Angel ECM Suite. The Full Amphibious Equipment is also present. The most deadly feature is the Drone Carrier Control System. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. content.original: The Fulcrum Hover Tank was first brought into production by Cyclops Incorporation of Skye in 3057. The vehicle was initially stationed along the Lyran Alliance's Periphery and Free Worlds League borders, where its low maintenance needs were a boon for worlds that had not seen much of the newest technological advances. The vehicle had continued to perform well during the FedCom Civil War and during the early Jihad. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. content.original: [This version has Guided Arrows] The Hadur Fast Support Vehicle was developed by Clan Hell's Horses and introduced in 3102. Capable of reaching a top speed of 151 km/h, the Hadur can quickly position itself to provide heavy missile artillery support. It performs best when paired with forward scouts like the Asshur scout. The crew is protected by six tons of standard plate armor. The primary weapon of the Hadur is the Class 16 Arrow IV launcher. This massive weapon provides missile artillery support to friendly forces. However, unlike the Naga OmniMech, the Hadur has a single twenty round magazine instead of four smaller five round magazines. This means that switching ammunition types is a problem for Hadur crews. To remedy this, the Horses typically load the magazine with homing Arrow IV rounds. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Armor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 95 25 Total 505 125 Quirk: Improved Sensors

Основным оружием является пусковая установка класса 16 Arrow IV. Это массивное орудие обеспечивает ракетно-артиллерийскую поддержку дружественных сил. content.original: This 3087 variant carries a BattleMech Taser and LB 10-X in the turret. A pair of medium lasers and an ER Small Laser cover the front of the tank. When the Federated Commonwealth was looking for OmniVehicle designs, StarCorps Industries quickly gathered a design team and released a prototype in record time. Officially it fulfilled all requirements, but unofficially StarCorps Industries had greased all the right palms. With every version able to deliver an awesome amount of firepower while being extremely fast for a heavy tank, the Manteuffel is a serious tank to consider. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Manticore II updated the venerable Manticore tank with advanced capabilities and a brand new tactical niche as an amphibious vehicle. Few tanks of similar power can match the Manticore II’s mobility in wet terrain. The unit is best employed at long range, emerging from a swamp or river to provide highly accurate support fire from an unexpected quarter. It has the technical capabilities to serve in a similar role as the Manticore, but its expense makes this a questionable use of a specialist machine. Slower than the Medium Tank, but possessing heavier armor and fire power, the Heavy Tank is a fearsome combatant. Trading speed or weapons for armor, the Heavy Tank can soak up a surprisingly heavy level of fire power. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Amphibious Hull Values A S Front 265 35 Left 200 35 Right 200 35 Rear 120 35 Turret 245 35 Total 1030 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Marksman M1 Tank series first began field trials in 3088 for the Republic of the Sphere on Terra. The tank shares a name with the ancient SLDF Marksman Artillery Vehicle, a fact the RAF anticipates being able to exploit against opponents. Unlike the older vehicle, this vehicle was created as a main battle tank for the Republic of the Sphere. All of the vehicle's weaponry is mounted on the tank's turret. The tank's long range armament consists of its M-7 Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammunition and two MRM10 packs with a ton of ammunition. For short-range weaponry the vehicle has two Streak SRM4s with a ton of ammo, and two SRM6s with a ton of ammo. For use against infantry, it has four Bulldog miniguns with a half ton of ammunition. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 310 50 Left 205 50 Right 205 50 Rear 140 50 Turret 170 50 Total 1030 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Marksman Main Battle Tank is a beast of a unit that boasts an impressive amount of armor, and I have no idea how the engineers managed to fit that many weapons in the turret. Boss, this thing should be sufficient to give even assault 'MechWarriors a moment of pause.

content.original: The Marksman M1 Tank series first began field trials in 3088 for the Republic of the Sphere on Terra. The tank shares a name with the ancient SLDF Marksman Artillery Vehicle, a fact the RAF anticipates being able to exploit against opponents. Unlike the older vehicle, this vehicle was created as a main battle tank for the Republic of the Sphere. Developed specifically for the Republic of the Sphere, the M1A is equipped with twin MML-9 launchers and a quartet of ER Medium Lasers instead of the SRM and MRM systems. A Light Fusion Engine provides power, while fifteen tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor and CASE protect the crew. The remaining weapons remain the same as the M1. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: A Michaelson's Heavy Industries competitor to the aging Partisan and lighter Aesir AA vehicles. The distinctive feature of MHI's offering is the limited amphibious system allowing the unit to cross light water obstacles with ease. Primarily armed with a pair of LBX-10 Autocannons in the turret and a trio of forward-facing Light Machine Guns, this vehicle is a threat to both aircraft and lighter 'Mechs alike. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: The Nacon Armored Scout was created by Clan Jade Falcon to act as a recon unit. Instead of using expensive BattleMechs for recon, this armored scout allows a Falcon commander to find an opponent and direct heavier units into combat. With a top speed of 162 km/h, the Nacon can quickly find an enemy force and disengage. Protection comes from five tons of ferro-fibrous armor, which provides enough protection for quick escapes. However, the rear armor can only withstand a single PPC hit while the front face can withstand more than four PPC hits. This has encouraged some crews to engage heavier forces head on. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 10 Left 110 10 Right 110 10 Rear 60 10 Total 500 40 Quirk: Improved Communications

Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. content.original: Unveiled in 3110 the Partisan AA Vehicle, a lighter take on the original Partisan Air Defense Tank, was meant to be cheaper and faster but still be equally effective in the anti-aircraft role. The Partisan AA Vehicle is armed with dual Defiance Shredder LB 5-X Autocannons mounted in the vehicle's turret. These guns, along with its excellent anti-aircraft equipment, allow the vehicle to engage aircraft, such as VTOLs and other airborne targets. The vehicle's three tons of ammunition is enough to sustain the vehicle in combat. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 70 25 Turret 90 25 Total 480 125 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: A production version of the experimental X model, the vehicle is fitted with a 210 XL fusion engine with a supercharger. Weaponry includes a Medium X-Pulse laser and Streak SRM-6. A C3 Computer greatly improves it's scouting abilities. The Pegasus is a popular recon unit, due to its good speed, decent armor, and respectable firepower. It can be found in almost all militaries, having been introduced in the First Succession War and continuously updated ever since. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: First produced in 3093, the Pixiu Heavy Tank is a vehicle produced for the Capellan Confederation's Armed Forces just after the Jihad. It was designed to supplement the Po II, a short-range fighter, provide covering fire at long ranges. The Pixiu owes its reputation to its speed and the stealth it uses to great effect on the battlefield. The tank includes 11 tons of Ceres Heavy Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 250 35 Left 170 35 Right 170 35 Rear 90 35 Turret 175 35 Total 855 175 Quirk: Nimble

content.original: An extensively remodeled variant developed by the Ceres Metal facility on Menke in 3085, the Ultra Autocannon is replaced with a Luxor Mobile Battery Arrow IV system. While the original Po was intended to be cheap and simple to manufacture and maintain, the modern upgrade traded the Ceres 240 internal combustion engine with a much more expensive but considerably lighter Pitban 240 XL Fusion Engine to allow a great deal increase in firepower. Eleven tons of armor, a modest increase of half a ton, provided average protection for the vehicle's weight. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 230 30 Left 175 30 Right 175 30 Rear 140 30 Turret 175 30 Total 895 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: Originally developed by Vitesse Vehicles of Terra in 2611, the Prowler Multi-Terrain-Vehicle was the most common hostile and exotic environment military-grade exploration vehicles. The Prowler was almost unsurpassed in its niche, the design proving popular enough for Vitesse to halt production and merely license the design to manufacturers across the Inner Sphere and Periphery. While never produced in large numbers, all post–Star League era Successor State militaries maintained a number of the vehicle for combat on their most inhospitable planets. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Environmental Sealing Values A S Front 165 30 Left 120 30 Right 120 30 Rear 90 30 Turret 135 30 Total 630 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: This version of the Rommel removes the standard weaponry and replaces it with weapons that are allegedly easier for newer troops to use and less likely to fall victim to electronic warfare or Anti-Missile systems. The main gun is a Long Tom Artillery Cannon. This weapon can inflict massive amounts of damage on the target and its immediate surroundings and it doesn't require a great gunner. The LRM-5 was replaced by a Thunderbolt 5 launcher to provide more punch. The Rommel tank is a 65-ton armored combat vehicle, specializing in close range fighting and urban combat. Identical to its twin, the Patton, in every way but armament and armor configuration, the Rommel has primarily served with the Lyran Commonwealth and the Lyran Alliance. It is named after Field Marshal Erwin Rommel, a legendary commander of armored and mechanized forces renowned for his exploits during World War II on Terra. The Rommel was designed concurrently with the Patton in the early 3000s, when Defiance Industries decided that an armored combat vehicle capable of replacing 'Mechs was needed. Since 'Mech production was nearly at a standstill, the ability to produce and field armored vehicles became a necessity for every Successor State. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 300 35 Left 195 35 Right 195 35 Rear 165 35 Turret 240 35 Total 1095 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The vehicle's Primary Configuration is designed for both reconnaissance and electronic warfare. Mounted in its Pod space for this role is an Angel ECM Suite and a Bloodhound Probe. The vehicle's speed is increased thanks to the addition of a supercharger, allowing it to reach speeds upwards of 220 km/h. The Scapha's firepower comes from a pair of turret mounted Light PPCs guided by a Targeting Computer. The Scapha Hovertank is a thirty-second century Hover OmniVehicle which was originally exclusively produced for the Armed Forces of the Republic of the Sphere. Built by Grumman Industries on Terra in 3123, the Scapha was designed with the best technologies of its time. It would go on to serve in multiple roles in the RAF due to its flexibility and firepower. The design was highly popular in the service of the RAF well into the fall of most the Republic's Prefectures to invading forces after 3132. While part of many Republic Standing Guard units, the Scapha was noted for delaying the fall of many Republic worlds. Designed as a fast and flexible tank, the Scapha is powered by a Strand 265-rated Extra-Extralight Fusion Engine, giving excess speed. Despite the cost of the engine and its bulkiness, the Scapha has thirteen tons of pod space for weapons and equipment. Protecting its armored hide is 7.5 tons of Grumman CRR Reflective Armor which dampens the damage caused by energy weapons. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 20 Left 100 20 Right 100 20 Rear 100 20 Turret 150 20 Total 600 100 Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Omni Vehicle

content.original: The Schildkröte Line Tank is a Medium sized Combat Vehicle, originally designed for the Lyran Commonwealth's armed forces in 3122. A durable but slow tank, the Schildkröte was not well regarded when it first premiered. Due to this perception of it being too slow for frontline units, the vehicle was distributed among the Commonwealth's lower tier combat formations and planetary militia. However, over time the tank's durability would win over many with its performance in the field. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Scimitar Mk II Hover Combat Vehicle (HCV) is the successor to the original Scimitar. The vehicle has superior speed to the original Scimitar. The new version of the venerable combat vehicle began to appear at the dawn of the thirty-second century. Originally, this upgraded version of the Scimitar served as part of the Republic of the Sphere's Republic Armed Forces, being produced by Scarborough Manufacturers' Al Na'ir. Many of these vehicles were salvaged over the decades after the Jihad, and found their way into warring political militia factions in the Republic of the Sphere by 3132. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. The vehicle began to be produced in 3087 by Brigadier Corporation on Oliver and became highly popular with many of the Inner Sphere nations, which began to adopt Combined Arms doctrine for their militaries. Due to their popularity, they would be among forefront of scout missions, where it’s been known for different factions using these vehicles to clash during this time period. content.original: The Shillelagh Missile Tank is an early thirty-second century Combat Vehicle which was first produced for the Draconis Combine. Originally designed and prototyped during the 2nd Succession War, the vehicle suffered from instability and other technical problems that proved to be insurmountable at the time. Shortly after the Second Combine-Dominion War, the DCMS was in need of an inexpensive replacement vehicle for its militia forces. For this reason, engineers at Buda Imperial Vehicles revived the Shillelagh. Redesigned with inexpensive thirty-second century technology, the tank entered production as part of the Combine's efforts to rebuild its frontline forces by swapping more effective combat vehicle designs taken from the militias and replacing them with vehicles like the Shillelagh. Despite it being redesigned, the vehicle still is haunted by lingering design flaws. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 160 20 Left 120 20 Right 120 20 Rear 75 20 Turret 175 20 Total 650 100 Quirk: Thermal Sight

content.original: The Skulker Wheeled Scout is the much larger cousin of the Swift Wind scout car and originally based on the Heavy APC design. Due to it being larger than any scout car, it can act as a mobile communication outpost. With its advanced sensor suite which is tied to both its communication and targeting systems, it can navigate with only its sensors. While hot environments would normally wreak havoc upon its advanced electronics, the heat sinks from its Medium Laser cool the sensors while the laser is not in use. This allows it to operate in even the hottest environments where other scout vehicles cannot. The Skulker comes with four and a half tons of armor as standard. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 10 Left 100 10 Right 100 10 Rear 90 10 Total 430 40 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: The SM2 Heavy Artillery Vehicle originated as an attempt to adapt to the tactics and nature of warfare in the Inner Sphere by Clan Nova Cat. Manufactured from the Luthien Armor Works plant on Barcella originally, the SM2 was a nondescript vehicle that gave the Nova Cats a mobile midrange artillery support vehicle. While it wasn't ideal, the SM2 was manufactured for some years and was adopted by some of the solahma units, seeing service on the battlefield alongside Elementals or infantry equipped with Void battle armor, as well as Mamono Infantry Fighting Vehicles. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: LAW produced small quantities of a version of the SM2 that replaced the Sniper Artillery Piece with a larger Long Tom Cannon and twenty-five rounds of ammunition[6]. This variant wasn't a huge success; while the extra range and power of the Long Tom Cannon was a definite advantage, the vehicle suffered from severe structural instability. This instability was a result of poorly-placed shock rings, with the powerful recoil of the Cannon causing it to actually rip free of the mountings on occasion. LAW took a pragmatic approach to the problems with this variant: they offered it for sale at a reduced price. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 460 40 Left 375 40 Right 375 40 Rear 300 40 Total 1510 160 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: The Sortek Assault Hover Craft is a thirty-second century combat hovercraft, originally produced by Corean Enterprises for the armed forces of the Federated Suns. Built on New Avalon, Corean Enterprises constructed the craft as a means to repeat its success with its last successful hovercraft, the Musketeer. The Sortek was used by many Armed Forces of the Federated Suns combat units by the 3140s to rebuild their devastated forces. Many AFFS commanders would mistakenly use the Sortek as a main combatant, which would cause heavy casualties due to the Sortek's lack of being able to deliver a killing blow to a heavier opponent. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 25 Left 120 25 Right 120 25 Rear 110 25 Total 525 100 Quirk: Improved Sensors
content.prevOriginal: A jack of all trades, the Medium tank is the generic stereotype of a tank. content.original: The Thang-Ta APC is an inexpensive transport vehicle manufactured on Tiber; the combination of low price and simple construction paved the way for wide adoption throughout the states of the former Free Worlds League and then later after the League was reconstituted. The primary advantages the Thang-Ta enjoyed over older designs was higher speed. The Thang-Ta mounts a pair of ER Small Lasers in a turret. A bare bones infantry compartment completes it's equipment. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 95 5 Left 55 5 Right 55 5 Rear 50 5 Turret 50 5 Total 305 25 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: The largest change is the engine exchange. Instead of a Fusion or Internal Combustion Engine, Maxwell's engineers used a Fuel Cell engine. This engine trade allowed engineers to remove extra fusion engine shielding that was no longer needed. The engineers also used a pair of Sponson Turrets for the secondary weapons instead of the standard turret. Dropping the turret and heavy fusion engine provided the design team with enough room to double the Thumper Artillery's ammunition bay. The standard ER Small Laser was also removed. Secondary weapons on this version are now a single SRM-2 and Machine Gun mounted in each Sponson Turret. For additional protection the Thumper Maxwell employs an Angel ECM Suite and CASE. The Thumper was created by Brooks Incorporated as a cheap knock off of the SLDF's Thor Artillery Vehicle. The vehicle was mass produced and sold to the Successor States from 2735 to 3046. The Thumper mounts it's namesake; the Thumper Artillery piece. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 300 30 Left 240 30 Right 240 30 Rear 175 30 Total 955 120 Quirk: Stable Weapons

content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. The Winston is a fire support type tank which generally uses its long range weaponry to hit its opponent. The vehicle's principle long range weapons include a pair of turret mounted 15-tubed Long Range Missile Launchers and pair of Light PPCs. The Light PPCs are guided by a Targeting Computer mounted in the hull of the tank. In close combat, the vehicle must rely on its front mounted 6-tubed Streak Short Range Missile Launcher. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 345 35 Left 285 35 Right 285 35 Rear 185 35 Turret 300 35 Total 1400 175 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long

Основное оружие включает в себя пару установленных на башне 15-трубных LRM и пару легких PPC. Легкие PPC управляются компьютером целеуказания, установленным в корпусе танка. В ближнем бою танк полагается на установленную спереди 6-трубную Streak SRM. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. Produced as an alternative design to, perhaps, act as a companion to the original version of the Winston developed in 3086. The LAC variant exchanges the Light PPCs for a pair of Light Autocannons, while the LRMs are swapped for a pair of seven-tubed Multi-Missile Launchers for added flexibility. content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. Introduced in 3107 this Winston variant carries the Targeting Computer and Light PPCs of the original. The two LRM-15s are replaced by Clan-built LRM-20s. A pair of SRM-4 launchers covers the front arc, and a TAG is mounted in the turret to call in artillery strikes. An Angel ECM Suite is also included to disrupt enemy electronics systems. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.content: Боевая машина «Уинстон» была передовой машиной Республики Сферы, производство которой началось в 3085 году. Представленный в 3107 году вариант «Уинстона» оснащен компьютером целеуказания и легкими PPC. Два LRM-15 заменены на LRM-20. В комплект также входит комплекс ECM Angel для вывода из строя электронных систем противника. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Броня: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Структура: Structure Значения Б С Перед 350 35 Лево 290 35 Право 290 35 Зад 225 35 Turret 270 35 Итого 1425 175 Особенность: Улучшенное наведение - Long

content.original: The Winston is a solid Heavy tank Boss. Seventy tons of 'Mech would be better, but a Winston will do just fine.
content.prevOriginal: The Winston is a solid Heavy tank Boss. Seventy tons of 'Mech would be better, but a Winston will do just fine.
content.content: Winston - это надежный тяжелый танк-босс. Семидесятитонный мех был бы лучше, но и «Уинстон» вполне сойдет.

content.original: The Zephyros infantry support vehicle, is a Clan Hell's Horses vehicle produced on Kirchbach in the early 3080s. It was conceived as a means to shore up the Clan's conventional forces after being cut off from the Homeworlds. Five and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor protects the vehicle from enemy fire. The vehicle employs a Guardian ECM suite. The Zephyros's main weaponry is a pair of ER medium lasers that are mounted in the vehicle's turret along with a pair of light machine guns. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 145 15 Left 115 15 Right 115 15 Rear 90 15 Turret 110 15 Total 575 75 Quirk: Improved Jammer

content.original: The Aeron attack VTOL (BAP) was derived from prototypes created by the Word of Blake at the beginning of the Jihad era. These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. Developed in 3084 as a less-expensive alternative to the base model, this variant is specialized for use in a recon. The standard Targeting Computer is removed and replaced with a Beagle Active Probe and a half-ton cargo to house and deploy remote drones. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 15 Left 85 15 Right 85 15 Rear 75 15 Total 375 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. The Aeron carries a single Hellion-a III Extended Range Large Laser mounted in the nose. This weapon is aimed with the assistance of a battle-grade Targeting Computer. This allows the VTOL to target enemy units quickly and accurately even while moving at high speed. content.original: First introduced in 3096, this post-Jihad design was created by Clan Wolf as a cheap anti-aircraft platform. Slow and heavily armored, the Aesir is often set into static positions where its relatively slow speed is not considered a liability. The Aesir mounts a set of four Type Sierra LB-X Autocannon/2s in its turret. With their long range, and cluster munitions, they serve as an effective counter against airborne raiders. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Aithon Assault Transport is a Clan heavy infantry transport first produced by Swedenborg Heavy Industries in 3084 for Clan Hell's Horses. Created as a new design, the Aithon serves as a replacement for the various vehicles that the Clan is no longer able to produce. The Aithon is slow, but it is a well armored design which sports 12.5 tons of advance tech Ferro-Lamellor Armor. In addition to its damage reducing armor, the vehicle's vulnerable traction system is protected with a 10-ton Armored Motive System. One of the vehicle's principal features is its Infantry Bay, which is able to handle upwards to 10 tons worth of troops. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Lamellor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 50 Left 180 50 Right 180 50 Rear 140 50 Turret 170 50 Total 890 250 Quirk: Distracting Can Resupply/Repair
