content.original: The Anat Armored Personnel Carrier is an early Dark Age design which was first produced by Clan Hell's Horses in 3092. The Horses wanted a fast vehicle that could handle multiple terrain types. For this reason the vehicle was given a wheeled chassis and Limited Amphibious Equipment. The wheeled chassis can handle more terrain types than a hovercraft, and the amphibious equipment allows it to cross small water obstacles. Protected by three and a half tons of armor, the Anat can transport infantry units into hostile fire with some degree of safety. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The Maxim Mark II transport is produced by Cyclops Inc. of Skye and Scarborough Manufacturers. The vehicle was intended as an upgrade from the original Maxim hover transport. Though Cyclops wanted to build on the long history of the original Maxim and continue to use heavy weapons, Scarborough’s engineers pointed out that by carrying fewer weapons the crew would naturally withdraw from the battlefield before getting into overly dangerous situations. This would keep the Maxim Mk. II in service for a longer time, allowing the Republic Armed Forces to spend more money on battle armor and other equipment. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. content.original: The genesis of the Arrow IV Assault Vehicle or AAV was the battle to liberate Canopus IV during the Jihad, when Naomi Centrella and her forces saw the effectiveness of the Arrow IV-equipped Demolishers deployed by the Red Lancers when fighting against the Blakist Thirty-Fourth Militia Division. Although the AAV carried just the one missile system, the weight savings in comparison to the Demolisher allowed the AAV to carry more armor - thirteen and a half tons of heavy ferro-fibrous armor in total - and defensive weapons, a trait that was used to great effect against those used to fighting against the Demolisher. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 300 40 Left 270 40 Right 270 40 Rear 265 40 Turret 290 40 Total 1395 200 Quirk: Rugged
content.prevOriginal: Long range fire support assets, Artillery vehicles mount the big guns that pound stuff into metallic dust. Mounting large calibre weapons, Artillery excels at killing targets from afar. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 305 40 Left 265 40 Right 265 40 Rear 270 40 Turret 290 40 Total 1395 200

content.original: The Bardiche heavy Strike Tank was intended to be an infantry support vehicle, and while it is reasonably capable in providing that capability, it failed in most other roles simply because it wasn't well-armed enough to compete with main battle tanks of similar weight. To make matters worse, the Bardiche was both too heavy and too costly to be a popular choice for an infantry support vehicle. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The Behemoth II Heavy Tank was designed in 3102 by Aldis Industries.The tank gained a reputation to be feared among MechWarriors during the Victoria War. Among some noted actions using the vehicle, was in 3117, when elements of the 4th Oriente Hussars encountered a platoon of 4 Behemoth II tanks used to help defend the Capellan world of Shuen Wan during a raid. The Capellan defenders utilized the tank's capacities to hold the high deserts plateau where they encountered the Hussars. The tanks proved to be resilient in combat and remained operational throughout the fight, forcing the Hussars to withdraw. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 365 50 Left 280 50 Right 280 50 Rear 190 50 Turret 285 50 Total 1400 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: After the Word of Blake was defeated in the Jihad, Maxwell-Pulaski Motors modified the design slightly and produced it for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084.[9] The main differences are the removal of its Blakist features. The infantry bay was reduced to four tons, and the C3i system was replaced by a C3 slave unit. The machine gun ammunition was reduced to half a ton. All these changes increased the pod space available to the RAF Bollas by four and a half tons, but the turret can only mount fifteen tons of equipment. The Stealth Armor was retained, as was the Guardian ECM suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.content: After the Word of Blake was defeated in the Jihad, Maxwell-Pulaski Motors modified the design slightly and produced it for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084.[9] The main differences are the removal of its Blakist features. The infantry bay was reduced to four tons, and the C3i system was replaced by a C3 slave unit. The machine gun ammunition was reduced to half a ton. All these changes increased the pod space available to the RAF Bollas by four and a half tons, but the turret can only mount fifteen tons of equipment. The Stealth Armor was retained, as was the Guardian ECM suite. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: A modern take on the venerable SRM/LRM Carriers, the JES II Strategic Missile Carrier was a common missile based fire support vehicle in use in the early thirty-second century. A model sighted during the Dark Age era in 3088 mounted four Artemis IV enhanced LRM-20 in front with a single Artemis IV enhanced LRM-10 on each flank. It was also clad in Ferro-Fibrous armor. However to make room for all the equipment, the C3 Slave and Guardian ECM were removed, as was much of the armor. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. content.original: The Chalchiuhtotolin is a vehicle produced by Clan Jade Falcon during the post-Jihad era in response to the need for an urban combat vehicle. The vehicle's strange name can be attributed to Clan Merchant Factor Daniel. The tank is powered by a 230-rated Fusion Engine, which is capable of propelling the vehicle up to 86 km/h. The tank's weaponry was designed to be as accurate as possible as a means of minimizing damage to property and civilians when performing its urban enforcement duties. content.original: The Challenger Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. The Challenger was a joint effort between Kallon Industries and General Motors; rather than possibly losing out on lucrative contracts trying to outdo one another, the two corporations teamed up to create a main battle tank that could stand up to a BattleMech. The tank was produced on Kirklin, Kathil, and Salem. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 425 45 Left 335 45 Right 335 45 Rear 275 45 Turret 340 45 Total 1710 225 Quirk: Main Battle Tank
content.prevOriginal: The Challenger X Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. Equipped with a 270 rated XL Engine, the Challenger X has a top speed of 54kph, allowing it to keep pace with formations of heavy units. The tank is protected by fourteen tons of  Ferro-Fibrous Armor with an anti-missile system providing additional protection from missiles. The Challenger's primary weaponry includes a turret mounted Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo. For closer range threats, a LB 10-X Autocannon is also turret-mounted with two tons of ammo. An Artemis IV FCS-enhanced LRM-10 provides additional ranged firepower. To combat threats at short range, the Challenger X has a pair of Streak SRM 2 launchers protecting the sides of the tank, two front-mounted Medium Pulse Lasers and a rear-mounted Small Pulse Laser. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 425 45 Left 334 45 Right 334 45 Rear 277 45 Turret 340 45 Total 1710 225

content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. content.original: A cheaper version of the Demolisher Bombast unveiled after the Jihad, the Bombast (Fuel Cell) swaps the standard fusion engine for a cheaper Fuel Cell. content.original: The DI Multipurpose VTOL was the end result of a design process hampered repeatedly by changing requirements. Defiance had built a prototype when the LCAF changed the requirements. Defiance finally responded by preempting further design changes by submitting their own design for a single multi-role helicopter that met all of the previous requirements. The design originally called for by the LCAF was also produced directly for sale by Defiance; the Gunship variant lacked the infantry compartment, TAG and Beagle Active Probe of the Multipurpose VTOL, instead mounting an MML-7 on the front of the Gunship. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 18 Left 130 18 Right 130 18 Rear 100 18 Turret 15 18 Total 575 90 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: [This version has Guided Arrows] The Hadur Fast Support Vehicle was developed by Clan Hell's Horses and introduced in 3102. Capable of reaching a top speed of 151 km/h, the Hadur can quickly position itself to provide heavy missile artillery support. It performs best when paired with forward scouts like the Asshur scout. The crew is protected by six tons of standard plate armor. The primary weapon of the Hadur is the Class 16 Arrow IV launcher. This massive weapon provides missile artillery support to friendly forces. However, unlike the Naga OmniMech, the Hadur has a single twenty round magazine instead of four smaller five round magazines. This means that switching ammunition types is a problem for Hadur crews. To remedy this, the Horses typically load the magazine with homing Arrow IV rounds. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Armor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 95 25 Total 505 125 Quirk: Improved Sensors

Способный развивать скорость до 151 км/ч, «Хадур» может быстро занять позицию и обеспечить поддержку тяжелой ракетной артиллерией. Экипаж защищен шестью тоннами стандартной пластинчатой брони. Основным оружием является пусковая установка класса 16 Arrow IV. Это массивное орудие обеспечивает ракетно-артиллерийскую поддержку дружественных сил. content.original: This variant of the JES I Tactical Missile Carrier replaces the standard engine with a larger 165-rated model. This increases the speed of the JES by 50%. Joint Equipment System’s first vehicle since the Clan Invasion overtook its main plant on Alshain. The JES I is a close-in fighting vehicle for primary escort and defense. The vehicle is considered by many to be underpowered with its 15-rating fusion engine and underarmored for its size. The vehicle’s glaring flaws were due to JES’s lack of capital to fund better equipment. However, the vehicle proved to be popular among Periphery nations and so the vehicle’s production continued well into the 3130s Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Additionally, the Joust has eight tons of ferro-fibrous armor, double that of the similar Ares tank, enhancing the Joust's survivability. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Броня: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Структура: Structure Значения Б С Перед 220 20 Лево 160 20 Право 160 20 Зад 100 20 Turret 165 20 Итого 805 100 Особенность: Точное оружие - MG

content.original: The Kelswa Assault Tank is a thirty-second century frontline Combat Vehicle which was produced originally in the Lyran Commonwealth. A popular tank, the Kelswa has been seen deployed throughout the armed forces of the Inner Sphere and even in some Toumans of the Clans. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 395 50 Left 215 50 Right 215 50 Rear 210 50 Turret 245 50 Total 1280 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank
content.prevOriginal: Developed by the New Earth Trading Company in 2587, the Alacorn has developed a reputation as an effective and dependable tank. The design is popular with mercenary units and minor powers who can't afford BattleMechs, because of its heavy offensive weaponry and thirteen tons of armor; however, this payload is only possible through the use of an expensive and fragile 285 XL Engine. The three turret-mounted  Gauss Rifles allow the Alacorn to unleash devastating barrages at range, with five tons of reloads offering excellent endurance in combat. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 395 50 Left 215 50 Right 215 50 Rear 210 50 Turret 245 50 Total 1280 250

content.original: The King Scorpion is a straightforward attempt to update the famous, or perhaps infamous, Scorpion Light Tank for the modern era without completely losing the simplicity and low cost that made it popular in the first place. It's most advanced piece of equipment is an Ultra AC/5, and ferro-fibrous armor. Neatly doubling it's protection and firepower while adding only 10 more tons to the chassis. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 20 Left 100 20 Right 100 20 Rear 80 20 Turret 125 20 Total 555 100 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: This 3087 variant carries a BattleMech Taser and LB 10-X in the turret. A pair of medium lasers and an ER Small Laser cover the front of the tank. When the Federated Commonwealth was looking for OmniVehicle designs, StarCorps Industries quickly gathered a design team and released a prototype in record time. Officially it fulfilled all requirements, but unofficially StarCorps Industries had greased all the right palms. With every version able to deliver an awesome amount of firepower while being extremely fast for a heavy tank, the Manteuffel is a serious tank to consider. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Manticore II updated the venerable Manticore tank with advanced capabilities and a brand new tactical niche as an amphibious vehicle. Few tanks of similar power can match the Manticore II’s mobility in wet terrain. The unit is best employed at long range, emerging from a swamp or river to provide highly accurate support fire from an unexpected quarter. It has the technical capabilities to serve in a similar role as the Manticore, but its expense makes this a questionable use of a specialist machine. Slower than the Medium Tank, but possessing heavier armor and fire power, the Heavy Tank is a fearsome combatant. Trading speed or weapons for armor, the Heavy Tank can soak up a surprisingly heavy level of fire power. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Amphibious Hull Values A S Front 265 35 Left 200 35 Right 200 35 Rear 120 35 Turret 245 35 Total 1030 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Marksman M1 Tank series first began field trials in 3088 for the Republic of the Sphere on Terra. The tank shares a name with the ancient SLDF Marksman Artillery Vehicle, a fact the RAF anticipates being able to exploit against opponents. Unlike the older vehicle, this vehicle was created as a main battle tank for the Republic of the Sphere. All of the vehicle's weaponry is mounted on the tank's turret. The tank's long range armament consists of its M-7 Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammunition and two MRM10 packs with a ton of ammunition. For short-range weaponry the vehicle has two Streak SRM4s with a ton of ammo, and two SRM6s with a ton of ammo. For use against infantry, it has four Bulldog miniguns with a half ton of ammunition. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 310 50 Left 205 50 Right 205 50 Rear 140 50 Turret 170 50 Total 1030 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Marksman M1 Tank series first began field trials in 3088 for the Republic of the Sphere on Terra. The tank shares a name with the ancient SLDF Marksman Artillery Vehicle, a fact the RAF anticipates being able to exploit against opponents. Unlike the older vehicle, this vehicle was created as a main battle tank for the Republic of the Sphere. Developed specifically for the Republic of the Sphere, the M1A is equipped with twin MML-9 launchers and a quartet of ER Medium Lasers instead of the SRM and MRM systems. A Light Fusion Engine provides power, while fifteen tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor and CASE protect the crew. The remaining weapons remain the same as the M1. content.original: A Michaelson's Heavy Industries competitor to the aging Partisan and lighter Aesir AA vehicles. The distinctive feature of MHI's offering is the limited amphibious system allowing the unit to cross light water obstacles with ease. Primarily armed with a pair of LBX-10 Autocannons in the turret and a trio of forward-facing Light Machine Guns, this vehicle is a threat to both aircraft and lighter 'Mechs alike. content.original: The Nacon Armored Scout was created by Clan Jade Falcon to act as a recon unit. Instead of using expensive BattleMechs for recon, this armored scout allows a Falcon commander to find an opponent and direct heavier units into combat. With a top speed of 162 km/h, the Nacon can quickly find an enemy force and disengage. Protection comes from five tons of ferro-fibrous armor, which provides enough protection for quick escapes. However, the rear armor can only withstand a single PPC hit while the front face can withstand more than four PPC hits. This has encouraged some crews to engage heavier forces head on. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 10 Left 110 10 Right 110 10 Rear 60 10 Total 500 40 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: Unveiled in 3110 the Partisan AA Vehicle, a lighter take on the original Partisan Air Defense Tank, was meant to be cheaper and faster but still be equally effective in the anti-aircraft role. The Partisan AA Vehicle is armed with dual Defiance Shredder LB 5-X Autocannons mounted in the vehicle's turret. These guns, along with its excellent anti-aircraft equipment, allow the vehicle to engage aircraft, such as VTOLs and other airborne targets. The vehicle's three tons of ammunition is enough to sustain the vehicle in combat. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 70 25 Turret 90 25 Total 480 125 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: A production version of the experimental X model, the vehicle is fitted with a 210 XL fusion engine with a supercharger. Weaponry includes a Medium X-Pulse laser and Streak SRM-6. A C3 Computer greatly improves it's scouting abilities. The Pegasus is a popular recon unit, due to its good speed, decent armor, and respectable firepower. It can be found in almost all militaries, having been introduced in the First Succession War and continuously updated ever since. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: First produced in 3093, the Pixiu Heavy Tank is a vehicle produced for the Capellan Confederation's Armed Forces just after the Jihad. It was designed to supplement the Po II, a short-range fighter, provide covering fire at long ranges. The Pixiu owes its reputation to its speed and the stealth it uses to great effect on the battlefield. The tank includes 11 tons of Ceres Heavy Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: An extensively remodeled variant developed by the Ceres Metal facility on Menke in 3085, the Ultra Autocannon is replaced with a Luxor Mobile Battery Arrow IV system. While the original Po was intended to be cheap and simple to manufacture and maintain, the modern upgrade traded the Ceres 240 internal combustion engine with a much more expensive but considerably lighter Pitban 240 XL Fusion Engine to allow a great deal increase in firepower. Eleven tons of armor, a modest increase of half a ton, provided average protection for the vehicle's weight. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: Originally developed by Vitesse Vehicles of Terra in 2611, the Prowler Multi-Terrain-Vehicle was the most common hostile and exotic environment military-grade exploration vehicles. The Prowler was almost unsurpassed in its niche, the design proving popular enough for Vitesse to halt production and merely license the design to manufacturers across the Inner Sphere and Periphery. While never produced in large numbers, all post–Star League era Successor State militaries maintained a number of the vehicle for combat on their most inhospitable planets. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Environmental Sealing Values A S Front 165 30 Left 120 30 Right 120 30 Rear 90 30 Turret 135 30 Total 630 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: This version of the Rommel removes the standard weaponry and replaces it with weapons that are allegedly easier for newer troops to use and less likely to fall victim to electronic warfare or Anti-Missile systems. The main gun is a Long Tom Artillery Cannon. This weapon can inflict massive amounts of damage on the target and its immediate surroundings and it doesn't require a great gunner. The LRM-5 was replaced by a Thunderbolt 5 launcher to provide more punch. The Rommel tank is a 65-ton armored combat vehicle, specializing in close range fighting and urban combat. Identical to its twin, the Patton, in every way but armament and armor configuration, the Rommel has primarily served with the Lyran Commonwealth and the Lyran Alliance. It is named after Field Marshal Erwin Rommel, a legendary commander of armored and mechanized forces renowned for his exploits during World War II on Terra. The Rommel was designed concurrently with the Patton in the early 3000s, when Defiance Industries decided that an armored combat vehicle capable of replacing 'Mechs was needed. Since 'Mech production was nearly at a standstill, the ability to produce and field armored vehicles became a necessity for every Successor State. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 300 35 Left 195 35 Right 195 35 Rear 165 35 Turret 240 35 Total 1095 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank
content.prevOriginal: Long range fire support assets, Artillery vehicles mount the big guns that pound stuff into metallic dust. Mounting large calibre weapons, Artillery excels at killing targets from afar. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 301 35 Left 183 35 Right 183 35 Rear 188 35 Turret 240 35 Total 1095 175

content.original: The vehicle's Primary Configuration is designed for both reconnaissance and electronic warfare. Mounted in its Pod space for this role is an Angel ECM Suite and a Bloodhound Probe. The vehicle's speed is increased thanks to the addition of a supercharger, allowing it to reach speeds upwards of 220 km/h. The Scapha's firepower comes from a pair of turret mounted Light PPCs guided by a Targeting Computer. The Scapha Hovertank is a thirty-second century Hover OmniVehicle which was originally exclusively produced for the Armed Forces of the Republic of the Sphere. Built by Grumman Industries on Terra in 3123, the Scapha was designed with the best technologies of its time. It would go on to serve in multiple roles in the RAF due to its flexibility and firepower. The design was highly popular in the service of the RAF well into the fall of most the Republic's Prefectures to invading forces after 3132. While part of many Republic Standing Guard units, the Scapha was noted for delaying the fall of many Republic worlds. Designed as a fast and flexible tank, the Scapha is powered by a Strand 265-rated Extra-Extralight Fusion Engine, giving excess speed. Despite the cost of the engine and its bulkiness, the Scapha has thirteen tons of pod space for weapons and equipment. Protecting its armored hide is 7.5 tons of Grumman CRR Reflective Armor which dampens the damage caused by energy weapons. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 20 Left 100 20 Right 100 20 Rear 100 20 Turret 150 20 Total 600 100 Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Omni Vehicle

content.original: A medium-range fighter and spotter, the F Configuration mounts a basic AC/5 guided by a Targeting Computer. The vehicle carries two tons worth of ammunition for the weapon, allowing carrying different ammo types. A TAG unit allows it act as spotter for artillery and units using semi-guided LRM launchers. The Scapha Hovertank is a thirty-second century Hover OmniVehicle which was originally exclusively produced for the Armed Forces of the Republic of the Sphere. Built by Grumman Industries on Terra in 3123, the Scapha was designed with the best technologies of its time. It would go on to serve in multiple roles in the RAF due to its flexibility and firepower. The design was highly popular in the service of the RAF well into the fall of most the Republic's Prefectures to invading forces after 3132. While part of many Republic Standing Guard units, the Scapha was noted for delaying the fall of many Republic worlds. content.original: The Schildkröte Line Tank is a Medium sized Combat Vehicle, originally designed for the Lyran Commonwealth's armed forces in 3122. A durable but slow tank, the Schildkröte was not well regarded when it first premiered. Due to this perception of it being too slow for frontline units, the vehicle was distributed among the Commonwealth's lower tier combat formations and planetary militia. However, over time the tank's durability would win over many with its performance in the field. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. The base chassis carries a C3 Computer, as well as a Guardian ECM Suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Scimitar Mk II Hover Combat Vehicle (HCV) is the successor to the original Scimitar. The vehicle has superior speed to the original Scimitar. The new version of the venerable combat vehicle began to appear at the dawn of the thirty-second century. Originally, this upgraded version of the Scimitar served as part of the Republic of the Sphere's Republic Armed Forces, being produced by Scarborough Manufacturers' Al Na'ir. Many of these vehicles were salvaged over the decades after the Jihad, and found their way into warring political militia factions in the Republic of the Sphere by 3132. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. content.original: The Shandra Advanced Scout Vehicle is a light Combat Vehicle created in the last decades of the thirty-first century and used well into the next century. The vehicle began to be produced in 3087 by Brigadier Corporation on Oliver and became highly popular with many of the Inner Sphere nations, which began to adopt Combined Arms doctrine for their militaries. Due to their popularity, they would be among forefront of scout missions, where it’s been known for different factions using these vehicles to clash during this time period. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 15 Left 75 15 Right 75 15 Rear 50 15 Total 340 60 Quirk: Off Roader

content.original: The Sheriff Infantry Support Vehicle is a common sight within the various allies of the Capellan Confederation. Introduced shortly before the end of the thirty-first century by Majesty Metals and Manufacturing and manufactured in their plant on Dunianshire, the Sheriff proved to have uses beyond simply acting as mobile cover for infantry; crews would often carry multiple different types of ammunition for the turret-mounted light autocannons, allowing the Sheriff to tailor its performance to the demands of the mission or battle. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 25 Left 195 25 Right 195 25 Rear 195 25 Turret 195 25 Total 1000 125 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: The Shillelagh Missile Tank is an early thirty-second century Combat Vehicle which was first produced for the Draconis Combine. Originally designed and prototyped during the 2nd Succession War, the vehicle suffered from instability and other technical problems that proved to be insurmountable at the time. Shortly after the Second Combine-Dominion War, the DCMS was in need of an inexpensive replacement vehicle for its militia forces. For this reason, engineers at Buda Imperial Vehicles revived the Shillelagh. Redesigned with inexpensive thirty-second century technology, the tank entered production as part of the Combine's efforts to rebuild its frontline forces by swapping more effective combat vehicle designs taken from the militias and replacing them with vehicles like the Shillelagh. Despite it being redesigned, the vehicle still is haunted by lingering design flaws. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 160 20 Left 120 20 Right 120 20 Rear 75 20 Turret 175 20 Total 650 100 Quirk: Thermal Sight

content.original: The Skulker Wheeled Scout is the much larger cousin of the Swift Wind scout car and originally based on the Heavy APC design. Due to it being larger than any scout car, it can act as a mobile communication outpost. With its advanced sensor suite which is tied to both its communication and targeting systems, it can navigate with only its sensors. While hot environments would normally wreak havoc upon its advanced electronics, the heat sinks from its Medium Laser cool the sensors while the laser is not in use. This allows it to operate in even the hottest environments where other scout vehicles cannot. The Skulker comes with four and a half tons of armor as standard. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 10 Left 100 10 Right 100 10 Rear 90 10 Total 430 40 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: The SM2 Heavy Artillery Vehicle originated as an attempt to adapt to the tactics and nature of warfare in the Inner Sphere by Clan Nova Cat. Manufactured from the Luthien Armor Works plant on Barcella originally, the SM2 was a nondescript vehicle that gave the Nova Cats a mobile midrange artillery support vehicle. While it wasn't ideal, the SM2 was manufactured for some years and was adopted by some of the solahma units, seeing service on the battlefield alongside Elementals or infantry equipped with Void battle armor, as well as Mamono Infantry Fighting Vehicles. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 460 40 Left 375 40 Right 375 40 Rear 300 40 Total 1510 160 Quirk: Improved Communications
content.prevOriginal: Long range fire support assets, Artillery vehicles mount the big guns that pound stuff into metallic dust. Designed to support allies from range, Artillery can throw a variety of payloads down range; ranging from standard artillery to FASCAM or Inferno loads. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: LAW produced small quantities of a version of the SM2 that replaced the Sniper Artillery Piece with a larger Long Tom Cannon and twenty-five rounds of ammunition[6]. This variant wasn't a huge success; while the extra range and power of the Long Tom Cannon was a definite advantage, the vehicle suffered from severe structural instability. This instability was a result of poorly-placed shock rings, with the powerful recoil of the Cannon causing it to actually rip free of the mountings on occasion. LAW took a pragmatic approach to the problems with this variant: they offered it for sale at a reduced price. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 460 40 Left 375 40 Right 375 40 Rear 300 40 Total 1510 160 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: The Sortek Assault Hover Craft is a thirty-second century combat hovercraft, originally produced by Corean Enterprises for the armed forces of the Federated Suns. Built on New Avalon, Corean Enterprises constructed the craft as a means to repeat its success with its last successful hovercraft, the Musketeer. The Sortek was used by many Armed Forces of the Federated Suns combat units by the 3140s to rebuild their devastated forces. Many AFFS commanders would mistakenly use the Sortek as a main combatant, which would cause heavy casualties due to the Sortek's lack of being able to deliver a killing blow to a heavier opponent. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 25 Left 120 25 Right 120 25 Rear 110 25 Total 525 100 Quirk: Improved Sensors

content.original: The Thang-Ta APC is an inexpensive transport vehicle manufactured on Tiber; the combination of low price and simple construction paved the way for wide adoption throughout the states of the former Free Worlds League and then later after the League was reconstituted. The primary advantages the Thang-Ta enjoyed over older designs was higher speed. The Thang-Ta mounts a pair of ER Small Lasers in a turret. A bare bones infantry compartment completes it's equipment. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 95 5 Left 55 5 Right 55 5 Rear 50 5 Turret 50 5 Total 305 25 Quirk: Enhanced FPE
content.prevOriginal: APCs are not fighting vehicles, their main function is to transport infantry squads from one battle to another. However, many APC variants sacrifice troop capacity to mount significant weaponry. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 96 5 Left 54 5 Right 54 5 Rear 50 5 Turret 50 5 Total 304 25

content.original: The largest change is the engine exchange. Instead of a Fusion or Internal Combustion Engine, Maxwell's engineers used a Fuel Cell engine. This engine trade allowed engineers to remove extra fusion engine shielding that was no longer needed. The engineers also used a pair of Sponson Turrets for the secondary weapons instead of the standard turret. Dropping the turret and heavy fusion engine provided the design team with enough room to double the Thumper Artillery's ammunition bay. The standard ER Small Laser was also removed. Secondary weapons on this version are now a single SRM-2 and Machine Gun mounted in each Sponson Turret. For additional protection the Thumper Maxwell employs an Angel ECM Suite and CASE. The Thumper was created by Brooks Incorporated as a cheap knock off of the SLDF's Thor Artillery Vehicle. The vehicle was mass produced and sold to the Successor States from 2735 to 3046. The Thumper mounts it's namesake; the Thumper Artillery piece. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.prevOriginal: Long range fire support assets, Artillery vehicles mount the big guns that pound stuff into metallic dust. Designed to support allies from range, Artillery can throw a variety of payloads down range; ranging from standard artillery to FASCAM or Inferno loads. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.content: The largest change is the engine exchange. Instead of a Fusion or Internal Combustion Engine, Maxwell's engineers used a Fuel Cell engine. This engine trade allowed engineers to remove extra fusion engine shielding that was no longer needed. The engineers also used a pair of Sponson Turrets for the secondary weapons instead of the standard turret. Dropping the turret and heavy fusion engine provided the design team with enough room to double the Thumper Artillery's ammunition bay. The standard ER Small Laser was also removed. Secondary weapons on this version are now a single SRM-2 and Machine Gun mounted in each Sponson Turret. For additional protection the Thumper Maxwell employs an Angel ECM Suite and CASE. The Thumper was created by Brooks Incorporated as a cheap knock off of the SLDF's Thor Artillery Vehicle. The vehicle was mass produced and sold to the Successor States from 2735 to 3046. The Thumper mounts it's namesake; the Thumper Artillery piece. Топливная ячейка: улучшенный двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. The Winston is a fire support type tank which generally uses its long range weaponry to hit its opponent. The vehicle's principle long range weapons include a pair of turret mounted 15-tubed Long Range Missile Launchers and pair of Light PPCs. The Light PPCs are guided by a Targeting Computer mounted in the hull of the tank. In close combat, the vehicle must rely on its front mounted 6-tubed Streak Short Range Missile Launcher. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. The Aeron carries a single Bombast Laser mounted in the nose. This weapon is aimed with the assistance of a battle-grade Targeting Computer. This allows the VTOL to target enemy units quickly and accurately even while moving at high speed. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. content.original: An escort model of the standard Maxim APC, the Maxim Escort trades the troop bay for a heavier weapons load and a Fuel Cell engine. Mimicking the classic Maxim loadout, the Escort has a pair of MML-5's on the front of the vehicle with a third on the rear. A trio of Machine Guns linked together in an array and a Streak SRM-6 are mounted on the turret. Lastly to deter flanking units an SRM-2 Improved Oneshot is mounted on the vehicles flanks. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 125 25 Left 115 25 Right 115 25 Rear 95 25 Turret 100 25 Total 550 125 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Introduced after the Jihad, the Balac Strike VTOL was an extremely fast and versatile VTOL. Introduced in 3090 this version uses a standard Fusion engine. The two ATM-6 launchers remain, but the laser has been replaced by a single Heavy Machine Gun with a half-ton of ammunition. The smaller engine means the Hybrid can only reach a top speed of 150km/h Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Cal-Boeing however has no plans to sell it outside the Federated Suns. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. content.original: A staple of garrison units everywhere, the Chasseur is a 30 ton Star League era tank that resembles a fat Scorpion; albeit one without the quality control issues that the Scorpion is notorious for. Designed as a ‘‘light’’ Main Battle Tank by General Mechanics, the Chasseur is armed with a mid size Autocannon and an MG. In continuous production for 3 centuries, variants of the Chasseur can be found across the Periphery and the Inner Sphere. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 80 15 Right 80 15 Rear 60 15 Turret 80 15 Total 400 75 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Cizin is a hover tank developed by Clan Nova Cat during the last years of the thirty-first century. Designed to be fast and hard hitting. Most of the Cizin's firepower comes from four ER Medium Lasers found in the tank's turret. A pair of SRM-2 Launchers are mounted in its front. The vehicle would be effectively used during the Clan Nova Cat's uprising and would become accepted to Draconis Combine's own forces after the Clan's demise. LAW would then add additional production facilities for the Cizin on Luthien by 3145. The Cizin is named after the Mayan god of earthquakes and death. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 25 Left 135 25 Right 135 25 Rear 120 25 Turret 115 25 Total 705 125 Quirk: Tacticon TC7000

content.original: The Cizin is a hover tank developed by Clan Nova Cat during the last years of the thirty-first century. Designed to be fast and hard hitting, the Cizin Designed for long-range engagements, the Support variant was introduced in 3124. Its main weapon is a turreted ER Large Laser. A single Streak LRM-15 mounted in the front with sixteen volleys worth of fire. The vehicle would be effectively used during the Clan Nova Cat's uprising and would become accepted to Draconis Combine's own forces after the Clan's demise. LAW would then add additional production facilities for the Cizin on Luthien by 3145. The Cizin is named after the Mayan god of earthquakes and death. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 25 Left 135 25 Right 135 25 Rear 120 25 Turret 115 25 Total 705 125 Quirk: Tacticon TC7000

content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 25 Left 115 25 Right 115 25 Rear 90 25 Turret 110 25 Total 580 125 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: The Enyo Strike Tank is a combat vehicle produced by Clan Hell's Horses. Following the success of the XL Engine variant of the Mars, Khan Malavai Fletcher ordered his scientist caste to come up with a main battle tank that could take advantage of the speed a lightweight engine could bring. His successor, James Cobb, liked the idea and maintained the mandate for such a proof of concept. The result of the scientists' labor is the Enyo. It can hit speeds up to 97 km/h, which enables it to keep up with many Clan medium 'Mechs. Seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor protect the tank, allowing it to withstand some punishment, though speed is its best defense. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Hardened (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 30 Left 90 30 Right 90 30 Rear 75 30 Turret 90 30 Total 465 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: A light combat vehicle that first saw production in 2692 the Galleon proved to be an economical means of supporting infantry and BattleMechs. With a top speed faster than most 'Mechs, the Galleon was mobile but generally lacked protection, early models carrying only three and a half tons of armor. After the Exodus, these tracked vehicles mostly fell into the possession of the Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League. The Galleon is often paired with the Harasser Missile Platform. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 135 15 Left 125 15 Right 125 15 Rear 100 15 Turret 135 15 Total 620 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

content.original: [This version has Standard Arrows] The Hadur Fast Support Vehicle was developed by Clan Hell's Horses and introduced in 3102. Capable of reaching a top speed of 151 km/h, the Hadur can quickly position itself to provide heavy missile artillery support. It performs best when paired with forward scouts like the Asshur scout. The crew is protected by six tons of standard plate armor. The primary weapon of the Hadur is the Class 16 Arrow IV launcher. This massive weapon provides missile artillery support to friendly forces. However, unlike the Naga OmniMech, the Hadur has a single twenty round magazine instead of four smaller five round magazines. This means that switching ammunition types is a problem for Hadur crews. To remedy this, the Horses typically load the magazine with homing Arrow IV rounds. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Armor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 95 25 Total 505 125 Quirk: Improved Sensors

Способный развивать скорость до 151 км/ч, «Хадур» может быстро занять позицию и обеспечить поддержку тяжелой ракетной артиллерией. Экипаж защищен шестью тоннами стандартной пластинчатой брони. Основным оружием является пусковая установка класса 16 Arrow IV. Это массивное орудие обеспечивает ракетно-артиллерийскую поддержку дружественных сил. content.original: This non-Omni 3083 version of the Hephaestus Scout Tank is equipped with a pair of ER Medium Lasers, TAG, ECM Suite, and an Active Probe. The standard fusion engine provides a maximum ground speed of nearly 150 km/h while five and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor protects the tank while the hoverskirts have been reinforced with an Armored Motive System. The most interesting feature, however, is the set of eight Jump Jets mounted in the body, which allows this hovertank to cover 240 meters in a single bound. Not since the Kanga has this system been deployed on a combat unit. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 20 Left 120 20 Right 120 20 Rear 95 20 Turret 110 20 Total 565 100 Quirk: Distracting

The standard fusion engine provides a maximum ground speed of nearly 150 km/h while five and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor protects the tank while the hoverskirts have been reinforced with an Armored Motive System. The most interesting feature, however, is the set of eight Jump Jets mounted in the body, which allows this hovertank to cover 240 meters in a single bound. Not since the Kanga has this system been deployed on a combat unit. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. It has a similar look and loadout to the standard Hephaestus Scout Tank but its not an OmniVehicle and its got eight Jump Jets mounted on it for clearing not so small obstacles. All that extra weight had to come from somewhere though so this thing is five tons heavier and no longer carries an infantry bay.

content.original: Ubiquitous across the Inner Sphere, the Igor is a name given to a generic super heavy lift platform. Originally developed to rapidly relocate heavy armour under battlefield conditions, the design has since spawned a host of imitators and copy cats with almost every developed world in the Inner Sphere and the Periphery possessing at least one Igor or Igor derived clone. Developed as a combat mod of the 60 ton VTOL, the Igor (AC/10) mounts a pair of AC/10's with 2 tons of ammo in place of the original cargo bay. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 48 Left 115 48 Right 115 48 Rear 90 48 Turret 25 48 Total 475 240 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: A 3099 update of the J.Edgar, produced by Pinard Protectorates; the J Edgar (Streak) is designed to take advantage of new technologies whilst still retaining the low cost of the original model. Retaining the original engine and armour layout, the Streak model uses Heavy Ferro Fibrous to free up enough tonnage to swap the SRM-2's for Streak models; retaining the original munition bay in the process. The Medium Laser is swapped for an ER Model and CASE rounds out the design. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 155 15 Left 100 15 Right 100 15 Rear 60 15 Turret 120 15 Total 535 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: This variant of the JES I Tactical Missile Carrier replaces the standard engine with a larger 165-rated model. This increases the speed of the JES by 50%. Joint Equipment System’s first vehicle since the Clan Invasion overtook its main plant on Alshain. The JES I is a close-in fighting vehicle for primary escort and defense. The vehicle is considered by many to be underpowered with its 15-rating fusion engine and underarmored for its size. The vehicle’s glaring flaws were due to JES’s lack of capital to fund better equipment. However, the vehicle proved to be popular among Periphery nations and so the vehicle’s production continued well into the 3130s Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 25 Left 70 25 Right 70 25 Rear 50 25 Turret 60 25 Total 370 125 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium

content.original: Created by Clan Nova Cat after the success of the Shoden, the Joust was designed to be a well-rounded medium tank. With a wide mix of weapons, the Joust is a versatile design, capable of handling a multitude of roles and missions. Additionally, the Joust has eight tons of ferro-fibrous armor, double that of the similar Ares tank, enhancing the Joust's survivability. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The Kamakiri mounts three weapon systems mounted in the front of the VTOL - a single Tiegart Particle Projection Cannon and a pair of Telos ThunderShot Thunderbolt 10 Missile Launchers. The Kamakiri Attack VTOL was developed at the end of the thirty-first century by Yan Manufacturing of New Samarkand as a result of their growing success in the military aerospace market. Dubbed as resembling a praying mantis, the Kamakiri was an immediate success; the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery personnel responsible for supervising the first vehicle trial watched for just two minutes before approving the Kamakiri for purchase. Moving as fast as many reconnaissance and strike platforms in service with the DCMS already thanks to the DAV 155 XL extra light engine, the original specification armor installed by Yan was replaced with seven tons of StarGuard Aurora Reflective at the request of the DCMS, who wanted to improve the Kamakari's protection against energy weapons, although the nature of the Reflective Armor didn't offer any additional protection against the flak commonly directed at VTOLs. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 42 Left 140 42 Right 140 42 Rear 100 42 Total 580 210 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Wingmounted

content.original: Combining the role of IFV and Light Tank, the Kamisori is a Republic era Light Tank produced by Pesht Motors. Designed to work in conjunction with Battle Armour whilst bring the fire power of a Galleon the Kamisori is a 20 ton Omni Tank. Powered by a 120 rated fusion core, the Kamisori can reach speeds of 97 kph and is protected by 5.5 tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armour. A 5 ton allocation of pod space in the turret allows for a diverse range of variants. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 10 Left 100 10 Right 100 10 Rear 55 10 Turret 145 10 Total 550 50 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Omni Vehicle

content.original: Capable of scouting, providing ECM cover and calling in artillery support from other units, the Kite Reconnaissance Vehicle was marketed as an all-in-one solution by Clan Sea Fox. The Kite was a successful replacement for the aging Odin, whisper-quiet even when moving, easier to maintain and cheaper to both purchase and operate. The Armored Motive System built into the Kite helped keep the vehicle mobile and functioning. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 135 15 Left 110 15 Right 110 15 Rear 105 15 Turret 100 15 Total 560 75 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: The modern Kruger Combat Car is a scout vehicle reintroduced in the Thirty-second century as an update of the much older original Kruger Combat Car introduced in 2620. The modern Kruger was developed by the Avalon Arms Company on New Avalon and marketed initially to the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns in 3091. Updated to use advanced equipment and technologies, the Kruger is a popular reconnaissance vehicle for scout detachments operating in the spinward Inner Sphere as well as neighboring Periphery nations. Lightly armed, it has a pair of turret mounted ER medium lasers and features a DAV 50 Fusion engine that powers the Kruger to speeds of up to 118 km/h. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 80 5 Left 70 5 Right 70 5 Rear 70 5 Turret 65 5 Total 355 25 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: The Main Gauche Light Support Tank is a fire support companion to Brooks Incorporated's Galleon. Though slower, topping out at only 64 km/h, five tons of armor protect it. The Main Gauche was actually submitted to the Free Worlds League Military because that organization was looking for a tank with long range capability. It finally reached full production in 3064. Based on the XL variant, this version introduced in 3081 is equipped with a four ton infantry compartment. The weapons have been removed and replaced by a forward mounted Plasma Rifle with 2 tons of ammo and two Light Machine Guns. Another Light Machine Gun covers the right and left side of the tank. It also carries some additional armor. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 15 Left 115 15 Right 115 15 Rear 85 15 Total 465 60 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: Developed as a generalist upgrade to the classic Manticore, the Manticore (XL) is an attempt by Defiance Industries to bring in additional revenue. Developed with an eye to licensing thee tank to other manufactures, the XL variant makes modest use of established technology. A 240 rated XL engine and Heavy Ferro Fibrous with added CASE provide a good balance of protection and practicality. The weapons systems are a riff on the classic Manticore with an ER PPC and a Medium Laser paired with a Targeting Computer. A Streak SRM-6 and an Enhanced LRM-10 replace the standard SRM/LRM combo. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 210 30 Left 180 30 Right 180 30 Rear 145 30 Turret 210 30 Total 925 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Nuberu Anti-Aircraft Tank is a post-Jihad design, which was developed jointly by Clan Snow Raven and the Outworlds Alliance in the early 3080s. After the end of the Jihad, pirate activity in the newly expanded Raven Alliance began to increase to the point that the OA's armed forces were no longer able provide adequate air cover for its worlds' ground forces. Based on the Partisan, the Nuberu use advanced technology to provide a greater air-defense capacity to both Clan and Alliance ground forces. Powered by a 180 Rated Fuel Cell engine, the vehicle has a modest 54 kilometer per hour speed, keeping pace with slower combat vehicles. Protecting its hull, Clan Scientists have added 9.5 tons of Clan Laser Reflective Armor. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Glazed (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 150 30 Right 150 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 200 30 Total 850 150 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Nuberu Anti-Aircraft Tank is a post-Jihad design, which was developed jointly by Clan Snow Raven and the Outworlds Alliance in the early 3080s. After the end of the Jihad, pirate activity in the newly expanded Raven Alliance began to increase to the point that the OA's armed forces were no longer able provide adequate air cover for its worlds' ground forces. Based on the Partisan, the Nuberu use advanced technology to provide a greater air-defense capacity to both Clan and Alliance ground forces. Powered by a 180 Rated Fuel Cell engine, the vehicle has a modest 54 kilometer per hour speed, keeping pace with slower combat vehicles. Protecting its hull, Clan Scientists have added 9.5 tons of Clan Laser Reflective Armor. Also known as the 'Numantia,' this variant is designed to be a companion to the the standard model. The Nuberu 2's mission is to act as a bodyguard unit for the vulnerable anti-air model. The forward turret has pair of Streak SRM-6 Launchers for short range engagements, while the rear turret features four LRM-15 Launchers for long-range engagements. The vehicle has also been given six Light Machine Guns. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.prevOriginal: The Nuberu Anti-Aircraft Tank is a post-Jihad design, which was developed jointly by Clan Snow Raven and the Outworlds Alliance in the early 3080s. After the end of the Jihad, pirate activity in the newly expanded Raven Alliance began to increase to the point that the OA's armed forces were no longer able provide adequate air cover for its worlds' ground forces. Based on the Partisan, the Nuberu use advanced technology to provide a greater air-defense capacity to both Clan and Alliance ground forces. Powered by a 180 Rated Fuel Cell engine, the vehicle has a modest 54 kilometer per hour speed, keeping pace with slower combat vehicles. content.original: The Patton tank is a 65-ton armored combat vehicle, specializing in conventional armored warfare. Identical to its twin, the Rommel, in every way but armament and armor configuration, the Patton has primarily served with the Lyran Commonwealth and the Lyran Alliance. It is named after General George S. Patton, Jr., a legendary commander of armored and mechanized forces renowned for his exploits during World War II on Terra. Unlike the Rommel, which features a massive and powerful but short-ranged AC/20 as its main gun, the Patton mounts an AC/10, giving it twice the ammunition capacity and superior firing range while also enabling it to be fitted with more armor. The Patton is capable of fighting in short-ranged and urban environments, but is far more suited than the Rommel to engaging targets at medium to long range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 265 35 Left 250 35 Right 250 35 Rear 230 35 Turret 265 35 Total 1260 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: First produced in 3093, the Pixiu Heavy Tank is a vehicle produced for the Capellan Confederation's Armed Forces just after the Jihad. The Pixiu owes its reputation to its speed and the stealth it uses to great effect on the battlefield. The tank includes 11 tons of Ceres Heavy Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite. content.original: The Schildkröte Line Tank is a Medium sized Combat Vehicle, originally designed for the Lyran Commonwealth's armed forces in 3122. A durable but slow tank, the Schildkröte was not well regarded when it first premiered. Due to this perception of it being too slow for frontline units, the vehicle was distributed among the Commonwealth's lower tier combat formations and planetary militia. However, over time the tank's durability would win over many with its performance in the field. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. A durable but slow tank, the Schildkröte was not well regarded when it first premiered. Due to this perception of it being too slow for frontline units, the vehicle was distributed among the Commonwealth's lower tier combat formations and planetary militia. However, over time the tank's durability would win over many with its performance in the field. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Skadi is a Fast Attack VTOL. It can reach a top speed of 162 km/h, and is protected by four and a half tons of Clan-spec Ferro-Fibrous Armor. The Skadi was originally designed by Clan Jade Falcon, but the main factory fell to the Lyran Commonwealth. For the next few decades, the Commonwealth sold the Skadi to any interested party. The combination of good protection, high speed, and a heavy gun proved to be very popular, and the Skadi was exported across the Inner Sphere. The Falcons later recaptured the facility and have restricted the Skadi to their own forces. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 125 18 Left 100 18 Right 100 18 Rear 90 18 Turret 15 18 Total 430 90 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: The Skulker Wheeled Scout is the much larger cousin of the Swift Wind scout car and originally based on the Heavy APC design. Due to it being larger than any scout car, it can act as a mobile communication outpost. With its advanced sensor suite which is tied to both its communication and targeting systems, it can navigate with only its sensors. While hot environments would normally wreak havoc upon its advanced electronics, the heat sinks from its Medium Laser cool the sensors while the laser is not in use. This allows it to operate in even the hottest environments where other scout vehicles cannot. The Skulker comes with four and a half tons of armor as standard. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 90 10 Left 90 10 Right 90 10 Rear 90 10 Total 360 40 Quirk: Improved Sensors

content.original: The key feature of the Sniper Artillery vehicle is its namesake weapon the forward-mounted Armstrong Industries Sniper Artillery Piece. Two forward-mounted ER Small Lasers and the two turret-mounted Machine Guns are secondary weapons at best. Twelve tons of standard armor give good coverage to most facings, and included CASE mitigates ammunition explosions. The Sniper's capabilities go beyond fire support Quikscell also added Limited Amphibious Equipment. More impressive is the four tons of Communications Equipment allowing it to function as a limited mobile command and control vehicle. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Limited Amphibious Values A S Front 240 40 Left 200 40 Right 200 40 Rear 120 40 Turret 200 40 Total 960 200 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short

content.original: The Sokar was developed by Clan Jade Falcon after the Jihad. The Falcons needed a vehicle to deal with large numbers of unarmed rioters on occupied worlds, and the police subcaste received the Sokar Urban Combat Unit. The Sokar's presence is often enough to dissuade the lower castes from continuing to riot for silly things like food. When it doesn't the Sokar's quartet of AP Gauss Rifles can reduce dozens of civilians to a pile of broken flesh in seconds. Assignment to a Sokar isn't desired, with only solahma units of the Falcon touman receiving it. Warriors dislike it because it is used to 'fight' non-warriors. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 25 Left 110 25 Right 110 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 80 25 Total 495 125 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short

content.original: Developed from concepts devised during the waning years of the Jihad, the SturmFeur (NLRM) rolled off the Defiance Industries production lines in 3083. Aiming to correct the main weaknesses of the classic model, the new model features a larger 340 rated XL Engine with a top speed of 65km/h. The standard LRM-20's are replaced with Enhanced models augmented by Artemis IV, halving the minimum range of the Tank with a Beagle Active Probe boosting short range awareness. CASE and Heavy Ferro Fibrous are added to round out the design. Production of this tank would be abandoned for the new line of ClanTech augmented models. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 350 45 Left 300 45 Right 300 45 Rear 280 45 Turret 300 45 Total 1530 225 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: Built to provide heavy fire support, the Sturmfeur (Support) is a specialised variant mounts an Arrow IV and 5 Thunderbolt-5's with an ER Small Laser for close range defence. A TAG allows the tank to tag targets for allied units. To fit the heavy payload, designers utilised a 255 rated Light Engine and Heavy Ferro Fibrous armour in order to create the needed weight. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Derided by critics and loved by its crews, the 25 ton Venator is a VTOL designed to hunt tanks. Slower then other contemporary VTOL’s, the low cost Venator makes up for it’s slower speed by mounting an AC/10 or a large missile launcher, giving it exceptionally heavy fire power for it’s small size. Produced by a handful of companies in the Periphery, the Venator is a common sight on the battlefields of the Periphery where it is often fielded in large quantities. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 70 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 35 15 Total 220 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. A Dark Age variant developed in 3114, this model is powered by an XXL Fusion Engine. It is armed with two AMS, two Clan-built LRM-15s, and twin TSEMP Cannons. The Targeting Computer remains as well. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Amazon battle armor was created by the Magistracy of Canopus. Based on the standard Inner Sphere battle armor, the Amazon uses advanced armor to increase protection and provides a jump capability of 90 meters. This allows Amazon-equipped troops to clear obstacles that would stop other battle armor units. The Amazon is used by both the Magistracy and the Capellan Confederation. Amazons deployed by the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces faced Cavalier battle armor and turned in a better performance. Quirk: Advanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The Apollo is designed to be a long range fire support BattleMech. This is accomplished by mounting an engine on the 'Mech that gives it a top speed of only 64.8 kph and eleven and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech was then armed with massive missile launchers which can rain destruction down on an enemy. While the Apollo has less than average speed for a medium 'Mech, if it is employed correctly the Apollo should have nothing to fear from enemy fire; it is fully capable of staying at the edge of the battlefield and laying down suppressive LRM fire. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: A post-Jihad Lyran Commonwealth take on the Combine's AS7-K introduced in 3082, the K2 model of the Atlas also used a Vlar XL Engine but increased its rating to 400, giving the K2 model a top speed of 64.8 km/h. Retaining only the Gauss Rifle and ER Large Lasers of the AS7-K, the K2 carried two Guided Technologies 2nd Gen Streak SRM-6 launchers. The K2 was protected with sixteen and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and, to protect against advanced enemy electronics, a Guardian ECM Suite. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The late Republic era AS7-S4 retained the majority of the -S3’s armament, but married it to stealth armor. The 'Mech was mainly kept within the Lyran Commonwealth forces, but some recently produced 'S4s disappeared under strange circumstances, only to reappear in the hands of some Mercenary Outfits attacking the Commonwealth's rivals. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The S3 Atlas is a rearmament of the S2 version introduced in 3062. The Heavy Gauss Rifle is reduced to a standard model Gauss Rifle with sixteen shots while each arm contains a PPC and a Small Laser. An additional small laser is mounted in the head. For extra defense, an AMS is installed on the left arm. The Artemis IV-enhanced LRM-15 and Guardian ECM Suite of the S2 model remain.

content.original: The production version of the BGS-4X, this Barghest uses the Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle, CASE II, and Quad BattleMech Turret of that variant. The PPCs and PPC Capacitors of that version have been removed to make room for an ER Large Laser and ER Medium Laser. The Small Cockpit remains, as does the C3 Slave. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.content: Боец

content.original: Katherine Steiner-Davion decided during her reign over the Lyran Alliance that she wanted a four legged BattleMech that would evoke fear in its enemies in a similar vein to the classic Atlas and Banshee designs. To do this, the Barghest is built on an Earthwerk GRF Quad chassis that supports a Magna 350 XL engine that saves weight and allows the 'Mech to carry a heavy weapons payload. The Barghest is protected by thirteen tons of Durallex Heavy armor that protects it from all but the heaviest enemy fire. To handle the 'Mech's heat buildup from its weapons, the Barghest has ten double heat sinks.

content.original: A specialist design from the Regulan Hussars, this variant replaces the traditional torso- and arm-mounted energy weapons with four Light AC/5s, two in each torso. It retains Small X-Pulse Lasers in the left arm, and a Streak SRM-6 is in the left torso. There is one ton of Streak ammo, but four tons of autocannon ammunition allows the 6C to carry special munitions for particular foes. The most important feature however is the Command Console in the BattleMaster's head. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster is one of the best known 'Mechs in existence. Originally designed to be the largest and most powerful 'Mech for the Star League armies in the 27th century, the sheer size of the BattleMaster, combined with the cost and resources needed to build one, meant the 'Mech can only be manufactured on a few planets. Still, those lucky enough to pilot a BattleMaster can attest to some of the stories surrounding the 'Mech. With good reliability, firepower and armoring, the BattleMaster is equally adept anchoring an assault lance or serving as a command vehicle.

content.original: Built by General Motors, ironically from production lines that originally built its supposed successor, the Warlord, a Hollis Mark X Endo Steel Chassis and GM 340 Light Fusion Engine provide a solid foundation for fifteen and a half tons of armor. Sixteen double heat sinks are fitted, dissipating the heat from a Magna Hellfire Heavy PPC, two Magna Bolt Light PPCs in each side torso, supplemented by a Holly Streak SRM-6 with one ton of ammunition in a CASE II ammo bay. Each side torso carries an Martell ER Small Laser to cover the rear arc, and two Martel-X Small X-Pulse Lasers are in the left arm to act as anti-infantry firepower. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: A mixed-tech brawler, the BLR-6R mounts a Clan-grade Rotary AC/5 in its right arm supported by a left torso–mounted Inner Sphere grade Streak SRM-6 rack, twin Light PPCs in each side torso and pair of rear-facing Improved Heavy Medium Lasers. Carrying three tons of RAC rounds and one ton of Streak reloads in CASE II–protected bays, this loadout is made possible by a Light Fusion Engine. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: This 3085 version uses an experimental XXL engine to boost ground speed to 86 km/h. An Endo Steel skeleton provides enough weight savings to allow this BattleMaster to carry an ER PPC, Heavy PPC, Streak SRM-6, and a pair of ER medium lasers. Sixteen Double Heat Sinks keep the temperature manageable. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.content:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Особенность: Легко управлять Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

Лимит приводов рук: Omni

content.original: The first update to the Chameleon line after the acquirement of the rights by J.B. BattleMechs, the new CLN-8V is the apotheosis of this rebranding. The variant able to serve every role from ab initio and advanced training, to front-line combatant. Combat models retain the heat management software of the original trainer, enabling it to simulate high-heat side effects without the risk, or to prevent the pilot from pushing the heat level past a pre-set limit. Since virtually anyone capable of piloting a 'Mech is familiar with the Chameleon, it is an easy sell to budget-conscious buyers eager to save on familiarization training. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: Scout
content.prevOriginal: Scout
content.content: Разведка

content.original: The Chameleon carried a basic arsenal that allowed a MechWarrior-in-training to learn the skill of heat management. The 'Mech's reliable low-tech arsenal had proven effective when forced into combat. The primary weapon was a Cyclops Eye Large Laser. This was backed up by two Intek Medium Lasers and a trio of Defiance B3S Small Lasers. To make the threat of overheating more real to the new MechWarrior, the 'Mech carried two Scatter Gun Light Machine Guns that can be used for anti-infantry training.

content.original:
Often maligned as one of the worst assault 'Mechs ever produced, the Snow Ravens have elevated the Charger. Upgraded to a fully Clan-spec 'Mech with MASC and a supercharger, the Charger C is able to fulfill the original design intent of a fast assault-class scout with firepower to match. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower
