content.original: Heavy Scout & Harasser
content.prevOriginal: Heavy Scout & Harasser
content.content: Тяжёлая разведка / Преследование

content.original: Because the designers of the Charger wanted to discourage any activities that would put the 'Mech in danger, the engineers at Wells Technologies equipped the Charger with five Magna Mk I Small Lasers, mounted in its arms, torso and head. As these leave the 'Mech dangerously undergunned, arguably its most potent weapons are its fists; if the Charger is able to close the distance and get within hand-to-hand combat, it is more than capable of pounding to pieces other 'Mechs, especially lightweight ones.

content.original:
The latest iteration of the Clint is a sensible upgrade rather than a revolution. It shares many components with the Cadaver. This is a great advantage in the Periphery, where new components are perpetually scarce, especially for a volatile 'Mech like the Clint. The upgrade removed many of its troublesome features, to the joy of technicians. Its weapons array benefited from concurrent developments. This includes X-pulse technology, first used by the Taurians on the Brahma, which had since reached maturity for full-scale production. The new Clint's reflective armor remains a gamble that could possibly undo its other logistical advantages Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. Produced by the Taurian Concordat at the outbreak of the Jihad, the 3-3T modifies the original 2-3T. It adds Ferro-Fibrous armor to the design and swaps out the AC/5 with a Light AC/5, presumably supplied to them by the Word of Blake. This lighter weapon makes room for the inclusion of CASE and two tons of ammunition, ensuring it is able to carry various types of munitions.
content.prevOriginal: The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. content.original: Khan Marthe Pryde decided to upgrade the 'Mechs her Clan fielded. Rather than waste precious resources designing a new OmniMech from the ground up, she instructed her scientists to improve upon existing designs. The design the scientists chose to modify was the Adder. Though the two 'Mechs are visually similar and share the same weight, the Cougar is slower and better armed.

content.original: Despite the standard Elemental's all-around utility, Clan Hell's Horses sought to enhance their Elementals mobility. The result of their work, Elemental II, discards Jump Jets and SRM pack in favor of battle armor myomer booster. The design didn't gain popularity and saw no interest from other clans, and Elemental II remains in limited service in Hell's Horses garrisons. Quirk: Elemental Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: After the ultimately failed Elemental II project, the Hell's Horses quest to improve Elementals didn't end. The Elemental III keeps the basic suit relevant for another century, incorporating a one-shot advanced SRM system to extend the suit’s reach and newly developed stealth armor to increase survivability. Quirk: BA Stealth (C) Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
The Eris started life as the prototype 'Hel' from Nasha Diversified, but when it failed to gather interest the design was sold to Kallon Weapon, eventually giving birth to the final design put into mass production. The 2H base variant uses an Endo Steel structure with a 250 XL engine and five jump jets. The weapons loadout consists of a Heavy PPC in the Right Arm, one Streak SRM 6 launcher and two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The 2N variant goes in even deeper for the fast skirmisher and flanker design concept, as it adds a Partial Wing at the cost of removing all external heat sinks. It's weaponry is also change to be more effective at sudden alpha strikes from behind, mounting a Snub-Nose PPC and two MML 5 launchers in combination with three Small X-Pulse lasers. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
The J configuration is a frightful variant that has only recently graced the battlefields of the Inner Sphere during the waning days of the Dark-Age. One of very few mechs to mount the massive HAG-40, the J has to utilize the entire right arm and part of the torso to house the weapon. A four-ton magazine in the right torso feeds the gun, giving it reasonable staying power. Backing up the HAG is an impressive array of three SRM-6 launchers in the left arm. The SRMs utilize a two-ton magazine housed alongside them in the arm. While lacking a true "knock out" weapon the sheer damage potential of this variant is staggering. Problematically, the J houses no backup energy weaponry and must leave the field should it expend all of its ammo. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Capable of reaching speeds of 87 km/h with it's MASC activated, the Executioner is a fast 95 ton Clan OmniMech. Powered by a 380 rated XL Engine, the Executioner has 26.5 tons of pod space. The MASC and 4 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis.

content.original:
The L configuration is truly a master of long range. Mounting the same tried and true dual ER Large Lasers of the Prime, the L's true claim to fame is its other armaments. Its left arm houses two Streak LRM-15 Launchers. A CASE II protected magazine holds four tons of ammunition in the left torso. The streak technology and deep ammo bin ensures the L a long life on the battlefield as none of its ammo will be wasted on missed shots. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Fenrir II Assault Battle Armor may have allegedly originated as the result of a bet between Archon Adam Steiner and Duke Vedet Brewer of Hesperus II, but Duke Brewer's vision of "a monstrous wolf straight from the nightmares of our ancestors" proved to be one of the most popular battle suits on the market after its introduction to service in 3119. Quirk: Advanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.896 Can only mount internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original:
The -M3 is a modification of the -M2 introduced in 3104 that has been optimized for artillery spotting. The 'Mech has removed the three flamers mounted in the left arm, replacing them with a single ER small laser, added a TAG laser designator to the right torso, allowing it to spot for artillery, and MASC, which allows it to move at up to 129.6 km/h. The -M3 also dropped a single double heat sink but added another half ton of armor, giving it a total of seven and a half tons of standard armor. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: One of the more common 'Mechs during large parts of the Succession Wars, the Firestarter is built for one purpose alone - to overheat enemies and then overwhelm them. Later models also started seeing use as a capable scout, showing the versatility of the base design.

content.original:
Another reworking of the -M2 variant debuting in 3109, the M4 strips out a double heat sink, the ER medium laser and the three flamers mounted in the left arm. The -M4 upgrades the engine to 210-rated XL engine and mounts a single RAC/2 in the left arm, supplied with one ton of ammunition stored in the left torso. The -M4 also adds another half ton of standard armor. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth G is armed with 4 Improved Heavy Medium Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. A Supercharger pushes the Fire Moth to even faster speeds. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: Based on the original Flamberge BattleMech prototype, the Flamberge 2 is a 70 ton Mech and test bed for the Partial Wing. A 280 rated XL Engine and Endo Steel provide the free weight needed to mount 6 Improved Jump jets and a Partial Wing. 2 SRM-6's and a Large Pulse Laser form the main armament with 4 Medium Pulse Lasers and a Micro Pulse Laser for closer ranges. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
Developed in the later years of the Jihad by the Jade Falcons, the Flamberge was based on an older experiment involving Partial Wing technology. A 70 ton OmniMech, the Flamberge is built around a 280 rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel chassis with 13.5 tons of armour. 11 DHS are installed as standard, as are a pair of SRM-6's with 35 tons of podspace rounding out the design. The Flamberge D is armed with a pair of IS Plasma Rifles and 4 Medium pulse Lasers with 4 Jump Jets boosting the designs mobility and 5 extra DHS offsetting the increased heat load. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: This is a Capellan Confederation variant introduced in 3082. A larger engine increases the top speed of the Goliath to approximately 86 km/h. Equipped with Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite for protection, the 'Mech carries an ER PPC and two MML-7s. Though the ammo in the side torso is protected by CASE, the ammo in the center torso isn't. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: An 80 ton Quad Mech, the Goliath entered production in 2652. Partially based on data from the earlier Scorpion Quad Mech, the Goliath carries a heavier payload of weapons and armour, intended to boost it’s effectiveness on the battlefield. Powered by a 320 rated Fusion Core, the Goliath GOL-1H is armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-10’s. A pair of Machine Guns provide closer ranged firepower.

content.original: The Grand Dragon is the successful follow-up to the Dragon BattleMech. Just like the Dragon, the Grand Dragon quickly became a favorite in the DCMS, with nearly every line unit fielding a company of either design. Production of the Grand Dragon continued unabated until the Jihad, when the Word of Blake devastated LAW's factories in 3068. It took two years for LAW to get new Grand Dragon factories up and running, the first on Nykvarn followed by Abiy Adi and Savinsville, and ensure the continued use of the 'Mech in years to come.

content.original:
The G configurations main purpose is to be mobile enough to scout forward locations and still being able to deal with unexpected infantry troops. To achieve this the pod-based loadout includes 5 Micro Pulse Lasers and 4 Medium Pulse Lasers. The addition of a Watchdog CEWS electronics suite ensures the configuration is able to scout enemy forces without being easily detected. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: In 3083, the Nova Cats started refitting some older IICs to test their newly acquired, experimental Streak LRMs. Dubbed the IIC 7, the new variant has a top speed of 118 kph. Right torso LRM 5s are replaced with a single Streak LRM-10 launcher, and a Streak SRM 6 replaces the LRM 5s in the left torso. Each is backed up by an ER medium pulse laser. The IIC 7 uses standard jump jets, but coaxes out 210 meters of jump capacity. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

A mild evolution of the GLT-5M, the -7M boosts the Guillotine’s long-range firepower with a capacitor-boosted ER PPC backed-up by twin light PPCs. A pair of ER medium lasers and an ammo efficient Streak SRM 6 round out the weaponry. Durability is enhanced with CASE II, which reputedly also corrects the intermittent missile arming problems that plagued the original system from its inception Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Designed in 2499 for the Terran Hegemony and later the SLDF, the Guillotine served as a heavy raider; using a combination of speed and Jump Jets to out manoeuvre opponents. The Guillotine 3N is armed with a Large Laser and a quartet of Medium Lasers, backed up by an SRM-6 for close range engagements.

content.original:
Built for speed, firepower, and simplicity, the Gyrfalcon became common in Jade Falcon Stars. Its 275-Rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine would help propel the design into the battlefield at 86 kph and at bursts to 108 kph with the help of its MASC. Included in its construction is a Partial Wing, which gives the design the ability to jump further than the normal 150 meters that its Jump Jets would be capable of. In addition to its regular sensors, the engineers would fit a Light Active Probe in the 'Mech's head to help it identify potential enemy targets.While it has been noted that its MechWarriors have it customized for their purposes, this design's original weapons layout consisted of two Series 6b Extended Range Large Lasers and two Type OVR-V LB 2-X ACs mounted in its shortened arms actuators. In addition to these ranged weapons systems, engineers would go on to reinforce the Gyrfalcon's legs. This is a nod to their touman changing its attitude towards the use of physical attacks, namely using Death from Above maneuver. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Hellion is a product of Clan Ice Hellion and their philosophy that espouses speed above all else. Based on the Mist Lynx, the Hellion is a fast OmniMech that has respectable firepower. This light 'Mech is rather difficult to kill, incorporating five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. To save weight, the Hellion also uses an Endo Steel chassis. While it is not especially fast for its size, the Hellion does use MASC to allow for bursts of additional speed. The Hellion sports no fixed weapons on its chassis. The primary configuration consists of four ER Medium Lasers as well as a trio of Streak SRM-2s, which make it a potent headhunter 'Mech. It also packs an LRM-10 to harass enemies at range. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A very formidable and mobile light unit, as most Clan designs tend to be. Enough armor so that a single alpha strike usually is not able to cripple it, and enough speed to get away from trouble, it can be as persistent as a cockroach at times. Oh, and it sports quite the bite too.

content.original:
The Hellion is a product of Clan Ice Hellion and their philosophy that espouses speed above all else. Based on the Mist Lynx, the Hellion is a fast OmniMech that has respectable firepower. This light 'Mech is rather difficult to kill, incorporating five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. To save weight, the Hellion also uses an Endo Steel chassis. While it is not especially fast for its size, the Hellion does use MASC to allow for bursts of additional speed. The Hellion sports no fixed weapons on its chassis. The P configuration seems to have a single design goal, mount as many pulse lasers on the Hellion as possible - no matter their size - by sporting a total of eight Micro Pulse Lasers. However, it also manages to fit four ER Micro Lasers and three Improved Heavy Medium Lasers, a supercharge, a TAG and an ECM suite. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Hel HL-1 does not bring anything more fancy than a Heavy PPC, a single Streak SRM-6 launcher and two ER Medium Lasers, but this also keeps the mech quite reliable and easy to maintain. The Endo Steel structure saves enough weight to also fit a 250 XL engine, making the 'Mech quite mobile. Five jump jets add to the mobility, resulting in the 'Mechs common role of a fast flanker performing hit and run strikes. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Hermit Crab doesn't make use of many advanced technologies, eschewing an XL Engine or Endo Steel for a standard fusion plant and chassis. In fact the only advanced technology is found in the ten double heat sinks and ER Medium Lasers it carries into combat. Though larger, heavier and less efficient than many similar systems, the reliance on simple, proven technology makes the Hermit Crab popular on Periphery worlds and with military commands. The engine powers it to a top speed of 118km/h and seven jump jets allow it to cover 210 meters. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: The Hippogriff is a Clan Snow Raven design, which was created as part of their need for additional ground troops for their Touman. Made as a companion to the Gorgon, the Hippogriff was designed as a mobile light fire support unit. Considered to be a Heavy ProtoMech, the design is lightly armed for its size. Its only weaponry is a pair of LRM 2 Launchers. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: Designed for the Republic of the Sphere in 3085, this Hunchback is based on the HBK-7X-4. Unlike that unit however, the -7R uses a Standard Cockpit and lacks the Armored Gyro. The Reinforced Structure and CASE II systems remain, as does the Mydron Excel Ultra AC/10 and arm-mounted Diverse Optics Sunfire ER Medium Lasers. Unlike the experimental model, this Hunchback carries ten tons of Light Ferro-Fibrous armor for protection, incorporates TAG in the head, and carries a Guardian ECM Suite to interfere with enemy electronics. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The newest generation of Falcon OmniMechs represents a rift in design philosophy that mirrors the rift inside the Clan. The savage adherents of Malvina Hazen pilot more stylized ’Mechs like the Gyrfalcon and Shrike, whereas more moderate warriors prefer the toned-down aesthetics of newer machines like the Jade Phoenix, just as they prefer a toned down version of combat. The Jade Phoenix embodies what it means to be a true Jade Falcon, as did its namesake, the legendary Aidan Pryde.

content.prevOriginal: Clan OmniMech
content.content: Клановый омнимех

content.original: The newest generation of Falcon OmniMechs represents a rift in design philosophy that mirrors the rift inside the Clan. The savage adherents of Malvina Hazen pilot more stylized ’Mechs like the Gyrfalcon and Shrike, whereas more moderate warriors prefer the toned-down aesthetics of newer machines like the Jade Phoenix, just as they prefer a toned down version of combat. The Jade Phoenix embodies what it means to be a true Jade Falcon, as did its namesake, the legendary Aidan Pryde.

content.original:
The Jade Phoenix combines a 340-rated XL engine with Endo-Composite structure and Ferro-Fibrous armor to free enough weight capacity to be able to fits its four jump jets and partial wing system while still keep enough free for good weapons. The main armament is a HAG/30 supported by two ER PPCs and to handle all the generated heat the 'Mech carries 18 double heat sinks. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: The Jaguar mounted a ATM 6 Launcher in a Quad BattleMech Turret installed in the right torso, supplied with two tons of ammunition. The Jaguar also mounted a pair of ER Medium Lasers in each torso alongside a SRM 2 Launcher; supplied from a single ton of ammunition stored in the left torso. As a Clan design, both torsos were automatically protected by CASE. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: A quadrupedal scout 'Mech featuring a number of advanced Clan technological features, the Jaguar proved to be a success, spreading quickly amongst the various mercenary units working for the Lyran Commonwealth. Capable of deploying in a variety of roles including mobile fire support, reconnaissance and search-and-destroy missions, the Jaguar was powered by a Light Force 280 extra-light fusion engine that could propel it at speeds of almost a hundred and thirty kilometers per hour.

content.original: This variant removes all of the weapons from the original Jaguar except a single ER Medium Laser in each torso; the turret is removed to fix CASE in it. In place of the original weapons payload the Jaguar 2 carries a trio of Machine Guns in each of the left and right torsos, each trio arranged as a Machine Gun Array, as well as adding a Medium Pulse Laser alongside each Machine Gun Array. The remaining payload is taken up by an advanced electronics suite consisting of a Targeting Computer mounted in the right torso, and an Active Probe and a Light TAG system mounted in the center torso. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

The CRK-5006-1 is a further upgrade of the CRK-5003-J. Keeping the improved jump jets and Light PPCs paired with ER Medium Lasers, the remainder of the weapons have been changed. The LBX has been replaced by a Gauss Rifle, and the SRM launchers with their Streak brethren. The switch to an Endo Steel frame allows enough weight saved to also add C.A.S.E. II protection to both side torsos. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: The Katana began its existence when the Draconis Combine was given several downgraded Crockett BattleMechs by ComStar as part of Operation Rosebud. Independence Weaponry reverse-engineered the weapons so they could produce copies at a nearby facility and closely examined the Crocketts for several months. After making minor modifications these 'Mechs were renamed Katanas and used to replace Chargers in several DCMS units. The Katana quickly become a mainstay in many of the heavier mobile line units, especially after the invention of the C3 Computer. The Katana still shares many of the same features as the Crockett, right down to the serial number.

content.original:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of fire power and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox K is armed with an Improved Heavy Large Laser. An LB-10X provides close range firepower. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Kodiak II's long-range weaponry revolves around pair of arm mounted 20-tubed Long-Range Missile Launchers, backed up by a single 10-tubed LRM launcher found in the left torso. These missile launchers are guided by Artemis IV Fire Control Systems, allowing the 'Mech weapons to deliver its multiple tons of ammunition on target. Backing up the missile launchers is an Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon, found in the right torso. While it does need to close into brawling range to use them, the Kodiak II also has eight Extended Ranged Small Lasers split between the 'Mech's two arm actuators. All the 'Mech's energy weapons are tied into a Targeting Computer found in the center torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: The Kodiak II was built upon what Clan Ghost Bear learned and liked with the original Kodiak. The Kodiak II quickly became known for its Command facilities and its endurance. The powerful 'Mech carries 19 tons of Standard armor, giving it heavy resistance against weapons fire directed at it. At the heart of the machine is a 400-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine, which while not as quick as other designs its weight saving qualities allows the 'Mech to carry is substantial weapons load out.

content.original:
Though powerful, the original Kodiak lacked sufficient long range weaponry and did not come close to mounting its full compliment of armor. In 3095, saKhan Ragnar of Clan Ghost Bear tasked the technician caste with developing a variant that would resolves these setbacks. A first prototype of the new version designated V1 sported two LRM-20 and one LRM-10 launchers, an ER PPC and replaces the eight Medium Lasers with ER Small Lasers. This version also adds jump jets to the design, allowing the 'Mech to jump over 90 meters. The core concept behind this design is what eventually evolved into the Kodiak II. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Bearing the distinction of being the second Mech to be created by the Capellan Confederation, the Koschei began production in 2504 though production would cease during the Succession Wars; with production restarting during the Jihad. A 65 ton Mech, the Koschei 6L is powered by a 325 rated Light Fusion Engine giving it a top speed of 86km/h. A Sniper Canon with 2 tons of ammo is the Mechs main gun with 4 Medium Lasers as backup weapons. A Targeting Computer enhances the accuracy of the Lasers while Triple Strength Myomer boosts the Mechs speed. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

content.original: The Longbow, introduced in 2480, has seen service in the armies of the Inner Sphere since the days of the Star League and is one of the most well-known fire support 'Mechs in existence. As a fire-support 'Mech though, the Longbow is a trusted and reliable machine that can be counted on to carry out the mission it is designed for. The primary weapons on the Longbow are its LRM launchers, four in all, a pair of 20s and a pair of 5s, letting the Longbow put out 50 LRMs into any target it can see.

content.original:
Though bearing a remarkable outward resemblance to the Timberwolf, this BattleMech is a new and powerful creation. This variant removes the Gauss Rifles and Jump Jets and replaces them with a HAG/30 in each arm. The side torsos each mount an LRM-10 and a pair of ER Medium Lasers. A Light Active Probe is mounted in the head, and the remaining tonnage is given over to more armor protection. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Designed by the Marian Hegemony using the most cutting-edge gear available to them, the Marauder Battle Armor is patterned after the venerable Marauder BattleMech. Armed with a pair of Support PPCs and a Light Recoilless Rifle, the Marauder BA is one of the most heavily armed BA in existence. The Marians deploy them in squads of five called a contubernium and the suits are designed for that kind of larger deployment. While not particularly well armored, their extreme firepower load for battle armor makes them deadly on the field. Quirk: Marauder Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.895 Can mount any unit, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original:
Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolfs Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 300 rated Light Engine, the Marauder II MAD-6S is armed with a Gauss Rifle, paired ER PPC’s and Medium Pulse Lasers. AMS and an ER Small Laser round out the design. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The MCY-105 Mercury is a redesign that avoids the notorious Myomer Acceleration Signal Circuitry-lock that has long hindered the scout. It uses a higher-rated XL engine to turn the 'Mech into a fast raider. The redesign was otherwise conservative due to its speed, favoring off-the-shelf weapons instead of pursuing a modern 'Omni-Mercury' upgrade. While not an OmniMech, the MCY-105 remains easy to repair and modify, leading to countless field refits by Republican troops often involving assorted electronics in lieu of its mix of ER lasers Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.original:
Designed as a close range brawler, the Merlin 1M is marketed to smaller periphery states and mercenary commands in the market for a cut price heavy mech. Replacing the traditional PPC with an AC/10 and removing the anti-personnel weapons, allows for an extra pair of Medium Lasers to be added.With a third less heatsinks than the usual Merlin designs, pilots will need to be careful with their heat or risk a premature ammo explosion. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. A 25 ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175 rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx I is armed with a Narc Beacon and 5 SRM-2’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx I is armed with a Narc Beacon and 5 SRM-2’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Long regarded as a pocket Assault OmniMech, the Nova Cat sacrifices speed for firepower. With over half of its tonnage dedicated to weapons, ammunition, and equipment, the Nova Cat packs a punch in all configurations. Some recent configurations increased the speed and agility that Clan customers typically desire.

content.original:
This version introduced in 3083 was based on the earlier ON3-MX, although it addresses some of the shortcomings of that 'Mech and shares many of the same features as the ON1-M. Providing a more balanced weapon suite it still carries an Extended LRM-15 with four tons of ammo and an ER medium laser in each arm but instead uses a Grand Slam Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo in the right torso. It also uses CASE II to protect the ammunition and has a head-mounted TAG system to call in artillery. Initial feedback and advanced orders convinced Kali Yama to switch most of their Orion production lines over to making the ON3-M in 3086, but were soon set back a few years later when pressure from the Republic of the Sphere caused the Federated Suns to cancel their order. The company has seen sold the 'Mech at below-market prices and suffered financial hardship. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Ostroc carries as its primary weapons two Fuersturm-C Large Lasers in the left and right torsos. These give the Ostroc good medium to long range damage capabilities. The Ostrocs secondary weapons are two Fuersturm-b Medium Lasers also mounted in the side torsos and a Totschlagen SRM-4 launcher in the right torso for close-range combat, with one ton of reloads carried in the center torso. While the Ostroc's laser-heavy weapons payload allows it to operate well as a guerrilla fighter since it has limited dependency on supply lines, its short arms are a handicap in close combat, and the shocks of hand-to-hand fighting can easily damage the Fuersturm systems.

content.original: Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360 rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom Prime is armed with an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A TAG unit, Active Probe and ECM suite allow it to act as a scout, while an LRM-5 gives it some ranged capabilities.

content.original: The Pouncer was originally a test bed design that was upgraded to combat specifications on the orders of then-IlKhan Ulric Kerensky, as it was realized that a more mobile 'Mech was needed when combating Inner Sphere forces. The Pouncer is built on a lightweight DSAM Endo 4 Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a 240 XL engine which gives it a maximum speed of 97.2 km/h. The 'Mech's mobility is enhanced with five Grandthrust Mk. Four jump jets that allow it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. For protection from enemy fire, the Pouncer has a respectable six tons of Forging ZM15 Ferro-Fibrous armor. Overall, the Pouncer is an excellent OmniMech with fifteen and a half tons of pod space, allowing it to carry a wide variety of weapons payloads.

content.original: The -8P is based on the experimental -8X. The major differences are the removal of the stealth armor and the head turret. This reduces production cost considerably, but leaves the head-mounted PPC unable to cover the Quickdraw's retreat. The other advanced systems, including the torso cockpit, remain. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The Quickdraw was originally built in 2779 as a replacement for the Rifleman BattleMech. While it was unsuccessful in supplanting the Rifleman, over time the Quickdraw proved itself to be a good generalist 'Mech. Packing excellent firepower, solid armor protection and above-average speed, it quickly earned the respect of many MechWarriors and status as a workhorse in every Successor State's military.

content.original: This variant is protected by light ferro-fibrous armor. Each arm carries a single large laser which is tied into a targeting computer. The left torso also carries a single LRM-15 with three tons of ammunition in a CASE II–protected bay. A TAG system allows it to call in artillery strikes. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
In the 3120s, Independence Weaponry secretly built the Raijin -301-B. This variant kept much of the original RJN-200-A, but altered the armor and weapons to serve its future role in Malcolm Buhl's reconstituted Com Guard. They adapted and improved the older Tessen's endo-steel frame. For firepower, Independence kept the -101-C's triple-mount of ER medium lasers, while two SRM-6 launchers and an iNarc were added. CASE II protected these systems. This effort turned Buhl's Raijins into well-protected artillery spotters and scouts. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Raijin was designed after the Battle of Tukayyid to rearm ComGuard units that had suffered losses in the campaign. Despite having stockpiled Star League-era BattleMechs at his disposal, Precentor Martial Focht wanted something unfamiliar to both the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

content.original: Designed by the Marian Hegemony using the most cutting-edge gear available to them, the Ravager is made with the best technology available to the Hegemony. The Marian Hegemony soon began marketing the suit for sale to the open market to help bolster the Hegemony's coffers. The Marians deploy them in squads of five called a contubernium and the suits are designed for that kind of larger deployment. While not particularly well armed, the Ravager has extensive armor coverage, making them extremely durable on the battlefield. Quirk: Advanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9 Can only mount internal bays, can melee, can not swarm.

content.original: The Sagittaire is built to fight in the confines of an urban battlefield. Weighing in at a massive ninety-five tons, the Sagittaire started production in mid-3063 and began to trickle out to units clamoring for close combat 'Mechs in the midst of the FedCom Civil War. As a power source, the 'Mech has a 285 XL engine. The XL engine saves weight at the cost of survivability and gives the 'Mech a top speed of 54.0 km/h while its mobility is enhanced with three jump jets, allowing the 'Mech to jump up to ninety meters.

The Salamander PPR-7T is armed with a trio of Extended LRM-15’s. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: A very mobile design thanks to its 250-Rated extra-light fusion engine and the use of a TSM in its construction. A number of weapons are mounted in its turret, including a heavy PPC, light PPC, and one of the 'Mech's two ER medium lasers. Its other ER medium laser is installed in the 'Mech's center torso, with the Beagle Active Probe, and a ER small laser is mounted in its head. To take advantage of the 'Mech's TSM, each leg actuator is fitted with spikes Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Sarath was the former Free Worlds League first OmniMech. The 'Mech was named for the assumed guise of the mystic Hindu god Krishna. One of the 'Mech's most distinguishing traits was that it was constructed using a combination of advanced Inner Sphere and Clan technologies. The Sarath was constructed as an OmniMech, one of its distinguishing features being that 15 of its 19 tons of pod capacity were placed in the BattleMech turret. The 'Mech also had been designed to have enhanced movement and strength, in comparison to other similar designs.

content.original: This configuration of the Sarath is configured for a fire support role. Using Clan Sea Fox as its supplier for some its weapons, the 'Mech boasts two Clan 15-tubed long-range missile launchers and two multi-missile launchers found in the turret. The 'Mech's ammunition is stored mostly in the 'Mech's four legs. Enhanced mobility is achieved by fitting it with five jump jets. The configuration's only energy weapon, aside from its fixed laser, is a Clan version ER small laser mounted in the center torso. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Sarath was the former Free Worlds League first OmniMech. The 'Mech was named for the assumed guise of the mystic Hindu god Krishna. One of the 'Mech's most distinguishing traits was that it was constructed using a combination of advanced Inner Sphere and Clan technologies. The Sarath was constructed as an OmniMech, one of its distinguishing features being that 15 of its 19 tons of pod capacity were placed in the BattleMech turret. The 'Mech also had been designed to have enhanced movement and strength, in comparison to other similar designs.

content.original: Designed for close assault, the Sarath B, features a single plasma rifle, two medium lasers, and four ER flamers fitted into its turret. For use in melee combat, four Clan produced talons are mounted, one in each of the 'Mech's feet. When combined with the TSM, the talons allow the Sarath-B to demonstrate its physical prowess. The plasma rifle is allotted two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Sheng Long is a Quad type Heavy Class Battle Armor produced for both the Capellan Confederation and its close-allies in the Magistracy of Canopus. Designed with speed and firepower in mind, the Sheng Long employs its modular turret and stealth to out maneuver and assist in ambushing of enemy combat units. Quirk: Mimetic Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.892 Can only mount internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original: Developed by the Scorpion Empire, the OmniMech version of the Snow Fox borrows much of its initial design of the its older brother, the standard Snow Fox. Protected by four tons of armor, an Endo Steel chassis and XL engine allow the 'Mech to reach top speeds of 120km/h. Finally a permanently-mounted MASC system allows the Prime to sprint at speeds of up to 164km/h.

content.original:
Unlike many Lyran BattleMechs, the SPR-6F was directly commissioned by the LCAF. The Spector had performed admirably as a headhunter since its reintroduction in the mid-3050s, but variants' stealth systems were often inadequate against sharpshooters in the Jade Falcon or Wolf toumans. Tailor-made to beat Clan warriors at their own game, the -6F does so not through subterfuge but through sheer engineering. It can keep up with the nimblest of 'Mechs, reflective armor defeats advanced Clan lasers, and a targeting computer unerringly places its weapons on target. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: Reintroduced in 3053, the Spector mounts a Magna 245 XL engine in combination with an XL Engine and an  Endo Steel chassis. It carries seven and a half tons of armor along with seven jump jets. The Spector carries a Nightwind Large Laser as its primary weapon,  backed up by a pair of Defiance B3M Medium Lasers and a single Defiance B4S Small Laser for close combat. Defensively the Spector carries a Norse Guardian ECM Suite that allows it to defend itself against advanced enemy targeting and range finding equipment.

content.original: A post-Jihad variant developed by the Combine in 3084, the SDR-8K uses a Compact Gyro and a 240 XL Fusion Engine to maintain its ground speed while allowing it to carry four tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the extra weight left being used to swap the lasers of the stock Spider for a single torso mounted PPC Capacitor-enhanced Snub-Nose PPC. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Spider 5V is hands down the most maneuverable 'Mech you can field, but it's made of paper. It's an excellent scout, though, and can even jump into the rear arc of most enemies for surprise back shots.
content.prevOriginal: The Spider 5V is hands down the most maneuverable 'Mech you can field, but it's made of paper. It's an excellent scout, though, and can even jump into the rear arc of most enemies for surprise back shots.

content.original: A post-Jihad variant produced by Krupp Armament Works for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084, the production model 8R was based on the prototype SDR-8X that used during the liberation of Terra. Built on an Endo Steel chassis and powered by a smaller 210 Light Fusion Engine - while its ground speed was reduced, the SDR-8R's ten Pitban LFT-20X Improved Jump Jets gave it amazing maneuverability. Carrying ten double heat sinks allowed the 8R to fire its twin Diverse Optics ER Medium Lasers and jump without fear of overheating. Boasting a very different look, the redesigned 8R was also notable for being one of the first Spiders to include an ejection system. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Spider -9M was not a grand evolution of the chassis. Instead, it derived directly from preceding variants. Unwilling to gamble on reverse-engineered Clan weaponry, the -9M replaces the prior pulse laser loadouts with variable speed medium lasers. While Nimakachi touts the -9M's 'greatly increased' short-range firepower as the basis for its high sales, customers indicate that demand for the model is only due to the desperation of the mid-thirty-second century. Industry watchers have been critical partly due to the absence of the promised ejection seat, but primarily because the -9M's weaponry doubles in mass for no significant increase in range. The new Spider could be outperformed by units with lighter weapon arrays. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
content.prevOriginal: The Spider -9M was not a grand evolution of the chassis. Instead, it derived directly from preceding variants. Unwilling to gamble on reverse-engineered Clan weaponry, the -9M replaces the prior pulse laser loadouts with variable speed medium lasers. While Nimakachi touts the -9M's 'greatly increased' short-range firepower as the basis for its high sales, customers indicate that demand for the model is only due to the desperation of the mid-thirty-second century. Industry watchers have been critical partly due to the absence of the promised ejection seat, but primarily because the -9M's weaponry doubles in mass for no significant increase in range. The new Spider could be outperformed by units with lighter weapon arrays. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Spider is hands down the most maneuverable 'Mech you can field, but it's made of paper. It's an excellent scout, though, and can even jump into the rear arc of most enemies for surprise back shots.

content.original: The Stalking Spider II features most notably a heavy large laser along with a pair of SRM-4 launchers. Due to a design flaw, the ammunition feed for the SRM launchers occasionally explodes from the ammunition feed into the turret. Rounding out its weaponry, the 'Quad features a pair of heavy machine guns mounted in the left torso. The Stalking Spider II is protected by 9.5 tons of standard armor, which includes its built-in CASE that minimizes damage from ammunition explosions. With its 225-rated standard fusion engine, the Spider is able to move at a maximum speed of 86 km/h. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Stalking Spider II is a Clan Medium BattleMech designed and produced by Clan Sea Fox at its Manufacturing Plant SFF-TU1 on Tukayyid. Produced since the dawn of the thirty-second century, the Stalking Spider II was a result of the merchant Clan’s desire to bring more revenue into its coffers. The Clan redesigned the original Stalking Spider Quad 'Mech with new innovations, but these "innovations" began being problematic for its pilots, due to a unique turret design. It proved to be popular with Inner Sphere second-line defense units, despite its shortcomings.

content.original:
A 55 ton OmniMech that blends a lethal cocktail of speed and firepower, the Stormcrow is a common sight in many clan Toumans. Powered by a 330 rated XL Engine and built with a combination of an Endo Steel chassis and Ferro Fibrous armor, the Stormcrow has 19 tons of pod space available. The Stormcrow J is armed with a HAG/30 and an Improved Heavy Large Laser. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Originally rumored to be a light or ultralight LAM, the Svartalfa was a well-kept secret until its live-fire test against Clan Wolf where it saw great success. At first confusing the Wolves as to what it was -- too small to be a 'Mech, too large to be a Proto or battle armor -- the defending Wolf warriors were forced into deploying medium and heavy 'Mechs to deal with even a single Svartalfa. Quirk: UltraHeavy WiGE ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The original variant of the Tarantula is armored with four and a half tons of armor, while it only carries about three quarters of the theoretical maximum armor, the 'Mech's amazing speed makes the Tarantula capable of avoiding most damage. As the design is focused on scouting, the Tarantula carries a light armament that is common to a 'Mech of its size and role. The primary weapons are a pair of medium lasers which give the Tarantula most of its striking power. These are backed up by a Streak SRM-2 launcher, which allows the Tarantula to find any weak spots in an enemy's armor. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: The Tarantula was designed specifically for a reconnaissance role. The 'Mech is built around a massive 200 XL engine, which provides the Tarantula with a top speed approaching 130 km/h. The 'Mech is also equipped with eight jump jets which can be used to propel the 'Mech up to 240 meters allowing the Tarantula to easily navigate rough terrain.

content.original:
The Templar III is a Dark Age era Assault Class OmniMech, first produced by General Motors for the Federated Suns. It was intended as a replacement for the original Templar, whose factory lines were destroyed during the Jihad. General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

It was intended as a replacement for the original Templar, whose factory lines were destroyed during the Jihad. General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies.

content.original: Fast and well-armed for its weight, the Tiburon can be used in scout and attack formations alike. Mounting a pair of ER medium lasers in each arm, and backed up by two SRM-2 launchers and twin ER small lasers, the Tiburon can quickly close with an enemy and inflict damage before moving out of range again. Making matters worse for its opponents, the Tiburon carries a Watchdog CEWS to not only interfere with their electronics, but also assist in finding them from farther distances, and the lasers are all connected to an accurate targeting computer. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: The Tiburon is a name that hearkens back to when Clan Sea Fox was known as Clan Diamond Shark. The Tiburon is named after a large Terran shark found in the Caribbean, the design was created as the Clan transformed itself from a decimated-yet-centralized military force to a nomadic, spacefaring society of warrior-merchants. The Tiburon is just as lethal as its namesake and unlike most other 'Mechs built by the Sea Foxes, the Tiburon is not for sale and is used exclusively by its own warriors.

content.original:
A brutal short-ranged combatant, the Timber Wolf W mounts a mammoth Ultra AC/20 in the right torso, supported by a Streak SRM-6 rack in each side torso, a ER Small Laser in the left torso, and twin ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. Carrying four tons of UAC rounds and single ton of missiles for the ammo efficient Streak launchers, a Supercharger allows the W config to close within optimum range as quickly as possible. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Tomahawk II is designed around the use of a DSAM Endo 10-Composite internal structure, which gives the design its cavernous pod capacity of 56 tons. The 'Mech is powered by a 300-Rated Starfire Extra-Light Fusion Engine, giving it a maximum speed of 54 kph. Protecting the engine and the Tomahawk II's other vitals is 19 tons of Advanced/3 standard armor, providing nearly maximum protection against enemy fire. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Introduced during the cusp of the Dark Ages, the -B-9 combines two MML-5 launchers with a Light PPC for some decent firepower considering its weight class. A single Medium Laser provides secondary fire capabilities and a Guardian ECM allows basic electronic warfare. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. Based on captured Firebees, the Toro is a long range support mech.  Armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-5s the Toro carried two tons of ammo and 10 single heat sinks. The last Toro factory was demolished in 2598 by invading Star League troops and production would not resume until the Word of Blake Jihad.

content.original: The TR-XB is protected by 16 tons of Durallex Heavy Armor, with CASE embedded into its right torso. The 'Mech uses a XL 285 rated Fusion Engine as its source of power, to aid the 'Mech's ability to cope with a lack of rear-facing weapons and a modest top speed, the design was also given five Improved Jump Jets. The Trebaruna was designed to fight its opponents at long ranges, with its main weapon being its right torso-mounted Gauss Rifle, with 2 tons of ammunition, and supported by three Light PPC found in the opposite torso. These weapons are guided by a Targeting Computer located in the 'Mech's left torso. The Trebaruna is fitted with ten double heat sinks to help cope with its weapon and engine heat. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: The Trebaruna is a Quad configured Assault BattleMech that was originally designed by the Word of Blake Protectorate. Production plans were canceled by the Word of Blake in 3078, when Allied Coalition forces were finally closing in on Terra. The design was discovered by Coalition members, and was offered to all the partners. The design was put into production by the Republic of the Sphere as part of its newly-formed armed forces in 3081, followed shortly after by the Marik-Stewart Commonwealth and Capellan Confederation.

content.original: Introduced during the later stages of the Republic in 3115, this Trebaruna's Composite Skeleton is protected by Hardened Armor. This variant's maximum jump range is reduced to 120 meters. It carries an Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle as its main armament, supported by an ER PPC. The PPC is mounted in a Quad Turret to provide a wide field of fire. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: Produced by the Free Worlds League splinter nation, the Marik-Stewart Commonwealth 3081, the XJ variant differed from the original XB mostly in secondary weapons and targeting equipment. Its Targeting Computer was removed and the Light PPCs were replaced by a pair of Snub-Nose PPCs. In addition, the 'Mech's armor coverage and Double Heat Sink quantity were increased. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: This variant is produced by the Capellan Confederation in 3081, whose soldiers had discovered the Blakist design during their liberation efforts in the later part of the Jihad. The variant replaced the Gauss Rifle with an LB 20-X Class Autocannon, and the Light PPCs were changed out for a pair of Plasma Rifles. The 'Mech's ammunition is protected by CASE in the left torso, while the design's armor has been increased to 17.5 tons. To allow for the additional armor and new equipment, the standard Fusion Engine was exchanged for a Light Fusion Engine. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original:
Introduced in 2940, the Viper is a 40 ton OmniMech that emphasizes speed and armour, with only 8.5 tons of podspace available for weapons. A 320 rated XL Engine powers the Viper and 8 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis, further improving the mobility. The Viper R is armed with a pair of ER Medium Lasers and a Narc Beacon. A Light TAG and a Bloodhound Active Probe improve the Scouting capabilities of the Viper. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Fusion Core, the Warhammer WHM-8R is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers, Machine Guns and a Streak SRM-6 deter opponents from closing in. CASE II rounds out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The Warhawk's L configuration uses a combination of two ER PPC, two ER Flamer and an ATM 12, where both the PPC are equipped with a capacitor. The 'Mech also mounts a supercharger and a Watchdog CEWS. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The first White Raven keeps the same skeleton, engine, and jump capabilities of the Black Python, but is protected by fourteen and a half tons of Ferro-Lamellor armor. The weapons kit has also been updated. Two ER Large Lasers, two Medium Pulse Lasers, four ER Small Lasers, and two AP Gauss Rifles are present; All of these are tied into a Targeting Computer. Sixteen double heat sinks are installed as well. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: The Wraith battle armor was designed by the Rasalhague Dominion to support conventional infantry as well as perform surgical strikes. It is equipped with Basic Stealth armor to hide it from enemy probes, and its jump jets allow it to cover ninety meters in a single jump. The suit was introduced after extensive testing of the Rogue Bear battle armor, and is a direct descendant of that design. Quirk: BA Stealth (C) Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The Xanthos was first introduced by the Capellan Confederation in 2564, designed by a young engineer named Dr. David Harrison. Working for Hollis Inc., he pioneered the technology to create four-legged BattleMechs. This technological advancement that later allowed the research into the Scorpion and Goliath enabled the Xanthos to get on the field. It was presented to the Terran Hegemony for review after the cancellation of the Catapult. Hollis pushed to have this 'Mech presented against Dr. Harrison's wishes in a bid to maintain financial solvency. Clumsy and stiff, the 'Mech failed to win the contract from the Star League purchasing committee.

Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. An evolution of the Zeus -9T, the new ZEU-11S is a mixture of technologies that blurs the Inner Sphere and Clan divide. Using Clan specification extended-range lasers, an extralight engine and LRM-15 launcher built on-site, the -11S seamlessly integrates these onto the frame of the -9T, although mating the Sphere-made Artemis FCS onto the ClanTech launcher did prove to be a challenge. Everything on the -9T was improved, especially armor protection, with the 'Mech's resilience being further bolstered by a compact gyro and CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Aeron attack VTOL (Bombast) was derived from prototypes created by the Word of Blake at the beginning of the Jihad era. These experimental models mounted a new vector thrust propulsion system on a Hawk Moth chassis. The Aeron carries a single Bombast Laser mounted in the nose. This weapon is aimed with the assistance of a battle-grade Targeting Computer. This allows the VTOL to target enemy units quickly and accurately even while moving at high speed. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 12/18 Hex: 360/540 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 15 Left 85 15 Right 85 15 Rear 75 15 Total 375 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: An escort model of the standard Maxim APC, the Maxim Escort trades the troop bay for a heavier weapons load and a Fuel Cell engine. Mimicking the classic Maxim loadout, the Escort has a pair of MML-5's on the front of the vehicle with a third on the rear. A trio of Machine Guns linked together in an array and a Streak SRM-6 are mounted on the turret. Lastly to deter flanking units an SRM-2 Improved Oneshot is mounted on the vehicles flanks. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 125 25 Left 115 25 Right 115 25 Rear 95 25 Turret 100 25 Total 550 125 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Introduced after the Jihad, the Balac Strike VTOL was an extremely fast and versatile VTOL. Introduced in 3090 this version uses a standard Fusion engine. The two ATM-6 launchers remain, but the laser has been replaced by a single Heavy Machine Gun with a half-ton of ammunition. The smaller engine means the Hybrid can only reach a top speed of 150km/h Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 60 15 Right 60 15 Rear 50 15 Total 285 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: The Cavalry Infiltrator uses advanced technology to deploy battle armor into combat at blistering speed. Featuring a Jet booster, Guardian ECM, Stealth Armor and a pair of Magshots in a Chin Turret it's the envy of many Inner Sphere forces. Cal-Boeing however has no plans to sell it outside the Federated Suns. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. content.original: A staple of garrison units everywhere, the Chasseur is a 30 ton Star League era tank that resembles a fat Scorpion; albeit one without the quality control issues that the Scorpion is notorious for. Designed as a ‘‘light’’ Main Battle Tank by General Mechanics, the Chasseur is armed with a mid size Autocannon and an MG. In continuous production for 3 centuries, variants of the Chasseur can be found across the Periphery and the Inner Sphere. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 80 15 Right 80 15 Rear 60 15 Turret 80 15 Total 400 75 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Cizin is a hover tank developed by Clan Nova Cat during the last years of the thirty-first century. Designed to be fast and hard hitting. Most of the Cizin's firepower comes from four ER Medium Lasers found in the tank's turret. A pair of SRM-2 Launchers are mounted in its front. The vehicle would be effectively used during the Clan Nova Cat's uprising and would become accepted to Draconis Combine's own forces after the Clan's demise. LAW would then add additional production facilities for the Cizin on Luthien by 3145. The Cizin is named after the Mayan god of earthquakes and death. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 25 Left 135 25 Right 135 25 Rear 120 25 Turret 115 25 Total 705 125 Quirk: Tacticon TC7000

content.original: The Cizin is a hover tank developed by Clan Nova Cat during the last years of the thirty-first century. A single Streak LRM-15 mounted in the front with sixteen volleys worth of fire. The vehicle would be effectively used during the Clan Nova Cat's uprising and would become accepted to Draconis Combine's own forces after the Clan's demise. content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 25 Left 115 25 Right 115 25 Rear 90 25 Turret 110 25 Total 580 125 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: The Enyo Strike Tank is a combat vehicle produced by Clan Hell's Horses. Following the success of the XL Engine variant of the Mars, Khan Malavai Fletcher ordered his scientist caste to come up with a main battle tank that could take advantage of the speed a lightweight engine could bring. His successor, James Cobb, liked the idea and maintained the mandate for such a proof of concept. The result of the scientists' labor is the Enyo. It can hit speeds up to 97 km/h, which enables it to keep up with many Clan medium 'Mechs. Seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor protect the tank, allowing it to withstand some punishment, though speed is its best defense. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Hardened (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 30 Left 90 30 Right 90 30 Rear 75 30 Turret 90 30 Total 465 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: A light combat vehicle that first saw production in 2692 the Galleon proved to be an economical means of supporting infantry and BattleMechs. With a top speed faster than most 'Mechs, the Galleon was mobile but generally lacked protection, early models carrying only three and a half tons of armor. After the Exodus, these tracked vehicles mostly fell into the possession of the Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League. The Galleon is often paired with the Harasser Missile Platform. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 135 15 Left 125 15 Right 125 15 Rear 100 15 Turret 135 15 Total 620 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

After the Exodus, these tracked vehicles mostly fell into the possession of the Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League. The Galleon is often paired with the Harasser Missile Platform. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 75 15 Left 70 15 Right 70 15 Rear 70 15 Turret 75 15 Total 360 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

content.original: [This version has Standard Arrows] The Hadur Fast Support Vehicle was developed by Clan Hell's Horses and introduced in 3102. Capable of reaching a top speed of 151 km/h, the Hadur can quickly position itself to provide heavy missile artillery support. It performs best when paired with forward scouts like the Asshur scout. The crew is protected by six tons of standard plate armor. The primary weapon of the Hadur is the Class 16 Arrow IV launcher. This massive weapon provides missile artillery support to friendly forces. However, unlike the Naga OmniMech, the Hadur has a single twenty round magazine instead of four smaller five round magazines. This means that switching ammunition types is a problem for Hadur crews. To remedy this, the Horses typically load the magazine with homing Arrow IV rounds. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Armor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 95 25 Total 505 125 Quirk: Improved Sensors

Способный развивать скорость до 151 км/ч, «Хадур» может быстро занять позицию и обеспечить поддержку тяжелой ракетной артиллерией. Экипаж защищен шестью тоннами стандартной пластинчатой брони. Основным оружием является пусковая установка класса 16 Arrow IV. Это массивное орудие обеспечивает ракетно-артиллерийскую поддержку дружественных сил. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. content.original: This non-Omni 3083 version of the Hephaestus Scout Tank is equipped with a pair of ER Medium Lasers, TAG, ECM Suite, and an Active Probe. The standard fusion engine provides a maximum ground speed of nearly 150 km/h while five and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor protects the tank while the hoverskirts have been reinforced with an Armored Motive System. The most interesting feature, however, is the set of eight Jump Jets mounted in the body, which allows this hovertank to cover 240 meters in a single bound. Not since the Kanga has this system been deployed on a combat unit. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 20 Left 120 20 Right 120 20 Rear 95 20 Turret 110 20 Total 565 100 Quirk: Distracting

content.original: An updated iteration of Quikscells infamous Hetzer, the Hetzer (Cell) is every bit as cheap as it's predecessors and every bit as potent. A swap to a 180 rated Fuel Cell improves the Hetzers speed and allows the AC/20 to be upgraded to a UAC/20. A half ton more armour is the only other improvement made by Quikscell. content.original: Ubiquitous across the Inner Sphere, the Igor is a name given to a generic super heavy lift platform. Originally developed to rapidly relocate heavy armour under battlefield conditions, the design has since spawned a host of imitators and copy cats with almost every developed world in the Inner Sphere and the Periphery possessing at least one Igor or Igor derived clone. Developed as a combat mod of the 60 ton VTOL, the Igor (AC/10) mounts a pair of AC/10's with 2 tons of ammo in place of the original cargo bay. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 130 48 Left 115 48 Right 115 48 Rear 90 48 Turret 25 48 Total 475 240 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: A 3099 update of the J.Edgar, produced by Pinard Protectorates; the J Edgar (Streak) is designed to take advantage of new technologies whilst still retaining the low cost of the original model. Retaining the original engine and armour layout, the Streak model uses Heavy Ferro Fibrous to free up enough tonnage to swap the SRM-2's for Streak models; retaining the original munition bay in the process. The Medium Laser is swapped for an ER Model and CASE rounds out the design. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 155 15 Left 100 15 Right 100 15 Rear 60 15 Turret 120 15 Total 535 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: Created by Clan Nova Cat after the success of the Shoden, the Joust was designed to be a well-rounded medium tank. With a wide mix of weapons, the Joust is a versatile design, capable of handling a multitude of roles and missions. Additionally, the Joust has eight tons of ferro-fibrous armor, double that of the similar Ares tank, enhancing the Joust's survivability. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 20 Left 170 20 Right 170 20 Rear 100 20 Turret 170 20 Total 810 100 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - MG

content.original: The Kamakiri mounts three weapon systems mounted in the front of the VTOL - a single Tiegart Particle Projection Cannon and a pair of Telos ThunderShot Thunderbolt 10 Missile Launchers. The Kamakiri Attack VTOL was developed at the end of the thirty-first century by Yan Manufacturing of New Samarkand as a result of their growing success in the military aerospace market. Dubbed as resembling a praying mantis, the Kamakiri was an immediate success; the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery personnel responsible for supervising the first vehicle trial watched for just two minutes before approving the Kamakiri for purchase. Moving as fast as many reconnaissance and strike platforms in service with the DCMS already thanks to the DAV 155 XL extra light engine, the original specification armor installed by Yan was replaced with seven tons of StarGuard Aurora Reflective at the request of the DCMS, who wanted to improve the Kamakari's protection against energy weapons, although the nature of the Reflective Armor didn't offer any additional protection against the flak commonly directed at VTOLs. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 42 Left 140 42 Right 140 42 Rear 100 42 Total 580 210 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Wingmounted

content.original: Possibly designed specifically for the Ryuken, the Shi Kamakiri replaces the weapons loadout of the standard Kamakiri with a single Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle and four tons of ammunition. The Kamakiri Attack VTOL was developed at the end of the thirty-first century by Yan Manufacturing of New Samarkand as a result of their growing success in the military aerospace market. Dubbed as resembling a praying mantis, the Kamakiri was an immediate success; the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery personnel responsible for supervising the first vehicle trial watched for just two minutes before approving the Kamakiri for purchase. Moving as fast as many reconnaissance and strike platforms in service with the DCMS already thanks to the DAV 155 XL extra light engine, the original specification armor installed by Yan was replaced with seven tons of StarGuard Aurora Reflective at the request of the DCMS, who wanted to improve the Kamakari's protection against energy weapons, although the nature of the Reflective Armor didn't offer any additional protection against the flak commonly directed at VTOLs. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 42 Left 140 42 Right 140 42 Rear 100 42 Total 580 210 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Wingmounted

content.original: Combining the role of IFV and Light Tank, the Kamisori is a Republic era Light Tank produced by Pesht Motors. Designed to work in conjunction with Battle Armour whilst bring the fire power of a Galleon the Kamisori is a 20 ton Omni Tank. Powered by a 120 rated fusion core, the Kamisori can reach speeds of 97 kph and is protected by 5.5 tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armour. A 5 ton allocation of pod space in the turret allows for a diverse range of variants. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 10 Left 100 10 Right 100 10 Rear 55 10 Turret 145 10 Total 550 50 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Omni Vehicle

content.original: Capable of scouting, providing ECM cover and calling in artillery support from other units, the Kite Reconnaissance Vehicle was marketed as an all-in-one solution by Clan Sea Fox. The Kite was a successful replacement for the aging Odin, whisper-quiet even when moving, easier to maintain and cheaper to both purchase and operate. The Armored Motive System built into the Kite helped keep the vehicle mobile and functioning. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 135 15 Left 110 15 Right 110 15 Rear 105 15 Turret 100 15 Total 560 75 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: The modern Kruger Combat Car is a scout vehicle reintroduced in the Thirty-second century as an update of the much older original Kruger Combat Car introduced in 2620. The modern Kruger was developed by the Avalon Arms Company on New Avalon and marketed initially to the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns in 3091. Updated to use advanced equipment and technologies, the Kruger is a popular reconnaissance vehicle for scout detachments operating in the spinward Inner Sphere as well as neighboring Periphery nations. Lightly armed, it has a pair of turret mounted ER medium lasers and features a DAV 50 Fusion engine that powers the Kruger to speeds of up to 118 km/h. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 80 5 Left 70 5 Right 70 5 Rear 70 5 Turret 65 5 Total 355 25 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: The Main Gauche Light Support Tank is a fire support companion to Brooks Incorporated's Galleon. Though slower, topping out at only 64 km/h, five tons of armor protect it. The Main Gauche was actually submitted to the Free Worlds League Military because that organization was looking for a tank with long range capability. It finally reached full production in 3064. Based on the XL variant, this version introduced in 3081 is equipped with a four ton infantry compartment. The weapons have been removed and replaced by a forward mounted Plasma Rifle with 2 tons of ammo and two Light Machine Guns. Another Light Machine Gun covers the right and left side of the tank. It also carries some additional armor. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 15 Left 115 15 Right 115 15 Rear 85 15 Total 465 60 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: Developed as a generalist upgrade to the classic Manticore, the Manticore (XL) is an attempt by Defiance Industries to bring in additional revenue. Developed with an eye to licensing thee tank to other manufactures, the XL variant makes modest use of established technology. A 240 rated XL engine and Heavy Ferro Fibrous with added CASE provide a good balance of protection and practicality. The weapons systems are a riff on the classic Manticore with an ER PPC and a Medium Laser paired with a Targeting Computer. A Streak SRM-6 and an Enhanced LRM-10 replace the standard SRM/LRM combo. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 210 30 Left 180 30 Right 180 30 Rear 145 30 Turret 210 30 Total 925 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Nuberu Anti-Aircraft Tank is a post-Jihad design, which was developed jointly by Clan Snow Raven and the Outworlds Alliance in the early 3080s. After the end of the Jihad, pirate activity in the newly expanded Raven Alliance began to increase to the point that the OA's armed forces were no longer able provide adequate air cover for its worlds' ground forces. Based on the Partisan, the Nuberu use advanced technology to provide a greater air-defense capacity to both Clan and Alliance ground forces. Powered by a 180 Rated Fuel Cell engine, the vehicle has a modest 54 kilometer per hour speed, keeping pace with slower combat vehicles. Protecting its hull, Clan Scientists have added 9.5 tons of Clan Laser Reflective Armor. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Glazed (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 150 30 Right 150 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 200 30 Total 850 150 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting
