content.original: The Nuberu Anti-Aircraft Tank is a post-Jihad design, which was developed jointly by Clan Snow Raven and the Outworlds Alliance in the early 3080s. After the end of the Jihad, pirate activity in the newly expanded Raven Alliance began to increase to the point that the OA's armed forces were no longer able provide adequate air cover for its worlds' ground forces. Based on the Partisan, the Nuberu use advanced technology to provide a greater air-defense capacity to both Clan and Alliance ground forces. Powered by a 180 Rated Fuel Cell engine, the vehicle has a modest 54 kilometer per hour speed, keeping pace with slower combat vehicles. Protecting its hull, Clan Scientists have added 9.5 tons of Clan Laser Reflective Armor. Also known as the 'Numantia,' this variant is designed to be a companion to the the standard model. The Nuberu 2's mission is to act as a bodyguard unit for the vulnerable anti-air model. The forward turret has pair of Streak SRM-6 Launchers for short range engagements, while the rear turret features four LRM-15 Launchers for long-range engagements. The vehicle has also been given six Light Machine Guns. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Glazed (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 150 30 Right 150 30 Rear 140 30 Turret 200 30 Total 840 150 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting
content.prevOriginal: The Nuberu Anti-Aircraft Tank is a post-Jihad design, which was developed jointly by Clan Snow Raven and the Outworlds Alliance in the early 3080s. After the end of the Jihad, pirate activity in the newly expanded Raven Alliance began to increase to the point that the OA's armed forces were no longer able provide adequate air cover for its worlds' ground forces. Based on the Partisan, the Nuberu use advanced technology to provide a greater air-defense capacity to both Clan and Alliance ground forces. Powered by a 180 Rated Fuel Cell engine, the vehicle has a modest 54 kilometer per hour speed, keeping pace with slower combat vehicles. Protecting its hull, Clan Scientists have added 9.5 tons of Clan Laser Reflective Armor. Also known as the 'Numantia,' this variant is designed to be a companion to the the standard model. The Nuberu 2's mission is to act as a bodyguard unit for the vulnerable anti-air model. content.original: The Patton tank is a 65-ton armored combat vehicle, specializing in conventional armored warfare. Identical to its twin, the Rommel, in every way but armament and armor configuration, the Patton has primarily served with the Lyran Commonwealth and the Lyran Alliance. It is named after General George S. Patton, Jr., a legendary commander of armored and mechanized forces renowned for his exploits during World War II on Terra. Unlike the Rommel, which features a massive and powerful but short-ranged AC/20 as its main gun, the Patton mounts an AC/10, giving it twice the ammunition capacity and superior firing range while also enabling it to be fitted with more armor. The Patton is capable of fighting in short-ranged and urban environments, but is far more suited than the Rommel to engaging targets at medium to long range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 265 35 Left 250 35 Right 250 35 Rear 230 35 Turret 265 35 Total 1260 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: This version uses Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor to provide protection. The Beagle Probe and Supercharger improve the Tanks utility in scouting roles.. It also uses a Light Engine and replaces the standard weapons with quad MML-3 launchers and as reserve a MXPL is installed. The Pegasus is a popular recon unit, due to its good speed, decent armor, and respectable firepower. It can be found in almost all militaries, having been introduced in the First Succession War and continuously updated ever since. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: First produced in 3093, the Pixiu Heavy Tank is a vehicle produced for the Capellan Confederation's Armed Forces just after the Jihad. It was designed to supplement the Po II, a short-range fighter, provide covering fire at long ranges. The Pixiu owes its reputation to its speed and the stealth it uses to great effect on the battlefield. The tank includes 11 tons of Ceres Heavy Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Schildkröte Line Tank is a Medium sized Combat Vehicle, originally designed for the Lyran Commonwealth's armed forces in 3122. A durable but slow tank, the Schildkröte was not well regarded when it first premiered. Due to this perception of it being too slow for frontline units, the vehicle was distributed among the Commonwealth's lower tier combat formations and planetary militia. However, over time the tank's durability would win over many with its performance in the field. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 245 25 Left 200 25 Right 200 25 Rear 200 25 Turret 160 25 Total 1005 125 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long

content.original: The Skadi is a Fast Attack VTOL. It can reach a top speed of 162 km/h, and is protected by four and a half tons of Clan-spec Ferro-Fibrous Armor. The Skadi was originally designed by Clan Jade Falcon, but the main factory fell to the Lyran Commonwealth. For the next few decades, the Commonwealth sold the Skadi to any interested party. The combination of good protection, high speed, and a heavy gun proved to be very popular, and the Skadi was exported across the Inner Sphere. The Falcons later recaptured the facility and have restricted the Skadi to their own forces. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 125 18 Left 100 18 Right 100 18 Rear 90 18 Turret 15 18 Total 430 90 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: Designed by the Quikscell Company of Pandora, the Skanda Light Tank was a general use light combat vehicle first produced in the Lyran Commonwealth. Introduced in the last decade of the thirty-first century, the vehicle would be sold throughout the Inner Sphere until the Clan Jade Falcon Invasion of the Commonwealth in 3142. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 225 20 Left 160 20 Right 160 20 Rear 100 20 Total 645 80 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long

content.original: The Skulker Wheeled Scout is the much larger cousin of the Swift Wind scout car and originally based on the Heavy APC design. Due to it being larger than any scout car, it can act as a mobile communication outpost. With its advanced sensor suite which is tied to both its communication and targeting systems, it can navigate with only its sensors. While hot environments would normally wreak havoc upon its advanced electronics, the heat sinks from its Medium Laser cool the sensors while the laser is not in use. This allows it to operate in even the hottest environments where other scout vehicles cannot. The Skulker comes with four and a half tons of armor as standard. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 90 10 Left 90 10 Right 90 10 Rear 90 10 Total 360 40 Quirk: Improved Sensors

content.original: The key feature of the Sniper Artillery vehicle is its namesake weapon the forward-mounted Armstrong Industries Sniper Artillery Piece. Two forward-mounted ER Small Lasers and the two turret-mounted Machine Guns are secondary weapons at best. Twelve tons of standard armor give good coverage to most facings, and included CASE mitigates ammunition explosions. The Sniper's capabilities go beyond fire support Quikscell also added Limited Amphibious Equipment. More impressive is the four tons of Communications Equipment allowing it to function as a limited mobile command and control vehicle. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Limited Amphibious Values A S Front 240 40 Left 200 40 Right 200 40 Rear 120 40 Turret 200 40 Total 960 200 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short

content.original: The Sokar was developed by Clan Jade Falcon after the Jihad. The Falcons needed a vehicle to deal with large numbers of unarmed rioters on occupied worlds, and the police subcaste received the Sokar Urban Combat Unit. The Sokar's presence is often enough to dissuade the lower castes from continuing to riot for silly things like food. When it doesn't the Sokar's quartet of AP Gauss Rifles can reduce dozens of civilians to a pile of broken flesh in seconds. Assignment to a Sokar isn't desired, with only solahma units of the Falcon touman receiving it. Warriors dislike it because it is used to 'fight' non-warriors. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 25 Left 110 25 Right 110 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 80 25 Total 495 125 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short

content.original: Developed from concepts devised during the waning years of the Jihad, the SturmFeur (NLRM) rolled off the Defiance Industries production lines in 3083. Aiming to correct the main weaknesses of the classic model, the new model features a larger 340 rated XL Engine with a top speed of 65km/h. The standard LRM-20's are replaced with Enhanced models augmented by Artemis IV, halving the minimum range of the Tank with a Beagle Active Probe boosting short range awareness. CASE and Heavy Ferro Fibrous are added to round out the design. Production of this tank would be abandoned for the new line of ClanTech augmented models. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 350 45 Left 300 45 Right 300 45 Rear 280 45 Turret 300 45 Total 1530 225 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: Built to provide heavy fire support, the Sturmfeur (Support) is a specialised variant mounts an Arrow IV and 5 Thunderbolt-5's with an ER Small Laser for close range defence. A TAG allows the tank to tag targets for allied units. To fit the heavy payload, designers utilised a 255 rated Light Engine and Heavy Ferro Fibrous armour in order to create the needed weight. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 350 45 Left 330 45 Right 330 45 Rear 270 45 Turret 330 45 Total 1610 225 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: Derided by critics and loved by its crews, the 25 ton Venator is a VTOL designed to hunt tanks. Slower then other contemporary VTOL’s, the low cost Venator makes up for it’s slower speed by mounting an AC/10 or a large missile launcher, giving it exceptionally heavy fire power for it’s small size. Produced by a handful of companies in the Periphery, the Venator is a common sight on the battlefields of the Periphery where it is often fielded in large quantities. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 70 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 35 15 Total 220 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. A Dark Age variant developed in 3114, this model is powered by an XXL Fusion Engine. It is armed with two AMS, two Clan-built LRM-15s, and twin TSEMP Cannons. The Targeting Computer remains as well. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 350 35 Left 285 35 Right 285 35 Rear 225 35 Turret 270 35 Total 1415 175 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long

content.content: Боевая машина «Уинстон» была передовой машиной Республики Сферы, производство которой началось в 3085 году. Вариант Темной Эры, разработанный в 3114 году, эта модель оснащена двигателем XXL. Она вооружена двумя AMS, двумя клановыми LRM-15, и двумя пушками TSEMP. Компьютер целеуказания также остался на месте. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Броня: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Структура: Structure Значения Б С Перед 350 35 Лево 285 35 Право 285 35 Зад 225 35 Turret 270 35 Итого 1415 175 Особенность: Улучшенное наведение - Long

content.original: The Amazon battle armor was created by the Magistracy of Canopus. Based on the standard Inner Sphere battle armor, the Amazon uses advanced armor to increase protection and provides a jump capability of 90 meters. This allows Amazon-equipped troops to clear obstacles that would stop other battle armor units. The Amazon is used by both the Magistracy and the Capellan Confederation. Amazons deployed by the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces faced Cavalier battle armor and turned in a better performance. Quirk: Advanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The Apollo is designed to be a long range fire support BattleMech. This is accomplished by mounting an engine on the 'Mech that gives it a top speed of only 64.8 kph and eleven and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech was then armed with massive missile launchers which can rain destruction down on an enemy. While the Apollo has less than average speed for a medium 'Mech, if it is employed correctly the Apollo should have nothing to fear from enemy fire; it is fully capable of staying at the edge of the battlefield and laying down suppressive LRM fire. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: A post-Jihad Lyran Commonwealth take on the Combine's AS7-K introduced in 3082, the K2 model of the Atlas also used a Vlar XL Engine but increased its rating to 400, giving the K2 model a top speed of 64.8 km/h. Retaining only the Gauss Rifle and ER Large Lasers of the AS7-K, the K2 carried two Guided Technologies 2nd Gen Streak SRM-6 launchers. The K2 was protected with sixteen and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and, to protect against advanced enemy electronics, a Guardian ECM Suite. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: This Republic era Atlas is equipped with an ER PPC in each arm, an SRM-6 in the side torsos, and a Rotary AC/5 in the left torso. A Guardian ECM Suite is carried in the center torso. The two tons of SRM ammunition and three tons of RAC/5 ammunition are carried in a CASE protected bay in the right torso. The Atlas K4 is equipped with an extralight engine to allow it to hit a top speed of 64km/h. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The late Republic era AS7-S4 retained the majority of the -S3’s armament, but married it to stealth armor. The 'Mech was mainly kept within the Lyran Commonwealth forces, but some recently produced 'S4s disappeared under strange circumstances, only to reappear in the hands of some Mercenary Outfits attacking the Commonwealth's rivals. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The production version of the BGS-4X, this Barghest uses the Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle, CASE II, and Quad BattleMech Turret of that variant. The PPCs and PPC Capacitors of that version have been removed to make room for an ER Large Laser and ER Medium Laser. The Small Cockpit remains, as does the C3 Slave. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: A specialist design from the Regulan Hussars, this variant replaces the traditional torso- and arm-mounted energy weapons with four Light AC/5s, two in each torso. It retains Small X-Pulse Lasers in the left arm, and a Streak SRM-6 is in the left torso. There is one ton of Streak ammo, but four tons of autocannon ammunition allows the 6C to carry special munitions for particular foes. The most important feature however is the Command Console in the BattleMaster's head. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Built by General Motors, ironically from production lines that originally built its supposed successor, the Warlord, a Hollis Mark X Endo Steel Chassis and GM 340 Light Fusion Engine provide a solid foundation for fifteen and a half tons of armor. Sixteen double heat sinks are fitted, dissipating the heat from a Magna Hellfire Heavy PPC, two Magna Bolt Light PPCs in each side torso, supplemented by a Holly Streak SRM-6 with one ton of ammunition in a CASE II ammo bay. Each side torso carries an Martell ER Small Laser to cover the rear arc, and two Martel-X Small X-Pulse Lasers are in the left arm to act as anti-infantry firepower. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: A mixed-tech brawler, the BLR-6R mounts a Clan-grade Rotary AC/5 in its right arm supported by a left torso–mounted Inner Sphere grade Streak SRM-6 rack, twin Light PPCs in each side torso and pair of rear-facing Improved Heavy Medium Lasers. Carrying three tons of RAC rounds and one ton of Streak reloads in CASE II–protected bays, this loadout is made possible by a Light Fusion Engine. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: This 3085 version uses an experimental XXL engine to boost ground speed to 86 km/h. An Endo Steel skeleton provides enough weight savings to allow this BattleMaster to carry an ER PPC, Heavy PPC, Streak SRM-6, and a pair of ER medium lasers. Sixteen Double Heat Sinks keep the temperature manageable. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The first update to the Chameleon line after the acquirement of the rights by J.B. BattleMechs, the new CLN-8V is the apotheosis of this rebranding. The variant able to serve every role from ab initio and advanced training, to front-line combatant. Combat models retain the heat management software of the original trainer, enabling it to simulate high-heat side effects without the risk, or to prevent the pilot from pushing the heat level past a pre-set limit. Since virtually anyone capable of piloting a 'Mech is familiar with the Chameleon, it is an easy sell to budget-conscious buyers eager to save on familiarization training. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

The goal was to make the 'Mech as durable as possible, even at the cost of reducing the firepower potential. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
Often maligned as one of the worst assault 'Mechs ever produced, the Snow Ravens have elevated the Charger. Upgraded to a fully Clan-spec 'Mech with MASC and a supercharger, the Charger C is able to fulfill the original design intent of a fast assault-class scout with firepower to match. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The latest iteration of the Clint is a sensible upgrade rather than a revolution. It shares many components with the Cadaver. This is a great advantage in the Periphery, where new components are perpetually scarce, especially for a volatile 'Mech like the Clint. The upgrade removed many of its troublesome features, to the joy of technicians. Its weapons array benefited from concurrent developments. This includes X-pulse technology, first used by the Taurians on the Brahma, which had since reached maturity for full-scale production. The new Clint's reflective armor remains a gamble that could possibly undo its other logistical advantages Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: Despite the standard Elemental's all-around utility, Clan Hell's Horses sought to enhance their Elementals mobility. The result of their work, Elemental II, discards Jump Jets and SRM pack in favor of battle armor myomer booster. The design didn't gain popularity and saw no interest from other clans, and Elemental II remains in limited service in Hell's Horses garrisons. Quirk: Elemental Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: After the ultimately failed Elemental II project, the Hell's Horses quest to improve Elementals didn't end. The Elemental III keeps the basic suit relevant for another century, incorporating a one-shot advanced SRM system to extend the suit’s reach and newly developed stealth armor to increase survivability. Quirk: BA Stealth (C) Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
The Eris started life as the prototype 'Hel' from Nasha Diversified, but when it failed to gather interest the design was sold to Kallon Weapon, eventually giving birth to the final design put into mass production. The 2H base variant uses an Endo Steel structure with a 250 XL engine and five jump jets. The weapons loadout consists of a Heavy PPC in the Right Arm, one Streak SRM 6 launcher and two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The 2N variant goes in even deeper for the fast skirmisher and flanker design concept, as it adds a Partial Wing at the cost of removing all external heat sinks. It's weaponry is also change to be more effective at sudden alpha strikes from behind, mounting a Snub-Nose PPC and two MML 5 launchers in combination with three Small X-Pulse lasers. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
The J configuration is a frightful variant that has only recently graced the battlefields of the Inner Sphere during the waning days of the Dark-Age. One of very few mechs to mount the massive HAG-40, the J has to utilize the entire right arm and part of the torso to house the weapon. A four-ton magazine in the right torso feeds the gun, giving it reasonable staying power. Backing up the HAG is an impressive array of three SRM-6 launchers in the left arm. The SRMs utilize a two-ton magazine housed alongside them in the arm. While lacking a true "knock out" weapon the sheer damage potential of this variant is staggering. Problematically, the J houses no backup energy weaponry and must leave the field should it expend all of its ammo. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The L configuration is truly a master of long range. Mounting the same tried and true dual ER Large Lasers of the Prime, the L's true claim to fame is its other armaments. Its left arm houses two Streak LRM-15 Launchers. A CASE II protected magazine holds four tons of ammunition in the left torso. The streak technology and deep ammo bin ensures the L a long life on the battlefield as none of its ammo will be wasted on missed shots. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Лимит приводов рук: Omni

content.original: The Fenrir II Assault Battle Armor may have allegedly originated as the result of a bet between Archon Adam Steiner and Duke Vedet Brewer of Hesperus II, but Duke Brewer's vision of "a monstrous wolf straight from the nightmares of our ancestors" proved to be one of the most popular battle suits on the market after its introduction to service in 3119. Quirk: Advanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.896 Can only mount internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original:
The -M3 is a modification of the -M2 introduced in 3104 that has been optimized for artillery spotting. The 'Mech has removed the three flamers mounted in the left arm, replacing them with a single ER small laser, added a TAG laser designator to the right torso, allowing it to spot for artillery, and MASC, which allows it to move at up to 129.6 km/h. The -M3 also dropped a single double heat sink but added another half ton of armor, giving it a total of seven and a half tons of standard armor. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth G is armed with 4 Improved Heavy Medium Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. A Supercharger pushes the Fire Moth to even faster speeds. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: Based on the original Flamberge BattleMech prototype, the Flamberge 2 is a 70 ton Mech and test bed for the Partial Wing. A 280 rated XL Engine and Endo Steel provide the free weight needed to mount 6 Improved Jump jets and a Partial Wing. 2 SRM-6's and a Large Pulse Laser form the main armament with 4 Medium Pulse Lasers and a Micro Pulse Laser for closer ranges. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
Developed in the later years of the Jihad by the Jade Falcons, the Flamberge was based on an older experiment involving Partial Wing technology. A 70 ton OmniMech, the Flamberge is built around a 280 rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel chassis with 13.5 tons of armour. 11 DHS are installed as standard, as are a pair of SRM-6's with 35 tons of podspace rounding out the design. The Flamberge D is armed with a pair of IS Plasma Rifles and 4 Medium pulse Lasers with 4 Jump Jets boosting the designs mobility and 5 extra DHS offsetting the increased heat load. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Equipped with Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite for protection, the 'Mech carries an ER PPC and two MML-7s. Though the ammo in the side torso is protected by CASE, the ammo in the center torso isn't. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

The G configurations main purpose is to be mobile enough to scout forward locations and still being able to deal with unexpected infantry troops. To achieve this the pod-based loadout includes 5 Micro Pulse Lasers and 4 Medium Pulse Lasers. The addition of a Watchdog CEWS electronics suite ensures the configuration is able to scout enemy forces without being easily detected. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: In 3083, the Nova Cats started refitting some older IICs to test their newly acquired, experimental Streak LRMs. Dubbed the IIC 7, the new variant has a top speed of 118 kph. Right torso LRM 5s are replaced with a single Streak LRM-10 launcher, and a Streak SRM 6 replaces the LRM 5s in the left torso. Each is backed up by an ER medium pulse laser. The IIC 7 uses standard jump jets, but coaxes out 210 meters of jump capacity. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
A mild evolution of the GLT-5M, the -7M boosts the Guillotine’s long-range firepower with a capacitor-boosted ER PPC backed-up by twin light PPCs. A pair of ER medium lasers and an ammo efficient Streak SRM 6 round out the weaponry. Durability is enhanced with CASE II, which reputedly also corrects the intermittent missile arming problems that plagued the original system from its inception Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
Built for speed, firepower, and simplicity, the Gyrfalcon became common in Jade Falcon Stars. Its 275-Rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine would help propel the design into the battlefield at 86 kph and at bursts to 108 kph with the help of its MASC. Included in its construction is a Partial Wing, which gives the design the ability to jump further than the normal 150 meters that its Jump Jets would be capable of. In addition to its regular sensors, the engineers would fit a Light Active Probe in the 'Mech's head to help it identify potential enemy targets.While it has been noted that its MechWarriors have it customized for their purposes, this design's original weapons layout consisted of two Series 6b Extended Range Large Lasers and two Type OVR-V LB 2-X ACs mounted in its shortened arms actuators. In addition to these ranged weapons systems, engineers would go on to reinforce the Gyrfalcon's legs. This is a nod to their touman changing its attitude towards the use of physical attacks, namely using Death from Above maneuver. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
content.prevOriginal:
Built for speed, firepower, and simplicity, the Gyrfalcon became common in Jade Falcon Stars. Its 275-Rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine would help propel the design into the battlefield at 86 kph and at bursts to 108 kph with the help of its MASC. Included in its construction is a Partial Wing, which gives the design the ability to jump further than the normal 150 meters that its Jump Jets would be capable of. In addition to its regular sensors, the engineers would fit a Light Active Probe in the 'Mech's head to help it identify potential enemy targets.While it has been noted that its MechWarriors have it customized for their purposes, this design's original weapons layout consisted of two Series 6b Extended Range Large Lasers and two Type OVR-V LB 2-X ACs mounted in its shortened arms actuators. In addition to these ranged weapons systems, engineers would go on to reinforce the Gyrfalcon's legs. This is a nod to their touman changing its attitude towards the use of physical attacks, namely using Death from Above maneuver. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Hellion is a product of Clan Ice Hellion and their philosophy that espouses speed above all else. Based on the Mist Lynx, the Hellion is a fast OmniMech that has respectable firepower. This light 'Mech is rather difficult to kill, incorporating five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. To save weight, the Hellion also uses an Endo Steel chassis. While it is not especially fast for its size, the Hellion does use MASC to allow for bursts of additional speed. The Hellion sports no fixed weapons on its chassis. The primary configuration consists of four ER Medium Lasers as well as a trio of Streak SRM-2s, which make it a potent headhunter 'Mech. It also packs an LRM-10 to harass enemies at range. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Hel HL-1 does not bring anything more fancy than a Heavy PPC, a single Streak SRM-6 launcher and two ER Medium Lasers, but this also keeps the mech quite reliable and easy to maintain. The Endo Steel structure saves enough weight to also fit a 250 XL engine, making the 'Mech quite mobile. Five jump jets add to the mobility, resulting in the 'Mechs common role of a fast flanker performing hit and run strikes. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The Hermit Crab doesn't make use of many advanced technologies, eschewing an XL Engine or Endo Steel for a standard fusion plant and chassis. In fact the only advanced technology is found in the ten double heat sinks and ER Medium Lasers it carries into combat. Though larger, heavier and less efficient than many similar systems, the reliance on simple, proven technology makes the Hermit Crab popular on Periphery worlds and with military commands. The engine powers it to a top speed of 118km/h and seven jump jets allow it to cover 210 meters. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: The Hippogriff is a Clan Snow Raven design, which was created as part of their need for additional ground troops for their Touman. Made as a companion to the Gorgon, the Hippogriff was designed as a mobile light fire support unit. Considered to be a Heavy ProtoMech, the design is lightly armed for its size. Its only weaponry is a pair of LRM 2 Launchers. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: Designed for the Republic of the Sphere in 3085, this Hunchback is based on the HBK-7X-4. Unlike that unit however, the -7R uses a Standard Cockpit and lacks the Armored Gyro. The Reinforced Structure and CASE II systems remain, as does the Mydron Excel Ultra AC/10 and arm-mounted Diverse Optics Sunfire ER Medium Lasers. Unlike the experimental model, this Hunchback carries ten tons of Light Ferro-Fibrous armor for protection, incorporates TAG in the head, and carries a Guardian ECM Suite to interfere with enemy electronics. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of fire power and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox K is armed with an Improved Heavy Large Laser. An LB-10X provides close range firepower. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Kodiak II's long-range weaponry revolves around pair of arm mounted 20-tubed Long-Range Missile Launchers, backed up by a single 10-tubed LRM launcher found in the left torso. These missile launchers are guided by Artemis IV Fire Control Systems, allowing the 'Mech weapons to deliver its multiple tons of ammunition on target. Backing up the missile launchers is an Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon, found in the right torso. While it does need to close into brawling range to use them, the Kodiak II also has eight Extended Ranged Small Lasers split between the 'Mech's two arm actuators. All the 'Mech's energy weapons are tied into a Targeting Computer found in the center torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original:
Though powerful, the original Kodiak lacked sufficient long range weaponry and did not come close to mounting its full compliment of armor. In 3095, saKhan Ragnar of Clan Ghost Bear tasked the technician caste with developing a variant that would resolves these setbacks. A first prototype of the new version designated V1 sported two LRM-20 and one LRM-10 launchers, an ER PPC and replaces the eight Medium Lasers with ER Small Lasers. This version also adds jump jets to the design, allowing the 'Mech to jump over 90 meters. The core concept behind this design is what eventually evolved into the Kodiak II. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Bearing the distinction of being the second Mech to be created by the Capellan Confederation, the Koschei began production in 2504 though production would cease during the Succession Wars; with production restarting during the Jihad. A 65 ton Mech, the Koschei 6L is powered by a 325 rated Light Fusion Engine giving it a top speed of 86km/h. A Sniper Canon with 2 tons of ammo is the Mechs main gun with 4 Medium Lasers as backup weapons. A Targeting Computer enhances the accuracy of the Lasers while Triple Strength Myomer boosts the Mechs speed. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

content.original: Designed by the Marian Hegemony using the most cutting-edge gear available to them, the Marauder Battle Armor is patterned after the venerable Marauder BattleMech. Armed with a pair of Support PPCs and a Light Recoilless Rifle, the Marauder BA is one of the most heavily armed BA in existence. The Marians deploy them in squads of five called a contubernium and the suits are designed for that kind of larger deployment. While not particularly well armored, their extreme firepower load for battle armor makes them deadly on the field. Quirk: Marauder Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.895 Can mount any unit, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original:
Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolfs Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 300 rated Light Engine, the Marauder II MAD-6S is armed with a Gauss Rifle, paired ER PPC’s and Medium Pulse Lasers. AMS and an ER Small Laser round out the design. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The MCY-105 Mercury is a redesign that avoids the notorious Myomer Acceleration Signal Circuitry-lock that has long hindered the scout. It uses a higher-rated XL engine to turn the 'Mech into a fast raider. The redesign was otherwise conservative due to its speed, favoring off-the-shelf weapons instead of pursuing a modern 'Omni-Mercury' upgrade. While not an OmniMech, the MCY-105 remains easy to repair and modify, leading to countless field refits by Republican troops often involving assorted electronics in lieu of its mix of ER lasers Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.original:
Designed as a close range brawler, the Merlin 1M is marketed to smaller periphery states and mercenary commands in the market for a cut price heavy mech. Replacing the traditional PPC with an AC/10 and removing the anti-personnel weapons, allows for an extra pair of Medium Lasers to be added.With a third less heatsinks than the usual Merlin designs, pilots will need to be careful with their heat or risk a premature ammo explosion. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. A 25 ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175 rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx I is armed with a Narc Beacon and 5 SRM-2’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. A 25 ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175 rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx L is armed with a Heavy Flamer, an Improved Heavy Medium Laser and a trio of AP Gauss Rifles. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
This version introduced in 3083 was based on the earlier ON3-MX, although it addresses some of the shortcomings of that 'Mech and shares many of the same features as the ON1-M. Providing a more balanced weapon suite it still carries an Extended LRM-15 with four tons of ammo and an ER medium laser in each arm but instead uses a Grand Slam Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo in the right torso. It also uses CASE II to protect the ammunition and has a head-mounted TAG system to call in artillery. Initial feedback and advanced orders convinced Kali Yama to switch most of their Orion production lines over to making the ON3-M in 3086, but were soon set back a few years later when pressure from the Republic of the Sphere caused the Federated Suns to cancel their order. The company has seen sold the 'Mech at below-market prices and suffered financial hardship. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The -8P is based on the experimental -8X. The major differences are the removal of the stealth armor and the head turret. This reduces production cost considerably, but leaves the head-mounted PPC unable to cover the Quickdraw's retreat. The other advanced systems, including the torso cockpit, remain. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
In the 3120s, Independence Weaponry secretly built the Raijin -301-B. This variant kept much of the original RJN-200-A, but altered the armor and weapons to serve its future role in Malcolm Buhl's reconstituted Com Guard. They adapted and improved the older Tessen's endo-steel frame. For firepower, Independence kept the -101-C's triple-mount of ER medium lasers, while two SRM-6 launchers and an iNarc were added. CASE II protected these systems. This effort turned Buhl's Raijins into well-protected artillery spotters and scouts. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Designed by the Marian Hegemony using the most cutting-edge gear available to them, the Ravager is made with the best technology available to the Hegemony. The Marian Hegemony soon began marketing the suit for sale to the open market to help bolster the Hegemony's coffers. The Marians deploy them in squads of five called a contubernium and the suits are designed for that kind of larger deployment. While not particularly well armed, the Ravager has extensive armor coverage, making them extremely durable on the battlefield. Quirk: Advanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9 Can only mount internal bays, can melee, can not swarm.

content.original: A very mobile design thanks to its 250-Rated extra-light fusion engine and the use of a TSM in its construction. A number of weapons are mounted in its turret, including a heavy PPC, light PPC, and one of the 'Mech's two ER medium lasers. Its other ER medium laser is installed in the 'Mech's center torso, with the Beagle Active Probe, and a ER small laser is mounted in its head. To take advantage of the 'Mech's TSM, each leg actuator is fitted with spikes Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: This configuration of the Sarath is configured for a fire support role. Using Clan Sea Fox as its supplier for some its weapons, the 'Mech boasts two Clan 15-tubed long-range missile launchers and two multi-missile launchers found in the turret. The 'Mech's ammunition is stored mostly in the 'Mech's four legs. Enhanced mobility is achieved by fitting it with five jump jets. The configuration's only energy weapon, aside from its fixed laser, is a Clan version ER small laser mounted in the center torso. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: Designed for close assault, the Sarath B, features a single plasma rifle, two medium lasers, and four ER flamers fitted into its turret. For use in melee combat, four Clan produced talons are mounted, one in each of the 'Mech's feet. When combined with the TSM, the talons allow the Sarath-B to demonstrate its physical prowess. The plasma rifle is allotted two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Особенность: Адаптивный Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.892 Can only mount internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original:
Unlike many Lyran BattleMechs, the SPR-6F was directly commissioned by the LCAF. The Spector had performed admirably as a headhunter since its reintroduction in the mid-3050s, but variants' stealth systems were often inadequate against sharpshooters in the Jade Falcon or Wolf toumans. Tailor-made to beat Clan warriors at their own game, the -6F does so not through subterfuge but through sheer engineering. It can keep up with the nimblest of 'Mechs, reflective armor defeats advanced Clan lasers, and a targeting computer unerringly places its weapons on target. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: A post-Jihad variant developed by the Combine in 3084, the SDR-8K uses a Compact Gyro and a 240 XL Fusion Engine to maintain its ground speed while allowing it to carry four tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the extra weight left being used to swap the lasers of the stock Spider for a single torso mounted PPC Capacitor-enhanced Snub-Nose PPC. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
content.prevOriginal: A post-Jihad variant developed by the Combine in 3084, the SDR-8K uses a Compact Gyro and a 240 XL Fusion Engine to maintain its ground speed while allowing it to carry four tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the extra weight left being used to swap the lasers of the stock Spider for a single torso mounted PPC Capacitor-enhanced Snub-Nose PPC. content.original: A post-Jihad variant produced by Krupp Armament Works for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084, the production model 8R was based on the prototype SDR-8X that used during the liberation of Terra. Built on an Endo Steel chassis and powered by a smaller 210 Light Fusion Engine - while its ground speed was reduced, the SDR-8R's ten Pitban LFT-20X Improved Jump Jets gave it amazing maneuverability. Carrying ten double heat sinks allowed the 8R to fire its twin Diverse Optics ER Medium Lasers and jump without fear of overheating. Boasting a very different look, the redesigned 8R was also notable for being one of the first Spiders to include an ejection system. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: This version of the Spider was a field refit of the 8X. The medium pulse lasers are removed and replaced by five ER Small Lasers. For close-in combat, this Spider carries a Sword. It retains the Partial Wing. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Spider -9M was not a grand evolution of the chassis. Instead, it derived directly from preceding variants. Unwilling to gamble on reverse-engineered Clan weaponry, the -9M replaces the prior pulse laser loadouts with variable speed medium lasers. While Nimakachi touts the -9M's 'greatly increased' short-range firepower as the basis for its high sales, customers indicate that demand for the model is only due to the desperation of the mid-thirty-second century. Industry watchers have been critical partly due to the absence of the promised ejection seat, but primarily because the -9M's weaponry doubles in mass for no significant increase in range. The new Spider could be outperformed by units with lighter weapon arrays. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The Stalking Spider II features most notably a heavy large laser along with a pair of SRM-4 launchers. Due to a design flaw, the ammunition feed for the SRM launchers occasionally explodes from the ammunition feed into the turret. Rounding out its weaponry, the 'Quad features a pair of heavy machine guns mounted in the left torso. The Stalking Spider II is protected by 9.5 tons of standard armor, which includes its built-in CASE that minimizes damage from ammunition explosions. With its 225-rated standard fusion engine, the Spider is able to move at a maximum speed of 86 km/h. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
A 55 ton OmniMech that blends a lethal cocktail of speed and firepower, the Stormcrow is a common sight in many clan Toumans. Powered by a 330 rated XL Engine and built with a combination of an Endo Steel chassis and Ferro Fibrous armor, the Stormcrow has 19 tons of pod space available. The Stormcrow J is armed with a HAG/30 and an Improved Heavy Large Laser. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Originally rumored to be a light or ultralight LAM, the Svartalfa was a well-kept secret until its live-fire test against Clan Wolf where it saw great success. At first confusing the Wolves as to what it was -- too small to be a 'Mech, too large to be a Proto or battle armor -- the defending Wolf warriors were forced into deploying medium and heavy 'Mechs to deal with even a single Svartalfa. Quirk: UltraHeavy WiGE ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The original variant of the Tarantula is armored with four and a half tons of armor, while it only carries about three quarters of the theoretical maximum armor, the 'Mech's amazing speed makes the Tarantula capable of avoiding most damage. As the design is focused on scouting, the Tarantula carries a light armament that is common to a 'Mech of its size and role. The primary weapons are a pair of medium lasers which give the Tarantula most of its striking power. These are backed up by a Streak SRM-2 launcher, which allows the Tarantula to find any weak spots in an enemy's armor. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
The Templar III is a Dark Age era Assault Class OmniMech, first produced by General Motors for the Federated Suns. It was intended as a replacement for the original Templar, whose factory lines were destroyed during the Jihad. General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Fast and well-armed for its weight, the Tiburon can be used in scout and attack formations alike. Mounting a pair of ER medium lasers in each arm, and backed up by two SRM-2 launchers and twin ER small lasers, the Tiburon can quickly close with an enemy and inflict damage before moving out of range again. Making matters worse for its opponents, the Tiburon carries a Watchdog CEWS to not only interfere with their electronics, but also assist in finding them from farther distances, and the lasers are all connected to an accurate targeting computer. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original:
A brutal short-ranged combatant, the Timber Wolf W mounts a mammoth Ultra AC/20 in the right torso, supported by a Streak SRM-6 rack in each side torso, a ER Small Laser in the left torso, and twin ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. Carrying four tons of UAC rounds and single ton of missiles for the ammo efficient Streak launchers, a Supercharger allows the W config to close within optimum range as quickly as possible. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Tomahawk II is designed around the use of a DSAM Endo 10-Composite internal structure, which gives the design its cavernous pod capacity of 56 tons. The 'Mech is powered by a 300-Rated Starfire Extra-Light Fusion Engine, giving it a maximum speed of 54 kph. Protecting the engine and the Tomahawk II's other vitals is 19 tons of Advanced/3 standard armor, providing nearly maximum protection against enemy fire. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The TR-XB is protected by 16 tons of Durallex Heavy Armor, with CASE embedded into its right torso. The 'Mech uses a XL 285 rated Fusion Engine as its source of power, to aid the 'Mech's ability to cope with a lack of rear-facing weapons and a modest top speed, the design was also given five Improved Jump Jets. The Trebaruna was designed to fight its opponents at long ranges, with its main weapon being its right torso-mounted Gauss Rifle, with 2 tons of ammunition, and supported by three Light PPC found in the opposite torso. These weapons are guided by a Targeting Computer located in the 'Mech's left torso. The Trebaruna is fitted with ten double heat sinks to help cope with its weapon and engine heat. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: Introduced during the later stages of the Republic in 3115, this Trebaruna's Composite Skeleton is protected by Hardened Armor. This variant's maximum jump range is reduced to 120 meters. It carries an Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle as its main armament, supported by an ER PPC. The PPC is mounted in a Quad Turret to provide a wide field of fire. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: Produced by the Free Worlds League splinter nation, the Marik-Stewart Commonwealth 3081, the XJ variant differed from the original XB mostly in secondary weapons and targeting equipment. Its Targeting Computer was removed and the Light PPCs were replaced by a pair of Snub-Nose PPCs. In addition, the 'Mech's armor coverage and Double Heat Sink quantity were increased. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: This variant is produced by the Capellan Confederation in 3081, whose soldiers had discovered the Blakist design during their liberation efforts in the later part of the Jihad. The variant replaced the Gauss Rifle with an LB 20-X Class Autocannon, and the Light PPCs were changed out for a pair of Plasma Rifles. The 'Mech's ammunition is protected by CASE in the left torso, while the design's armor has been increased to 17.5 tons. To allow for the additional armor and new equipment, the standard Fusion Engine was exchanged for a Light Fusion Engine. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

A Davion Mech, the Valkyrie VLK-QD6 is powered by a 150 rated XL Engine and equipped with 5 Jump Jets. An Extended Range LRM-10 is the Mechs main weapon, with an ER Medium Laser for close range combat. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
Introduced in 2940, the Viper is a 40 ton OmniMech that emphasizes speed and armour, with only 8.5 tons of podspace available for weapons. A 320 rated XL Engine powers the Viper and 8 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis, further improving the mobility. The Viper R is armed with a pair of ER Medium Lasers and a Narc Beacon. A Light TAG and a Bloodhound Active Probe improve the Scouting capabilities of the Viper. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Fusion Core, the Warhammer WHM-8R is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers, Machine Guns and a Streak SRM-6 deter opponents from closing in. CASE II rounds out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The first White Raven keeps the same skeleton, engine, and jump capabilities of the Black Python, but is protected by fourteen and a half tons of Ferro-Lamellor armor. The weapons kit has also been updated. Two ER Large Lasers, two Medium Pulse Lasers, four ER Small Lasers, and two AP Gauss Rifles are present; All of these are tied into a Targeting Computer. Sixteen double heat sinks are installed as well. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: The Wraith battle armor was designed by the Rasalhague Dominion to support conventional infantry as well as perform surgical strikes. It is equipped with Basic Stealth armor to hide it from enemy probes, and its jump jets allow it to cover ninety meters in a single jump. The suit was introduced after extensive testing of the Rogue Bear battle armor, and is a direct descendant of that design. Quirk: BA Stealth (C) Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. An evolution of the Zeus -9T, the new ZEU-11S is a mixture of technologies that blurs the Inner Sphere and Clan divide. Using Clan specification extended-range lasers, an extralight engine and LRM-15 launcher built on-site, the -11S seamlessly integrates these onto the frame of the -9T, although mating the Sphere-made Artemis FCS onto the ClanTech launcher did prove to be a challenge. Everything on the -9T was improved, especially armor protection, with the 'Mech's resilience being further bolstered by a compact gyro and CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: This version of the Atlas was created by Preceptor Anton Jurn of the Outworlds Alliance. The traditional weaponry has been completely removed from an AS7-K chassis. The Atlas was then equipped with a Hypervelocity AC/10 and Snub Nose PPC in the right torso, while a Thunderbolt 15 launcher occupies the left torso and each arm carries a Light PPC. The ammunition for the AC and Thunderbolt are in a CASE II protected bay in the left torso. Jurn's refit also features a Cockpit Command Console that has been armored. To provide more intelligence to the commander, a Beagle Active Probe is mounted in the center torso, and each leg carries a Remote Sensor Dispenser system. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

content.original:
A one of a kind Rattlesnake developed by Headhunter Stables of Solaris 7; the Rattlesnake JR7-31R was piloted by Gideon Wozniak during his arena fight with the wanted war criminal and ex ROM agent, Victor Reskov. Built from a Rattlesnake JR7-37, the 37R model upgrades the Mech with Clan made Ferro Fibrous armour and MASC. 2 Clan ER Medium Lasers, 3 Medium Lasers and a Clan ER Small Laser form the Mechs armament; with Angel ECM and a Clan made Targeting Computer enhancing the Mechs effectiveness. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Tiburon is a name that hearkens back to when Clan Sea Fox was known as Clan Diamond Shark. The Tiburon is named after a large Terran shark found in the Caribbean, the design was created as the Clan transformed itself from a decimated-yet-centralized military force to a nomadic, spacefaring society of warrior-merchants. The Tiburon is just as lethal as its namesake and unlike most other 'Mechs built by the Sea Foxes, the Tiburon is not for sale and is used exclusively by its own warriors.

To provide more intelligence to the commander, a Beagle Active Probe is mounted in the center torso, and each leg carries a Remote Sensor Dispenser system. Особенность: Боевые кулаки Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.23

content.original:
A one of a kind Rattlesnake developed by Headhunter Stables of Solaris 7; the Rattlesnake JR7-31R was piloted by Gideon Wozniak during his arena fight with the wanted war criminal and ex ROM agent, Victor Reskov. Built from a Rattlesnake JR7-37, the 37R model upgrades the Mech with Clan made Ferro Fibrous armour and MASC. 2 Clan ER Medium Lasers, 3 Medium Lasers and a Clan ER Small Laser form the Mechs armament; with Angel ECM and a Clan made Targeting Computer enhancing the Mechs effectiveness. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: A Dark Age variant of the classic Cab, the Crab 54 mounts a massive 350 rated Fusion Core and a Supercharger, giving it the speed of a much lighter mech. A Composite Structure and Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor provide the needed weight and allow for a pair of Plasma Rifles to be mounted. An ER Medium Laser and an ER Small serve as secondary weapons if the Crab runs out of ammo. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: An experimental Republic era version of an updated -3F, using all Clan-based technology. The combination of an Ultra-light Gyro, XXL engine and both Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel chassis allows the mounting of two Gauss Rifles and 4 tons of ammunition. Due to the sheer weight of these weapons, the only other equipment is a single head-mounted ER Micro Laser to help dealing with infantry. The 'Mech however loses it characteristic Jump Jets and has to rely solely on its 225 rated engine core to get in melee range for the Hatchet. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
Developed for The Republic of the Sphere after the Capellan Crusades, this Hatchetman uses a Light Engine to develop a maximum ground speed of 85 km/h. It also has a jump range of 150 meters and is protected by eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor. Twelve double heat sinks are also installed, which dissipates the extreme heat from the single Medium X-Pulse Laser and six standard Medium Lasers mounted in the right arm. The left arm has the trademark hatchet. What makes this version so deadly is the fact that each arm has an Actuator Enhancement System, which improves targeting. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: Developed during the Jihad in 3084, this Hatchetman variant has an expanded role beyond urban combat. By using a larger Light Engine, designers increased the 'Mech's cruising speed by 25% and added another jump jet to increase the jump range by 25%. The biggest change is in the 'Mech's armament. The traditional autocannon is replaced by a single MML-9 and three tons of ammunition. A Guardian ECM Suite disrupts enemy electronics while ferro-fibrous armor and CASE protect the 'Mech from weapons fire and an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
The Mortis was designed by the branches of StarCorps Industries in the Capellan Confederation and the Free Worlds League. A fast heavy 'Mech, the Mortis has thirteen tons of armor, a jump radius of 150 meters, and a top speed of 86km/h. The Mortis places its main weaponry in the arms. The five ton Hatchet carried in the right arm is excellent for delivering a crushing blow in physical combat, while the Heavy PPC in the left arm is useful for punching holes in an opponent's armor. To harass enemy forces while closing to the short range preferred by Mortis pilots, the right torso carries a single MML-5 with a two ton magazine. To provide a little more firepower, the center torso boasts a Rocket Launcher 10. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The Mortis was designed by the branches of StarCorps Industries in the Capellan Confederation and the Free Worlds League. A fast heavy 'Mech, the Mortis has thirteen tons of armor, a jump radius of 150 meters, and a top speed of 86km/h. This variant is exclusively used by the CCAF. The Heavy PPC, MML-5, and one heat sink are removed. In their place is a Large Variable Speed Pulse Laser in the right arm and a TSEMP cannon in the torso. Armor protection, movement profile, and the rest of the equipment are unchanged from the MS-1A. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

The 'Mech however loses it characteristic Jump Jets and has to rely solely on its 225 rated engine core to get in melee range for the Hatchet. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09
content.content: An experimental Republic era version of an updated -3F, using all Clan-based technology. The combination of an Ultra-light Gyro, XXL engine and both Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel chassis allows the mounting of two Gauss Rifles and 4 tons of ammunition. Due to the sheer weight of these weapons, the only other equipment is a single head-mounted ER Micro Laser to help dealing with infantry. The 'Mech however loses it characteristic Jump Jets and has to rely solely on its 225 rated engine core to get in melee range for the Hatchet. Особенность: Приводы для рукопашной Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.09

content.original: Produced from ex-Lyran trophies by the FWLM after early stages of the Jihad, this version of the 5S variant has medium pulse lasers and the trademark hatchet and adds a Beagle Active Probe. The main firepower for this variant comes from a Heavy PPC housed in the right torso. The 5S' CASE system has been omitted. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
Developed for The Republic of the Sphere after the Capellan Crusades, this Hatchetman uses a Light Engine to develop a maximum ground speed of 85 km/h. It also has a jump range of 150 meters and is protected by eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor. Twelve double heat sinks are also installed, which dissipates the extreme heat from the single Medium X-Pulse Laser and six standard Medium Lasers mounted in the right arm. The left arm has the trademark hatchet. What makes this version so deadly is the fact that each arm has an Actuator Enhancement System, which improves targeting. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: Developed during the Jihad in 3084, this Hatchetman variant has an expanded role beyond urban combat. By using a larger Light Engine, designers increased the 'Mech's cruising speed by 25% and added another jump jet to increase the jump range by 25%. The biggest change is in the 'Mech's armament. The traditional autocannon is replaced by a single MML-9 and three tons of ammunition. A Guardian ECM Suite disrupts enemy electronics while ferro-fibrous armor and CASE protect the 'Mech from weapons fire and an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03
content.prevOriginal: Developed during the Jihad in 3084, this Hatchetman variant has an expanded role beyond urban combat. content.original:
The Mortis was designed by the branches of StarCorps Industries in the Capellan Confederation and the Free Worlds League. A fast heavy 'Mech, the Mortis has thirteen tons of armor, a jump radius of 150 meters, and a top speed of 86km/h. The Mortis places its main weaponry in the arms. The five ton Hatchet carried in the right arm is excellent for delivering a crushing blow in physical combat, while the Heavy PPC in the left arm is useful for punching holes in an opponent's armor. To harass enemy forces while closing to the short range preferred by Mortis pilots, the right torso carries a single MML-5 with a two ton magazine. To provide a little more firepower, the center torso boasts a Rocket Launcher 10. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The Mortis was designed by the branches of StarCorps Industries in the Capellan Confederation and the Free Worlds League. A fast heavy 'Mech, the Mortis has thirteen tons of armor, a jump radius of 150 meters, and a top speed of 86km/h. This variant is exclusively used by the CCAF. The Heavy PPC, MML-5, and one heat sink are removed. In their place is a Large Variable Speed Pulse Laser in the right arm and a TSEMP cannon in the torso. Armor protection, movement profile, and the rest of the equipment are unchanged from the MS-1A. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
Collapsing Vulcan sales led to deliberations on whether to focus entirely on increased Firestarter production, until representatives from Coventry took the unusual initiative of reaching out to Nimakachi executives. A technological summit, attended by engineers from both corporations, resulted in the development of a new, relatively simple Vulcan that combined the strengths of prior variants. Armed with the incendiary payload of the Coventry models and the durability, heat dissipation, and accuracy of the Nimakachi builds, the new -7T hit markets running. Now a top seller once more, the Vulcan is the deadliest it has ever been in urban environments. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Javelin is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage, especially against other light mechs and some mediums. The JVN-10N also makes a decent light 'Mech hunter-killer.
content.prevOriginal: The Javelin is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage, especially against other light mechs and some mediums. The JVN-10N also makes a decent light 'Mech hunter-killer.
content.content: The Javelin is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage, especially against other light mechs and some mediums. The JVN-10N also makes a decent light 'Mech hunter-killer.

content.original: Jalastar Aerospace's newest Javelin variant returns to the classic set-up, upgraded with everything the modern day has to offer. Clan-spec missile racks provide the Javelin's bite, while a locally made 240 XL engine, shared with the Cuirass, delivers additional speed. Jump jets take full advantage of the extra power, delivering leaps of nearly a quarter-kilometer. Finally, head-mounted TAG provides an 'ace in the hole' when supported by artillery or homing missiles. The AFFS is assigning the new Javelins to recon lances containing similarly speedy Stingers and Wasps. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Finally, head-mounted TAG provides an 'ace in the hole' when supported by artillery or homing missiles. The AFFS is assigning the new Javelins to recon lances containing similarly speedy Stingers and Wasps. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
content.content: Jalastar Aerospace's newest Javelin variant returns to the classic set-up, upgraded with everything the modern day has to offer. Clan-spec missile racks provide the Javelin's bite, while a locally made 240 XL engine, shared with the Cuirass, delivers additional speed. Jump jets take full advantage of the extra power, delivering leaps of nearly a quarter-kilometer. Finally, head-mounted TAG provides an 'ace in the hole' when supported by artillery or homing missiles. The AFFS is assigning the new Javelins to recon lances containing similarly speedy Stingers and Wasps. Особенность: Прост в обслуживании Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

content.original: The Angerona Scout Suit was developed by StarCorp Industries on Terra. The suit was designed for the needs of the newly formed Republic of the Sphere's Armed Forces, with the lessons learned from Stone's Coalition during the Jihad in mind. It utilizes its stealth capacities and quick movement to scout ahead of friendly forces without being detected. Quirk: Void Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The first real redesign of the Viper for three centuries, the VP-7 replaces the Pulse Lasers of the original VP-1 with three ER Medium Lasers. The switch to Composite internal structure as a result allowed adding both an advanced Targeting Computer and an Active Probe. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Almost 300 years after its original creation, the Viper was reborn in the Republic era. But not because of demand for a forgotten unit, but because a stockpile of blazers was discovered in a Kallon warehouse in 3123. Kallon engineers were then developing a new 'Mech for the RAF. They, like their predecessors, realized that the Viper was ideal for the surplus weapons. Viper schematics survived in their database, and existing Crusader tooling could be readily adapted.
